Xel-Há es un paraíso... Si te gusta tener contacto con la naturaleza es uno de los lugares que no puede faltar en tu visita a la Riviera Maya... Es inexplicable la experiencia en ese lugar, hacer snorkel en el río, ver los peces, la místico de los cenotes, nadar en sus aguas tan cristalinas, wow! Volvería mil veces si pudiera $$$...
Lugar maravilloso !!! Simplemente un paraíso, comida deliciosa

Großer Wasserfreizeitpark mit unzähligen Möglichkeiten. Relativ großes Komplettangebot mit Vollverpflegung. Zusätzlich angebotene Leistungen z.B. Schwimmen mit Delfinen ( 1 Erw + 2 Kinder 30 min ca 200$. Fotos dürfen dabei nicht gemacht werden, diese werden gemacht und am Ende teuer - ab 160$ ! - verkauft). Sämtliche Fotos, die gemacht werden sehr sehr teuer. Wie gesagt dafür aber ein großes Inklusivangebot. AUf dem Bild ist der Rutschenturm zu sehen. Unbedingt viel Zeit nehmen.
Great for family with kids

El parque excelente, precioso, gran lugar, gran comida, muy buen servicio de las personas.
Lo único que no les recomiendo es que compren el servicio de transportación privado. Fueron muy poco tolerantes al regreso. Yo contraté el servicio de transporte, y nos citan media hora antes que cierran el parque, es decir a las 5.30 pm, lo que no te permite disfrutar el parque hasta que cierran. Llegamos a las 6.15 pm y nos había dejado el autobús que ya habíamos pagado. Considero MUY POCA TOLERANCIA para venir desde lejos.  ¿ Cuál es la prisa de salir tan rápido ? La gran experiencia que habíamos tenido durante el día concluyó con ese MAL SABOR DE BOCA. 

Visiten el parque, pero no contraten el servicio de transporte con ellos

Saludos !

Посетили парк 30.01.2018 и остались в восторге! Конечно, перечитали кучу комментариев, многие были неоднозначными и даже негативными. Итак, по порядку:
1)Организация парка-вам выдают карту на которой пронумерованы и обозначены в картинках все локации. На территории расположено много больших карт с указанием местоположения сейчас(все цветное, со стрелками, т.е. так что ЛЮБОМУ будет понятно), дорожки обозначены разными цветами, каждый объект пронумерован в соответствии с картой. Персонал всегда объясняет понятно (на английском) куда вам нужно идти, чтобы попасть в тот или иной пункт. Если на входе вам будут предлагать одну кабинку на двоих-не соглашайтесь! Они маленькие, берите две.
2)Не планировали, но все же посетили пункт первой помощи. Там круче, чем в некоторых больницах в россии😂🤦🏻‍♀️
3)Ресторанов много, большая часть на побережье, несколько в глубине парка. Все вкусно.
4)Много разных шоу, все очень зрелищно, а вечернее шоу настолько впечатлило, что нет слов. Оставайтесь на него обязательно! Гид сказал, что на вечернее гоу нужно зарезервировать стол за деньги, чтобы спокойно сесть и все видеть-не ведитесь, это развод. Платные места находятся слишком низко и близко к сцене, все картинки с них не видно, пустая трата денег. 
5)Пока добираешься до какого-то места обязательно увидишь что-то красивое/необычное. Животных не очень много, но есть очень необычные(видели ламантинов). Птичник потрясающей красоты! Много попугаев сидят по всей территории парка. 
6)Есть смотровая площадка, в ней несколько укачивает. Вид с неё открывается красивый на бесконечные джунгли.
7)При сплаве по подводной реке ласты надевайте обязательно-дно очень каменистое. 

В общем-парк к посещению обязателен!

Käytiin Xcaretissa mieheni kanssa. Maksettiin reissusta n. 130e per naama. Ajateltiin, että hintaan kuuluu paljon tekemistä, kun on niin kallis. Kuitenkin tähän hintaan kuuluivat vain perusaktiviteetit joiden parissa puistossa kului n. 3h ajan. Ja itselläni oli ison osan ajasta todella tylsää.
Itseäni surettivat eläimet, esim osa linnuista ei päässyt lainkaan lentämään. Puisto tarjosi lisämaksusta uintia myös delfiinien kanssa ja tätä en voi ymmärtää.
Iso osa eläimistä vain makasi. Toki, päiväkin oli lämmin.

Ruoka on kallista ja hintaan nähden heikkoa. Esim susheja ei säilytetty edes kylmässä. Mainittakoon, että en uskaltanut niitä syödä. Olut oli kallista ja tarjoilijat muistivat mainita että tippi ei kuulu hintaan. Yksi tarjoilija ei tuonut vaihtorahoja takaisin vain piti ne tippinä kysymättä.
Lähdimme ennen iltashowta sillä aika ei olisi kulunut siihen asti.
En suosittele, nyt jos voisin päättää niin laittaisin rahani johonkin muualle.
Ein schöner Park mit viel Aktivitäten und Tieren inmitten einer Dschungellandschaft. Für Kinder bestimmt toll. Für uns als Paar schön durch zu laufen, aber dafür doch ein bisschen teuer.

В парк лучше ехать после 11часов-не так много народу.Мы ездили сами-без экскурсии.Билеты купили в кассе,зашли,везде походили,поплавали в подземной речке(полотенце брали с собой).Можно перекусить в кафе(рекомендую Лагуна).Парк очень большой-лучше взять план-карту,(при входе в парк)а то можно запутаться.Много разных магазинчиков с сувенирами ,игрушками и.т.д.В парке есть и животгые,и птицы с бабочками.Вечером начинаются разные представления(около 6часов).Такси прямо у входа в парк без проблем.

Постараюсь поменьше эмоций - место нам в целом очень понравилось - и побольше практических советов. Шкарет - развлечение на целый день, и к некоторым моментам нужно подготовиться заранее.
Нас было трое - двое взрослых и ребёнок 13 лет (для него цена как для взрослого).
Цены, которые представлены на сайте Шкарета (аналогично - со многими другими мексиканскими развлечениями) - это цены не входных билетов, это турпакеты с развозкой от-до отелей. 
Мы решили вместо турпакета доехать туда и обратно на маршрутке-"колективо" (от нашего отеля получилось по 40 песо на человека) и купить билеты на входе. 
Я не поленился, написал в техподдержку сайта, и получил уже более реальные цены (за вход). Первый раз пытался общаться по-английски - агент конкретно "завис", я начал новый чат по-испански и в этот раз получил нужную информацию. К моему удивлению, цены в долларах оказались выгоднее, чем в песо.
По ценам на входные билеты: есть несколько пакетов, «базовый», 99 долларов США, и «плюс» (на 30 долларов дороже, включает рестораны и камеры хранения). Мы взяли базовый (еда и так была с собой, за камеры платили) и не пожалели.
Хотя реклама говорит, будто в парке «есть бесплатный Интернет», на деле работает только и исключительно на входе, у касс, и больше ни в какой части парка не ловился.  
На Шкарет нужно планировать весь день, и лучше приезжать с самого раннего утра, часам к 9 – там всего очень много, иначе придётся под конец дня буквально бегом бегать (одним глазом на то, другим на это). 
Очень важный момент связан с камерами хранения (без которых вам, с большой вероятностью, будет не обойтись). Если вы решили поплавать в масках и посмотреть на подводных рыбок - вас ждёт жестокий облом, поскольку расположенные рядом камеры хранения - исключительно маленькие, туда почти ничего не влезет. На входе об этом не предупреждают (!!!). Поэтому зайдя в парк, лучше сразу направиться к большим камерам хранения (они работают до 6 вечера), которые расположены совсем в другой части парка (северная, около шеста с "летунами"), положить в них вещи, арендовать жилеты и уже дальше отправиться по остальному парку. 
Поскольку парк огромный, ориентироваться лучше по цветным дорожкам - они позволят не заблудиться
Нам понравились: 
- плавание с рыбками в масках (с них лучше начинать, иначе потом будет не протолкнуться - плюс см. совет выше про камеры хранения; расположены на конце, наиболее удалённом от входа)
- подземная река (проплыть в гротах почти километр – жилеты и канаты не дадут утонуть – от западной до восточной части парка)
- зоопарк – повсюду (у входа огромные попугаи, в центре - мелкая живность, в южной части - пума и ягуар, птицы и бабочки
- огромный птичник (южная часть парка – т.е. противоположная от камер хранения). Его, напротив, лучше отложить на вторую половину визита, когда уже лень будет плавать, а камеры хранения будут закрыты.
- аквариум (не такой большой, как в Торонто, но есть на что посмотреть)
- шоу летунов (а остальные шоу как-то так, не очень ; кроме того, все они будут повторяться на большом вечернем  шоу)
- Нескучное Кладбище (его можно оставить напоследок – как раз по дороге на вечернее шоу)
Неплохо:
- плавание на плотах
- шахта золотоискателей
- разные животные и птицы на деревьях
- настоящие (но маленькие) пирамиды в археологической зоне
Не понравилось шоу ковбоев (совсем скучное)
Отдельного внимания заслуживает вечернее театрализованное шоу длиной в 2 часа. По сути, шоу начинается уже перед входом в зал, когда вас встречает длинная вереница персонажей доколумбовой истории, с которыми можно сфотографироваться.
Первая часть – грандиозная (история Мексики от доколумбовых времён и до испанского завоевания; особенно понравились игра в мяч и игра в «огненный хоккей»). 
Вторая часть, честно сказать, показалась скучноватой. Она состоит из песен и плясок, представляющих разные регионы Мексики. Но то, что заводит мексиканцев, нам показалось весьма однообразным, мелодии и костюмы были похожи одни на другие. Мы не дождались и ушли минут за 10 до конца (что было разумным решением – потом пошла огромная толпа, автобусов не хватало). 
Когда ехали обратно, маршрутки были забиты и несколько пронеслось мимо нас. Но ничего, в конце концов добрались без приключений.

Bardzo warto odwiedzić ten park , długo zastanawiałam się czy kupić bilety, ale nie żałuje . Piękne krajobrazy , świeże powietrze, piękna dżungla, dużo zwierząt : flamingi, dużo papug, wielkie żółwie , delfiny i rekiny (możliwość pływania z nimi za dodatkowa opłatą) Fajne wodospady , pływanie tratwą wśród dżungli w cenie, plaże, hamaki na odpoczynek , super muzyka na żywo w restauracji, dobre jedzenie i duży wybór . Świetne pokazy, zwłaszcza wieczorne show . Cmentarz meksykański, spływ rzeką, baseny i zjeżdżalnie dla dzieci  i wiele innych atrakcji . Na park trzeba poświecić cały dzień. Bardzo polecam .

Wakacje były bez dzieci i szczerze przyznam nie miałem ochoty na wizytę w czymś co jest skrzyzowaniem mini zoo z parkiem wodnym  , ale namówiony przez rezydentkę iż nazwa jest myląca i  jest to coś więcej udaliśmy się tam , na szczęście taskówką o 10 rano  !!
a nie busem o 7.00 . Początek był obiecujący  - spływ w kapoku rzeką przez dzunglę , czasami po ziemią ,około 1.5 km - 2 godziny z przystankami .  Dopłynęliśmy do morza .
Nad morzem plaża -gorsza niż w hotelu , lezaki -gorsze niż w hotelu , drinki - drogie. 
Ruszamy dalej do następnych atrakcji . Delfiny - można popatrzeć na basem gdzie pływają . Jak dopłacisz 80 $ można nawet wejsć na chwilę do tego basenu a one pomachają płetwą . Super  nie skorzystałem . Dalej basen gdzie pływają żółwie i manaty . Jak w zoo . Wszędzie w zoo , za 20 złotych . Dalej można dokupić wejście w chełmie do basenu z płaszczkami  + 80 $ . wchodzisz stoisz - wychodzisz - 5 minut  . Super nie skorzystałem . Dalej wybieg i jedna puma . Wybieg i 1 jaguar . 
No to chyba wszystko . Aha , spływ rzeką ( bardzo ładną )  stoisz w kolejce , Szkolenie jak wsiadać , i po 20 minutach jesteś na płaskiej łodzi . 8 rzędów ławek . Widok 4 owłosione plecy przed oczami . I tyle . Chyba że jestes w 1 rzędzie( 2 osoby) . Spływ , a raczej podróz trwa 15 minut , szerokość rzeczki 2 metry głebokość 50 cm . 
Nic ciekawego , właściwie nie wiem co to było. 
Majowie , ruiny - nic ciekawego , wioska majów to poproty chaty ze straganami i pamiątkami . Przerwa na lunch ( w cenie biletu za 150 $ osoba ! (Pakiet z dojazdem)
- jesli bufet w hotelu oceniam na 100 to tam bufet oceniam na 40 . 
Dalej nuda wracac czy zostać ? Jest część dla dzieci ze zjeżdzalniami - nie korzystam .
Zostajemy na wieczorne show . Jest naprawdę fajne - szczgólnie pierwsza część ( o ile wczesniej poznałeś historie Meksyku i wiesz o co chodzi - Ja wiem ) .

Cały pobyt wraz z napojami itp 330 $ za dwie osoby plus stracony dzień .
Zaznaczam moja  ocena . Być może za duzo wymagam lun widziałem .
Ale plaża , otoczenie hotelu na riviera Maya było duzo lepsze.

Посетили Шкарет в мае 2013 года,с ребёнком 10 лет.Брали билеты в отеле,полный пакет,мероприятие заняло целый день(это с учётом дороги,т к мы проживали в Плайя Дель Кармен Ривьере Майя в отеле Иберостар Кецаль).В целом всё в парке понравилось,и попугаи,и подземная река,и большие плавающие черепахи,и зоны отдыха,всё красиво,экзотично,и шоу вечернее смотрели с удовольствием ,отлично всё спланировано,но гуляющие по территории зоны отдыха игуаны (большие ящерицы) это большой дискомфорт(((,они свободно передвигаются в зонах отдыха и незаметно могут к Вам подойти...в нашем случае,мы специально искали место где их нет,выбрали кафе по-выше,сели на лежачки,стали кушать бутеры,и тут игуаны набежали,это не передать словами,какой страх мы испытали,мы с дочкой кричали и звали на помощь,пришёл сотрудник парка,разогнал ящериц,и мы смогли выйти,пишу отзыв спустя 4,5 года,а страх до сих пор((( Я далеко не трусиха) и много где была и видела,но эта ситуация реально заставляет задуматься,особенно когда ты с ребёнком и несёшь ответственность не только за себя,но и за безопасность своего ребёнка...

Цена за вход, впрочем как и цены на территории всего парка можно смело делить на 3 и тогда получится адекватная стоимость. 
Сам парк большой, красивый, продуманный, но не скажу что невероятно интересный.
Самый оптимальный маршрут: сплав по реке (любой из двух, желтой или зеленой), далее пума с ягуаром, следом парк птиц, парк бабочек, возврат к реке. Сплав по второй реке, дельфинарий, аквариум, черепашки и подъем на башню. 
Собственно проделаете это все вы примерно до 15:00, максимум до 16:00, поэтому покупать улучшенный билет нет никакого смысла. 
Фото сделанные в парке обойдутся вам в 70$, при том снимать на свой фотоаппарат не запрещено. 
Как по мне, ехать в парк стоит только в том случае, если поехать больше совсем некуда.

Ta på dig bekväma skor för du kommer gå mycket! Otroligt mycket att se, allt från en fjärilsträdgård till akvarium till delfiner... köper du xcaret plus får du simma in i parken genom en undervattensflod, vilket var supermysigt! 
Vi var även på showen på kvällen och åt en 7-rätters mexikansk middag, väldigt gott! Min sambo fyllde år två dagar tidigare och fick en extra efterrätt. :-) väldigt trevlig show, gillade speciellt maya-indianernas ball game. Showen ingår men ska du ha mat är det 60 dollar per person. 

Minus i parken är att man först betalar ett dyrt inträde och sedan kostar alla aktiviteter mycket pengar utöver det. Vi kom som par, men för en barnfamilj blir det lite dyrt...
En stoooor djurpark men inget speciellt tyckte vi. Krångligt med banden och att dom ska märkas när man äter,lite snålt med tanke på att man betalar ett dyrt inträdr

Volá sa to zábavný park, ale všetko je to utopené na obrovskej ploche v lese, takže nestretávate davy ľudí. Je tam zoo, morské tvory, mrazivá indiánska show, prechádzka po morskom dne s helmou a vtláčaným vzduchom, nádherné miesta na ležanie pri mori, vodný svet a to najlepšie je možnosť zaplávať si (asi 700m) v podzemno-nadzemnej jaskynnej rieke. To posledné si nemôžete nechať ujsť! Nie je to lacné, celodenný vstup vychádza asi na 100 dolárov, ale určite to stálo za to.

Zbyt wielkie pieniądze za tak naprawde nic.. wszystkie atrakcje extra płatne.. w cenie był tylko bufet i jeden napój.. oraz możliwość poplywania w rzece.. reszta dodatkowo płatna.. ceny zaczynaja się od 60 dolarów za każda atrakcje taka jak na przykład poplywanie motorówka 10 min.. uratowało ich końcowe show które bardzo mi się podobało i warto było je obejrzeć.. po za tym prawie wszystkie dwudziesto minutowe przedstawienia odbywają się w jednym czasie tak ze trudno z końca parku zdarzyć na kolejne przedstawienie które odbywa się na początku parku... tak zwana wioska majòw to nic innego jak słomiane budki w których sprzedawane jest wszystko.. bardziej wyglada to jak centrum handlowe niż wioska majòw.. pływanie 15 min z delfinami to cena 150 dolarów.. przy czym po za parkiem można kupic 8 godzin pływania z delfinami za 180 dolarow.. ceny zdjęć które robi się na każdym kroku to jakaś porażka...koszt około 100 dolarow.. zobaczyc można pare zwierząt chociaż.. papugi pumę oraz bardzo ładne i zadbane oceanarium.. ogólnie nic specjalnego.. za ta cenę można zrobic naprawde wiele fajniejszych rzeczy... jedyna pozytywna rzecz to końcowe przedstawienie które trwa około 2 godzin i bardzo fajnie ukazana jest historia majów..

익스플로르 : 대형 세노테를 기반으로 만든 익사이팅 워커파크(짚라인, ATV 등)
셀하 : 스노클링과 돌고래 체험 등 자연형 테마파크(오픈세노테, 가족중심적)
스칼렛 : 멕시칸 문화와 수많은 동물들을 만날 수 있는 곳(2시간 짜리 멕시칸 쇼 관람 등)

나이가 젊어서 과감히 익스플로르 선택했고 후회는 없습니다. 정말 재밌고 스릴 넘치는 놀이공원입니다(감동의 눈물을 흘렸어요) 저희는 현장 발권했지만 일정 확정이신 분들은 21일 전에 예약하면 15%할인이고, 7일 전에 예약하면 10% 할인이니 미리 할인 받고 가시는 것도 좋을 것 같아요.

준비물은 수영복이나 티셔츠에 반바지, 비치타월 미제공이니 꼭 챙겨가시고, 워터슈즈는 구매할 수 있지만 챙겨오는 것이 좋습니다. 선크림은 화학물질이 없는 것만 사용가능하니 미리 해당 제품을 사오던지 귀찮으시면 현장 기념품샵에서 구매하면 됩니다.

개인적으로는 렌트카 끌고 가시는게 좋아요. 아침에 느즈막히 일어나 조식먹고 현장에 11시쯤 도착해서 5시까지 신나게 놀았는데- 패키지로 오신 분들은 새벽같이 일찍 오셔서 놀고 점심 먹고 2시쯤 빠지시더라구요. 전 개인적으로 여유있게 즐길 수 있어 더 좋았던거 같아요.

결제가 끝나면 손목 락커키와 헬멧을 주는데 락커키에 맞는 락커룸에 짐을 풀면 되요. 화장실만 남녀구분 있고 탈의실과 샤워실은 공용으로 사용합니다. 깨끗하게 씻는다기보다.. 겉에 묻은 오물이나 세노테 물을 씻어내는 개념으로 보는게 맞을 듯-

헬멧에 자체 내장칩이 있어서 카메라 존에서 자동으로 사진이 찍혀요. 사진을 사려면 1인당 거의 70달러를 내야해요.. 2인이면 140달러니 가격부담이 꽤 됩니다. 방수팩으로 사진 열심히 찍으세요.

짚라인은 총 2가지 코스인데. 총 14개로 구성되어있습니다. 한 코스를 완료하려면 적어도 연속 7번은 타야하는데 감속장치에 부딪힐때 살짝 아픕니다. ㅜㅜ 으으 마지막 짚라인은 물속으로 풍덩~빠져서 시원했어요.

패들보트는 손으로 노젓는 건데 방향전환도 어렵도 생각보다 잘 안나가서 체력의 60%를 이 곳에서 써서 녹초가 되었습니다. 종유석 동굴 수영하기 코스도 있는데 350m 코스랑 25m 코스 두개 갈림길이 나오니 체력에 맞게 코스 선택 하면 되요.

뭐니뭐니해도 4륜 ATV가 제일 재밌었습니다. 물구덩이도 지나갔다가 동굴도 지나갔다가.. 전조등 어떻게 켜야할지 몰라서 하마터면 사고날뻔 했던 아찔한 기억이 다 나네요 ㅎㅎ

신나게 놀고 카페테리아에서 뜨끈하게 마셨던 코코아 생각이 지금도 간절합니다. 코코아 들고 양지에 설치 된 해먹에 누워 낮잠도 자고 행복했어요. 이런 스펙타클한 워터파크는 난생 처음이었고 너무 재밌는 추억이 되었네요. 이 곳은 멕시코에 다시 간다면 또 가고 싶은 관광지입니다.

We really wanted to Snorkel, but with the ocean blowing up we needed am alternative. XEL HA!!!
We were picked up in a monster tour bus, and took the 1hr drive from cancun to Xel Ha. The park is enormous, very busy, but VERY capable to handle the crowds with quality and quantity of service. Mutiple delicious restaurants, bars, tons of gift shops and Snorkel stations. Meticulously maintained grounds. 
The lagoon is huge, and you basically grab your gear, jump in, and go wherever you want. Tons to see, clear warm water, very calm. Lots of awesome fish and animals everywhere.

There were tons of exta$ of course. Photo packs and extra excursions. We booked the SEA TREK. Underwater walking. Very neat but not reccomend for claustrophobic people. 

Our guide was right....we liked it better than our dumpy resort Oasis Sens.

We visited this place in the second week of 2018. We liked it and the weather was great. Below are some pros and cons, hope this helps.

Pros:
 * Great place for snorkeling: nice clear water, you can see different kinds of fish and also stingrays
 * The park itself is amazing; take a moment to admire everything around you: you may encounter iguanas, large parrots and other great animals. There's also a 40m tower that you can climb and see the view from above. And on the way down you can slide, no need to use the stairs!
 * They are providing snorkeling equipment
 * They are providing food
 * All around the park there is a network of cameras you can use and get yourself in some cool pictures

Cons:
 * I would recommend you bring your own snorkeling gear because they are providing a low quality one and it may leak or not work like you expect it to work
 * The food is not good at all... I did not expect that at all but that is what it is
 * If you are planning on taking the phone with you, get yourself an impermeable case beforehand. Because they are selling those at a price 5 times higher than you would normally find them on Amazon for example
 * It is expensive to buy the photos from the park; the ones you took with their cameras

Travelled Dec 18th - 25th, and stayed at Hotel XCaret. Included within our pkg was access to Xecontes. We went on Dec 20th and had a lot of fun. We visited 4 different locations.

First special mention to our guide Carlos. Super energetic, fun, informative, and spoke good English. #GorillaTeam

Recommend bringing water shoes... not 100% necessary but its just easier to walk around. Lunch if provided but don't expect a gourmet lunch. You're eating in the middle of a jungle.. LOL 

Water is pretty cold but you're body gets used to it after you start swimming around. You always have a life jacket on so no worries about swimming. 

Overall I had a fun time and would recommend this trip. We purchased the photo pkg. $60 USD for all the digital copies. They also accept credit cards

I pre booked this tour with my travel agent before I left and didn't really know what to expect.  Went by myself and had a blast! I loved that we got to see 4 different Xenotes and do something different at each one. 
The lunch and snacks provided were great. Our guide was very entertaining and educated.

The only draw back was that the photographer told us we could order our photos and if we didn't have the cash with us they could come to the resort later to collect the money (it was a bit pricey and I wasn't carrying that much cash out of safety.) Later in the trip she then told us this option would not be possible so I could only buy them then. I'm a little bummed I missed out on the photos.

Seeing some sort of cenotes was in the plan for our trip, but we weren't sure which tour to go on.  We are so glad we went on this one.  First of all, Miquel Fischer was our tour guide and showed up on time and we had a few short stops to pick others up and then we were our way!  All of the Cenotes were amazing and each had adventures waiting for us.  I loved jumping off all the cliffs, which was on my bucket list to do.  I would say you need to love adventure and have courage to do some of those jumps.  Miquel was always there to give info about the local plants and animals and also giving encouragement when that was needed.  He also explained what we were in for and what to expect.  I love the pictures of what the Photographer took, but have not received my pictures yet.  So I am a little disappointed, but I hope they return my email and send pictures.  Definitely would recommend this tour!!

Overall:  Hippie Recommended. 

We had a little hiccup in that the booking agent didn’t tell us about a weight limit on the rappel (I’m fat) but other than that it was great. 

Before you go:

1- Buy water shoes. You need something on your feet and flip flops WILL fall off.  

2- There is a weight limit on the rappel. 

3- The snorkel is not a snorkel, it’s a swim. 

4- They supply everything you need. Towels, life jackets, water, lunch, etc...

5- You can leave your stuff in the van. The whole day is spent on properties opened by the xcaret company with xcaret employees and other tourists. Even still, they lock the van. 

6- You only need money if you plan to buy the photos or one of their things (t-shirts, water shoes, towels, etc...). 

Pickup:

We booked through our hotel in the Hotel Zone they picked us up in their van. They told us 9:00 but showed up around 9:20. It turns out that they tell everybody the same time and then send a van from hotel to hotel so, depending on where your hotel is they could come earlier or later. 

The Tour:

After they pick you up, you drive their shop & pick up a photographer. Then they will assign your van to go to the four cenotes them in a different order based on the number of people and vans they have that day. Here’s what we did:

1- Rappel. It’s not a rappel (you control your speed on a dangling rope), it’s a controlled descent on a fixed diagonal line. They control your speed as you drop down into the Cenote. The Cenote is mostly underground with two openings in the roof. 

There is a platform with a ledge for jumping off of and, other than that, you just swim around. If they don’t let you rappel, you enter via a tunnel & stairs they’ve carved down and in from the side. You exit via that tunnel. 

2- Kayak/Snorkel:

Two in one. The Kayaks are tandem boats that sit up on the water. They’re easy to paddle and it’s a short trip. It’s kind of like renting a paddle boat at an amusement park. Not hard, mostly a photo op. 

The snorkel isn’t a snorkel. They give you a mask and you swim around. It’s not that exciting. 

3- Zip Line(s): This was my favorite part of the tour. 

There are two zip lines. One is a bar you hold and the other is a loop you can stand, sit, or hang on/in. You start from a cliff that is about 20 feet high. They’ll also let you jump off the cliff you want. 

Guys or girl wearing a 2 piece suit need to be careful if you’re going to to “Tarzan” on the loop line. When you hit the water it will flip you around and can cause a hilarious wardrobe malfunction. 

We had lunch after # 3. More on that later. 

4- Fire Cenote (mini-zip, waterslide, swim, cliff jump):

The water slide is a short slide with a 3 foot drop into the water. They let us do it a few times before we did the zip line. After the water slide, you do the mini-zip line and drop off for the swim. The swim is about 300 yards/250 meters. You’re wearing a life jacket so you just kind of dog paddle; it’s not hard. 

The cliff jump is another photo op. It’s about 15 feet, they’ll let multiple people jump at the same time. The photographer is standing by. 

Lunch: 

Lunch is sandwiches with some salads. They have beer, wine, sodas, and water. It’s not a big spread but it was good. 

While at lunch they’ll show you the photos they’ve taken so far and talk to you about buying them. 

Photos:

When you’re at the last Cenote they’ll sell you your photos. The price is based on the number in your group.

My mom and I booked this tour when we arrived and I am so glad we stumbled upon it!! Our guide and our photographer were absolutely amazing!! Friendly, funny, fantastic! Freddie was our photographer and the photos were spectacular- he noticed I was very interested in nature so he even included some nature photos.  He was paying attention to each party on our trip and able to take perfect photos (both spontaneous and posed). So impressed and grateful!  I think our guide was Carlos, but I don't remember! He was great and helped make the trip! 

The cenotes were beautiful and the activities were fun.  It was my favorite part of our week in Cancun (by far!)  I would HIGHLY recommend this!! 

My mom is terrified of heights, but with the encouragement of our guide and the group, she did the repelling and the zip line!! She was so glad she went so far out of her comfort zone.  The kayaking was perfect.  

The whole trip was incredible!! No complaints!
Es una experiencia ÚNICA! Para mi familia lo mejor que ofrece Experiencias Xcaret! Nuestro guia Ruben con un trato único, sin duda un guia que hace la experiencia la mejor

Me gustó mucho la experiencia. He visitado la mayoría de los parque del grupo xcaret y creo que siempre tienen algo con que sorprendernos. Aunque la comida fue buena, siento que me quedaron a deber. Por lo demás  les doy un 100. Gracias

Great tour. Lots of fun. Ziplining, snorkeling,repeling, and other stuff all in the many different and beautiful cenotes. Eduardo was our guide and Freddy was our photographer. They were great and made it fun for every one.

Great day. Noah was our awesome guide. I was concerned that we needed to be super fit but it was a great day, even for myself a senior.  I also have fear of heights and hurt my shoulder recently, there was no pressure to go beyond my limit and there was a real commradry among our group.  Our tour was limited to our van, 16 or 18 people, even though there were 4 vans, we never felt crowded. There are life guards everywhere and the workers are very safety conscious.  Guide will hold your eyeglasses if needed. Recommend underwater camera and water shoes. They will give you 2 towels, don't use 1 until very end. Flushed toilets and very decent facilities.You will be wet most of the day and cool since we are under the cover of trees. You can leave your things in van for safekeeping, bring dry clothes to change into. Noah never asked for a tip at anytime, but definitely deserved them.

The best tour in Yucatán we've taken so far.

This tour fulfills and exceeds expectations.

Una excursion muy divertida por 4 xenotes. Una hermosa naturaleza !!! El picnic y los snaks superaron nuestra expectativa. Muy bien cuidados y atendidos, nos toco Ivan ( amable, divertido y sabiendo hacer muy bien su trabajo ) como coordinador y Ana como nuestra fotografa. Compramos las fotos y las enviaron de inmediato via mail. Maravillosa experiencia

Xenotes Oasis Maya

Really Fun! 
I knew we made the right decision to go on this tour when the group that was going on the van with us, from our resort, said it is their second time going on this trip. This tour caught my attention for two reasons: 1) My daughter had never been to a  cenote, and this trip offered several different kinds, and 2) It got really good reviews from T.A.  I generally try to stay away from gimmicky tours that offer ziplining, rappelling, etc (been there, done that) but I have to admit, it was really fun doing all these things!!! The first cenote had a water slide, the other cenotes had really fun zip lines, a small cliff jump, that was scary for me, none the less, and we got rappelled into another cenote. It was especially fun doing it as a group because everyone was encouraging others, who were too scared to do some of the activities. And some people went crazy with the zip lines or jumping off the cliff doing all sorts of acrobatic stuff. The group laughed, guffawed, "ooo-ed and ahh-ed" at all the antics. What also made it great was that we could do everything numerous times! Saul our tour guide and his assistant Annaia....(?) were lovely. And, each cenote was truly Beautiful! FYI, I've been to several different cenotes in the past and the only drawback to this tour is the following: if you are interested in really going underground to explore a cave cenote and do more snorkeling, I would recommend you try something different like Rio Secreto or others.

We had an amazing day with our guide, Yosua, visiting 4 different incredible cenotes. The snacks and lunch we got were delicious. The cenotes were absolutely stunning, and there were super fun activities at each one - kayaking, zip lining, rapeling, etc. At our last cenote, the strap on my camera broke and my camera sunk to the bottom of the cenote. Our guide Yosua volunteered to free dive 8 meters and retrieve my camera for me. All in all an incredible day! Highly recommended to families, couples, etc. :)

We booked this tour as part of a two package combo with Xplor, and I must say that Xcaret knows how to do the adventure parks right! Our guide, Noel “el gordo” was fun, kept the group interested, and challenged us throughout the day. He was very focused to make sure we enjoyed the entire day, and shared his knowledge of the history of the Cenotes and the ecosystems we were visiting. 

This was much more than the swimming that is only offered at most of the cenotes. This tour took us to four different ones so that we could see the closed Cenote, semi open and open ones. Most of the cenotes involved zip lining and cliff jumping which added to the adrenaline of the day. 

A must do your if you enjoy adventure in the jungle.

Uma excursão fantástica e muito divertida! Visitámos vários cenotes nos quais fizemos várias actividades, rapel, zip-line, canoagem ...! Excelente guia, muito simpático e atencioso! Os cenotes encontram-se no meio de a natureza luxuriante! Recomendo vivamente!
Paulo Silva
Portugal

Amazing views!!! Our guide Eduardo was knowledgeable. There were cenotes (caves) all over and we got to snorkel, swim, kayak and zip line in caves. The views were so beautiful. You even get to see bats in one of the cenotes. Perfect for people who enjoy water and adventures at the same time. It's a whole day trip and the ticket price includes transportation, towels and lunch. So, plan accordingly. One thing that I am super impressed was with how neat and tidy the facilities are (very well maintained). Probably the best facilities I've ever been to esp in an adventurous place like these.

Optamos em fazer só os xenotes Oasis Maya ao invés do Chichen - Itza. Realmente são maravilhosos simplesmente amamos, mas no último Cenote Antiguo nossa máquina fotográfica caiu nele enquanto meu marido filmava descendo a tirolesa. Nossa máquina é a NIKON Coolpix AW130( RECOMENDO) e nela estava todos os registro dos 15 dias da nossa viagem em Cancún chorei e quase perdi a esperança, mas Deus é bom e usou a vida  do funcionário RODRIGO juntamente com o SALVA - VIDAS (e máquinas) rsrsrs para recuperá-la. Voltamos para o hotel arrasados. Porém no dia seguinte eles recuperaram nossa máquina no fundo do cenote com 40 metros de profundidade. Topzera essa equipe!!! Nosso eterno obrigada...

É um parque aquático natural então vá preparado para focar o dia todo na agua. Pagamos 80 dólares com tudo incluído o translado de Cancun até lá de ônibus demora 1:30 bem tranquilo. O parque é legal esperava mais dos cenotes mas conseguimos nos divertir. Fizemos o passei de bike pela floresta. Passeio pago 32 dólares por pessoa, recomendo por ser uma experiência diferente. Nosso pacote foi todo incluído o melhor restaurante achamos o vermelho.

This place is very beautiful, but that's about as far as it goes.  We were staying at a resort and took a day trip here.  Our day started off eating the horrible breakfast buffet.  That set the tone for the rest of the day.  Lunch was even worse at the Mexican restaurant.  None of the food was even recognizable and it was horrible.  We eventually found a restaurant that served American-type food, but it still left a lot to be desired. They have no bottled water or any place inside the park to purchase a bottled drink.  After seeing the quality of the food, there was no way I was going to drink anything there unless it came in a bottle.  Luckily we brought bottled water with us but it didn't last us all day.  We had to choose between staying hydrated or risk getting sick.  Unfortunately, my wife and I both still ended up getting sick from the food.  We haven't felt right for a few days after eating at this place.  This was the only place we ate at outside our resort.  

All of the interesting activities at this park cost extra money.  The park is extremely overcrowded, and the snorkeling gear is awful.  The masks fog up in less than a minute.  There were a few cool fish that we saw, but mostly the snorkeling was nothing great.  Everything is so far spread out, and the maps are definitely not to scale and it takes a long time just to figure out where you're going or where you are.  There is a river you can float down that is seriously about a mile long.  And there is no current to take you down the river, so you're left trying to paddle with your arms for a mile while sitting in your tube.  Not a very fun experience.  The one thing we did enjoy was riding the bikes, but it's a very short ride and the bikes are all in bad condition.  There are some nice shaded areas to sit at by the water, but we could have done that at our all-inclusive resort with food and drinks that we were not afraid to consume.  We got a great view and picture at the top of the tower water slide, which was cool, but it's hardly worth the price of admission.

Overall, this place was a complete waste of time and ended up being the opposite of why we went on vacation--to relax.  There are kids everywhere and so many people that it is impossible to enjoy yourself.  We arrived around 9am and by 2pm we were ready to leave.  The downside was our bus wasn't coming back until 6pm, so we literally counted down the minutes just to get out of the park.  I would not recommend eating the food or staying all day.  We might have had a better experience if we only went for half a day and ate at our resort before and after, but all things considered, we had a terrible experience.

Es un lugar muy bonito, donde realmente juegan con tus sentidos, por eso el nombre del parque Xenses, el pueblo es maravilloso y tiene un concepto muy divertido, con el rio subiendo, y el pueblo que parece que vas de subida, pero tu cuerpo avanza como en una bajada.. Muy raro pero muy divertido, ademÃ¡s hay mÃ¡s atracciones con las que te podras divertir
Me fascinó mis hijos y yo nos divertimos como enanos precio accesible .un poco desatentas las.chicas de los snacks
Muy bonito aunque el recorrido es corto, te deja tiempo para hacer otra actividad fuera del parque
Una experiencia inolvidable debes vivirla ! Es imperdible ojo lleva de esos zapatos para agua es el único parque de grupo Xcaret donde me he puesto a llorar al mezclar tantas emociones

OMG! Amazing adventure, I have never been to a park like this one. The very first activity we did was a sensatory challenge where you go through a pitch dark environment only using 3 of your  senses (touch, smell and hearing) to move through it, simply wonderful! There are many other optical and balance environments which are out of this world. Xenses lives up to its name putting all of your senses to the test!

La experiencia increíble y diferente. El pueblo fue lo mejor. Si van deben de incluir en su entrad el paquete de fotos. Es lo que ms vale la pena. Yo contesté servicio de transporte. Si hubiera review para esta sección le daría 1 estrella. El tiempo que dan no es suficiente para recorrer todo el parque. Nos faltó experiencias x hacer :(... Súper decepcionada de esta parte!
Super!!!
Muy divertido. El recorrido es corto pero sustancioso. Para despertar los sentidos. Me encantÃ³.

Way more fun than we thought it would be. The walk in the dark through 5 or 6 environmental zones brushing past typical plants and barefoot through sand, warm water, rock, chilly streams etc was superb and enjoyed by our 10 year old to our 50 year old.  
The "upside down" street was mind blowing. Lots of other visual tricks and gags.
Beautifully designed, immaculately clean, ... Probably the best "sensory" park in the world.

We were in Playa with our friends and they recommended Xenses as well as Xcaret , and it was a great advise, we had a blast, both parks are unique ,well maintained and  fun, kids had a blast, food is decent and reasonably priced, we did not get to do as much as I would have liked so hopefully we will next time.
Super interesante, una nueva forma de sentir la experiencia, literal un lugar de relajaciÃ³n y emociÃ³n al 100
simplemente espectacularÂ¡Â¡

Very cool park with many attractions to play with your senses. If you suffer from vertigo, however, I'm not sure I would recommend this place for you. They have a pueblo street that really plays with your head, as the angles of everything make it seem not as it is, and many cool things to do. Great place!
Me encantÃ³ el parque en todos los aspectos, especialmente los alimentos y bebidas. Son exquisitos!

Muy linda la experiencia que se vive.
Vale la pena la entrada.
Es un parque que se recorre en media jornada.
Vale la pena vivir la experiencia completa. El personal se destaca por su amabilidad. La calidad del producto es muy similar a la de Disney.
Tiene estacionamiento incluido en el precio si uno va en su propio carro.
Vale la pena amigos. Vivan esta gran sorpresa!!!!
Nos gusto mucho. Muy bueno el pack foto, por web tienen descuento si anticipan su visita ( en el valor de la entrada y el pack fotos).

INCREIBLEEEEEEEE Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡  Que hermoso parque, interesante, emosionante y sobre todo los sentidos a tope .... Felicidades y quedo mas que satisfecho Â¡Â¡Â¡  Gracias por crear espacios tan fantasticos.
El guia ,Rodrigo hizo super ameno todo el tour, excelente atención y lo mejor todo incluido �

Ya no se por dónde más tratar de contactarlos, les he escrito por todos los correos, por acá, nadie me responde. El 13 de enero fui con mi familia y pagamos las fotos del fotógrafo y aún no tenemos nada porque la información que nos dieron solo descarga dos fotos que no son ni de nosotros. De verdad confiamos mucho en ustedes y esperamos que nos solucionen.

What an amazing adventure this tour was. My one must to while visiting Cancun this month was to visit a cenote and boy oh boy did this exceed my expectations. Not only are the cenote’s beautiful, things that you would only see on a movie or in pictures, but our tour guide Fisher was absolutely amazing. From the zip lining, repelling, waterslide, cliff jump… nothing could get the smile off my face.

I highly recommend this tour to anyone who is thinking about it. I thought it was reasonably priced for a full day of fun, activities, laughter and most of all memories.

We had an amazing time during our tour (december 2017). Our tour guide Josh was encouraging and fun! A comfortable bus transfer from/hotel and between the cenotes, fun activities, good lunch and amazing memories!

An amazing day! Our driver/guide, Ivan (not sure if spelling is right), really made the day even more memorable > super knowledgeable, funny and great English. Refreshments, snacks and lunch were very good quality, and all of the cenotes visited were extremely well-maintained with even more knowledgeable and friendly staff. Thank you for a wonderful day of zip lining, rappelling, snorkelling, kayaking and swimming!

We had a great day with Severiano and Jaime. Even though it was cooler, they kept us laughing the entire day. You can also tell that they are passionate about the history and care of the Xenotes. I highly recommend!

Awesome trip!  We had a great tour guide , Serveano (not sure I spelled that right) and”paparazzi” Jaime. They both added to the fun of the trip. Great way to get an example of several different cenotes and experience different activities.
Excepcional, disfrutando de mis mejores vacaciones al lado de mi hija Caro. Nuestro guía Renè: atento y cortéz, y Daniel nuestro fotógrafo. En hora buena.
Muy padre, todos muy amables, lugares hermosos y únicos, nuestro fotógrafo Fredy excelente y el guía muy bien!!!
J'ai vraiment adoré, le stuff (Elias et Jaime) étaient très professionnels et très gentils, l'endroit est vraiment paradisiaque , c'est à couper le souffle. Je le recommande fortement.

Hello, our family paid for the photo package on 29 December 2017 with Xenotes and we have not yet received the photos through the email we provided. We have the receipts and information of the tour bus/guide that day. I have written an email at your customer service website but they have only sent me automated messages. The number they provided does not go through. My incident number is: Case No. 00297258, "Missing Photos (Paid)". Please let me know how to reach the photo department for the photos that our family paid for.

Son excelentes lugares,1000% recomendado, es un paraíso natural bello, gracias a Rubén y Elías excelentes guías que nos acompañaron en nuestra aventura haciéndola muy especial y divertida. Me encantó!!!�
Que hermoso lugar... Elías y Daniela nos acompañaron durante todo el tour y excelente trato nos dieron... Todo todo fue increíble ninguna cosa en contra...

Increíble experiencia, el contacto con la
Naturaleza es indescriptible, sin duda regresaré
Fue una aventura increíble, el tour estaba muy bien organizado y nuestro guía fue muy bueno también.

I'm not sure I can add to what others have said to expect when you go there.  I'm glad I pre-read the reviews and both my husband and i brought our own water shoes (you can find them on Amazon for about $10/pair).  I highly recommend this, as those who wore flip-flops had to carry them around.  Based on a recommendation, I also wore a water shirt, and I was glad i did, as a few of the caves were a bit chilly.   We also brought our own snorkel equipment, but I'm not sure that was necessary.  

Our photographer, Elias, captured some incredible images, and we decided to purchase the $58US package. Our guide (also Elias), was very knowledgable about the cenotes and very patient with me continuously chickening out to jump off the cliff(s).  I finally gained the courage and went for it.  

I will add that my husband and I both recently lost some weight, which was very helpful for the excursion. It took some effort to climb and do some of the swimming.  There is no way we could have done this excursion a year ago and fully appreciate all it had to offer had we not have lost the weight.  While I think they will be accommodating for all fitness levels, it does require a certain amount of effort.  

I'm so glad we went on this excursion and will probably try it again.

We were so fortunate to have Amet as our guide!  Although the tour is worth EVERY penny, he made a great day extraordinary.  It was clearly evident that his goal was two-fold; first, to ensure our safety and well being, and second, to ensure we had an experience that we will remember for a lifetime!  

Amet was certain that before we participated in the activities available at each of the 4 sites, we understood the history and importance of the cenotes to the Mayans.  His knowledge of history, wild life and vegetation was vast, and he took time to answer any and all questions.

The activities were so much fun, and although safety is their number one priority, there was never a doubt that the ultimate goal of our guide and the staff was making certain everyone in our group was smiling the entire time.  Our group of 18 started as strangers but all became friends before the day was done.  Thanks Amet!  Coyotes rule!!

This excursion was hands down one of the best experiences I have ever had on a vacation. The cenotes were beautiful and fun. Everyone was very nice and knowledgeable. Our guide Elias was very nice and friendly. It didn’t even matter that it was colder at the time for Mexico because it was so beautiful. Also, after getting out of each xenote there was always a table set up with snacks and coffee and hot chocolate, and we were given towels to warm up in.

When I first heard about this place, I thought just another water park. Boy, was I wrong! Xcaret is huge and beautiful. There was so much for you to do in one day. Snorkeling was great. Water was clear lot of activities underwater. Many shaded places to just relax. So many verities of food to choose from. I would come back again if i'm in the area.

We had a great time. Serveano was an amazing tour guide. So fun all the time. Xenotes were beautiful, activities fun, and lunch was good. The one activity is supposed to be rappelling but it’s more like a controlled decent. And there was no snorkeling, just goggles to look at the bottom of one centoe.
Would never go again. Worst of all parks, every activity is extra. Snorkeling water is not clear, staff less than professional, food nothing special.

Our family of 4 (parents with 2 adult children) had a great time.  We visited 4 different xenotes and our guide, abuelo, was fantastic.  He made everyone feel comfortable and was very professional at all times.  Our group had a young girl that wasn't a strong swimmer and he swam along side her (we wore life jackets when we were in the water at all times).  2 towels are provided but I recommend bringing one of your own also as you are in the water 4 different times.  The lunch was delicious and water/wine/beer/pop are provided at some of the stops.
La mejor experiencia de mi vida, excelente atención por parte del guía Luis y del fotógrafo Luis, la comida muy rica, el personal ( salvavidas, anfitriones etc) muy atentos y muy cordiales

Lugares hermosos para visitar en los que se tiene contacto con la bella naturaleza en todos los sentidos, desde momentos en los que ésta se puede contemplar en calma, hasta aquellos llenos de aventura. Los líderes del grupo son tan hábiles en su labor, que llegan hacer sentir al grupo como una familia a pesar de estar compuesta de personas completamente desconocidas y de diferentes nacionalidades; además de que muestran amor y respeto por la naturaleza. Me queda únicamente agradecer por la hermosa a experiencia y por el increíble y divertidísimo liderazgo de Severiano, y junto al amor de fotógrafos Carlos y Alberto. ¡Saludos!

We went with me and my husband, my 6yr old daughter and 9yr old son.  Also had my 74 yr old mother in law.   Truly a great day.   We did not see any other young children but I would recommend it if your kids love the water and are super comfortable in it.   Lots of stairs so that was a bit rough for my mother in law but she handled all the water adventures like a champ.   No safety issues.   Great food.  They provide everything and b prepared to buy the photos.   They r better than anything you can take and you don’t risk losing your camera in a 100 foot deep cenote.

Highly recommended for young and old! Even though, we felt rushed by our guide - particularly the first two cenotes; and felt that we didn't have enough time to enjoy the beauty surrounding us. Ziplining, kayaking, rappelling, swimming, water sliding, jumping off cliffs - a really fun day in paradise. You can do as much or as little as you like. Recommend bringing your own snorkel; also, watershoes, flip-flops, rash guard, additional swimwear, and a change of clothes. Just keep in mind that there is barely any storage space in the van; you'll have to keep your belongings on your lap. Van gets locked when you do the activities, so think hard -and fast (if you get Gorilla's Carlos for a guide) -  about the things you want to take with you, before you take off into the jungle.

Me and my children had a great experience at xenotes, our tour guide(can’t remember his name) and photographer (Gina) were amazing. Great lunch and coffee break. Delicious water of Jamaica and hot chocolate. 
Loved the views and the adventure!
Es impresionante! Gracias Rubén (guía del tour) por todo el entusiasmo

Amet was our guide for the day visiting 4 cenotes.  We had an awesome time rappelling and jumping into a cenote, snorkeling in a cenote/cave, kayaking in a river, zip lining into a cenote, and sliding/swimming/cliff jumping into a cenote/river. The water was fresh, beautiful and warm. The scenery was gorgeous - we were in the jungle with no bugs!!!!!  What an awesome array of things we got to do!  Lunch was plentiful. Mandatory life vests were helpful. We got to lock up valuables in the van during excursions.  I bought a wet shirt because it was a rainy morning and that came in helpful.  They also sold water shoes (recommend highly) and eyeglass straps in the van. Great trip. I took my underwater camera in the snorkeling/kayaking stop and then should have taken it for the swim/jump stop but got it from the van and took a few pictures afterwards. The snorkeling portion is just a mask and no tube but the space is small, so not a big deal but I took my own stuff for that stop. Glad there was a pro photographer there so I bought the pics!  Do this tour!  It’s great!

This was my adult daughter and myself. 
This would fall into one of our favorite excursions anywhere. 
We were allowed time to swim and jump off of rocks and cliffs in addition to the scheduled activities. 
There were plenty of guides and support staff. Our group was limited to about 10-12 people so you got personal attention when appropriate and helpful instructions when needed. 
Lunch was included- a nice deli selection. Drinks were supplied often. 
I would do this again in a heartbeat! 
This was GREAT!

My wife and I spent two weeks in the Mayan Riviera just before Christmas 2017. We did 7 different excursions from our resort and this was our favourite one! This adventure tour takes you to 4 different cenotes, and each one is different than the last. You get to zipline into the water (at two of them), cliff jump (if you want to), rappel (controlled descent), snorkel, kayak, and do lots of swimming (with a life jacket) and enjoying the beautiful scenic (and natural) locations. They say swimming in a cenote is one of the top things to do in the Mayan Riviera, and I have to agree. This tour is a great way to experience just a few of the thousands of cenotes in the area. I highly recommend. Our tour guide, Helios, was the best! He was very informative and a lot of fun to spend the day with.

I love this activity! It has so many things to offer. The guides are fun, the camera person does a fantastic job. It's fun to drive through the jungle and see little villages and kids out playing or walking to school. I felt safe with the activities, driving, and in the areas where we went. I love the water so if you are not a water person this may not be good for you but if you love the water you'll love this!

It is a great place for adventure surrounded by nature. There are thousands of cenotes in the Yucatán peninsula, but in this tour you can experiment all four kinds, and there is something different to do in each one.. also, they include the transportation, a light breakfast and a lunch meal, which are both great. You can have snorkeling, kayak, swimming, cliff jump, rappel, and zip lines in one day. Our guide, Saúl was great, and the photographer, Álvaro took amazing pictures.

De lo mejor en Cancún, muy recomendable atracción para aventureros y no aventureros! La pasamos increíble, la naturaleza en su máximo esplendor.
Nuestro guía Fisher, Miguel Fisher nos hizo un día muy agradable con sus recomendaciones y apoyo total. Daniel el fotógrafo, nos dejaste con grandiosas fotografías 📸
El lunch muy de acuerdo al tipo de experiencia, lo volveríamos a vivir en familia!
GRACIAS

Yo estáva en el grupo de morgan p con el guía yosua muy amable los cenotes muy hermosos la fotógrafa karina lo único malo es que cuando regrese al hotel en mi cartera me faltaba dinero y en la compra de fotografía compre el libro de los cenotes y supuestamente estaría en el hotel el libro y nunca llego así que les recomiendo que tengan cuidado con sus cosas de valor ya que las cosa se quedan en la van y supuestamente solo el guía y la fotógrafa tienen acceso no confíen en que va estar seguro.
Una experiencia increíble! Paisajes hermosos! Excelente atención de David y Georgina! Buena comida.....un servicio completo desde la salida del hotel. Quedamos invitados a repetir esta experiencia!!!

My boyfriend and I took the Xenotes tour on our 2nd last day of our 2 week Mexican Vacation. If I was going to do 1 thing while in Mexico, visiting a cenote was on the top of my list! 

Miguel Fisher was our tour guide and a lot of fun. He was super knowledgeable about the local plants, vegetation, animals and made the tour exciting. 

The views we had were out of this world and truly unique. We did purchase the picture package after the tour and had a few issues in downloading our pictures, but we did eventually get our pictures. 

If I was going to say one thing about the tour it would be that it is quite "adventurous". I personally found that the brochure we got when booking the tour didn't properly advertise this. There was a lot of steep rock climbing, cliff jumping, zip lining (holding only onto a handlebar), rappelling, kayaking, swimming & snorkeling. There was a small child on our trip and she didn't participate in a lot of the activities. So just be aware that this is more than just swimming in cenotes. 

Price for value was well worth it and I HIGHLY recommend enjoying this tour.

Fue un día inolvidable: lo pasamos tan estupendamente que nos encantaría repetir en un futuro :).  El guía-conductor Braulio, la fotógrafa Paulina y todos los demás miembros del equipo se portaron maravillosamente y con una paciencia infinita.  Vamos, que es una excursión altamente recomendable y sumamente interesante. ¡Que nadie la deje escapar!  Quisiera agradecer aquí también a mi interlocutor a la hora de reservar el tour, Carlos Eustaquio, por su enorme amabilidad: viajar así da gusto.

Este es el 3er año consecutivo que para celebrar mi cumpleaños, familiares y amigos hacemos este tour. Y por tercera vez he quedado maravillado por la increíble experiencia que ofrecen.
Las actividades son divertidisimas, los cenotes que visitamos son majestuosos, las instalaciones en cada cenote están super bien pensada... Pero lo mejor es la gente, desde los guardavidas, los chicos que te ajustan el arnés en el rapel, los fotógrafos y los guías!!! Mis respetos!
En mi primera visita Joshua fue nuestro guía, para tratar de ser breve les comento que, tres años después del Tour, mi sobrino sigue hablando de Joshua como si fuera su héroe!! Estábamos muy admirados de su buena vibra y profesionalismo, cabe señalar que a pesar de que éramos un grupo complicado con gente que hablaba francés, inglés y español; y cada vez daba las explicaciones 3 veces con el mismo entusiasmo.
En esta última vez nuestro guía fue Hemerson! Super dinámico y divertido. ¡Cuidado! porque de pronto cuando parecía que caminabas tranquilo con tu grupo, se las ingeniaba, se escondía y saltaba de entre los árboles y nos pegaba tremendos sustos! Reímos mucho y disfrutamos de haber sido parte de su grupo.
Cada que vamos a Xenotes compramos las fotos, los fotógrafos son atentos y super creativos para sacar fotos padrisimas! A cualquier parque al que vamos compramos las fotos, pero las de xenotes siempre serán mis favoritas por la atención que te brindan los fotógrafos.
Para mí, que he visitado todos los parques en varias ocasiones y me considero fan de todo lo que ofrecen; Xenotes es lo mejor que tiene experiencias Xcaret!!
Mil felicidades a toda su gente que hacen de xenotes una experiencia inolvidable!!!
GRACIAS!!!
Y nos vemos el próximo año en mi cumpleaños!!!

Me gusto la pasamos divertidos en el recorrido que realizamos. Música alegré con personas divertidas.
