Sin duda el mejor tour por muchos factores:
La atención de los guías durante los traslados.
El conocimiento de los guías en las explicaciones y su pasión por platicar sobre sus antepasados.
La comida riquísima en el restaurante.
Nos encantó el tour, lo recomendamos ampliamente! !

Súper organizados  muy buen servicio 
Guías en tu idioma
Comida y bebida de muy buena calidad!
Nos la pasamos súper !!!!
Definitivamente ha sido una experiencia excelente, el tour es muy completo y con una atención muy buena. Definitivamente regresaré.

Tomé el plan Deluxe que ofrecía transporte en un bus de lujo con bebidas ilimitadas, lo cual no se cumplió.  El desayuno ofrecido estuvo muy bien, mientras que el bus era corriente sin nada especial y las bebidas se negaron al solicitarlas.  La única bebida que nos dieron cuando regresamos de Chichen Itza nos la quitaron de nuestros puestos, nos dimos cuenta de esto cuando regresamos del cenote, lo cual, me pareció de muy mal gusto que nos esculcaran nuestras pertenencias. Al reclamar al guía sobre esto, fue bastante grosero y nuevamente nos negó una nueva bebida, esto sucedió con el guía llamado Rafael.   Con respecto al tour me pareció magnífica la experiencia en Chitchen Itza, es realmente espectacular!  La comida en valladolid deliciosa y muy variada. El cenote no fue tan espectacular como se ve en fotos y no se permite el baño.  En general la experiencia estuvo buena, les recomiendo que tomen solo chitchen itza para que puedan disfrutar sin apuros y realizar sus compras de souvenirs que por cierto encuentran a muy buen precio.  En el tour que tomé teníamos que estar corriendo todo el tiempo y no pudimos apreciar bien el lugar.

ya es la segunda vez que hago el tour de xichen plus y xcaret plus, la verdad me gusta mucho el servicio que brindan , la comida de los buffetes es muy buena, algo costoso pero vale la pena , lo unico que me gustaria es que las llegadas a xcaret no fuera tan tarde ya que el dia no te rinde nada , estaba en playa del carmen ,te recogen a las 10 am y vas llegando al parque como a las 11:30 , es tan grande y bonito xcaret que necesitas mucho tiempo para conocerlo , deberian de programar las llegadas de la gente desde la hora que abre el parque , lo que son las actividades acuaticas toman mucho tiempo , de ahi en fuera a mi me encanta todo , cuando sales del parque sales con un buen sabor de boca y muy orgulloso de ser mexicano. espero pronto poder tener la oportunidad de regresar

Salimos muy temprano para hallar el bus que nos llevaría a Chichen y no paramos hasta eso de las 18:30 horas. La experiencia ha sido maravillosa e impecable. Todo lo que se comprometen lo cumplen. Los guías que nos tocaron: Eduardo y su equipo han sido maravillosos, siempre dispuestos a ayudar, a enceñarnos sus costumbres ansestrales. Recomiendo que tomen todos los tours de Xcaret. Están muy bien organizados y el equipo humano más allá de estar muy bien preparados en sus recorridos, tienen una capacidad empática con los visitantes que asombra. Además los equipos de seguridad (En aquellas de deben usarse) son de primera calidad y notamos que están bien cuidados o chequeado para que la experiencia del visitante resulta única.
De nuestra parte nos quedan nada más que palabras de agradecimiento y esperamos volver a hacer algunas de las otras atracciones que nos faltaron.
Arnaldo (Salta-Argentina)

El tour es ofrecido por xperiencias Xcaret, es fenomenal. Jorge y Fernando fueron nuestros guías, y Fernando, nuestro conductor del autobús. Sin puntuales, confiables y muy amables, saben llegar a las personas y dan una guía maravillosa. Visita al cenote muy bonita aunque un poco corta, y el restaurante en Valladolid es delicioso y muy lindo. Puedes adquirir arte popular mexicano muy lindo y a muy buenos precios. Definitivamente lo recomiendo y en mi próxima visita a México compraré más tours con xperiencias Xcaret, pues son completamente confiables.

Empieza temprano, como a las 7am y termina cerca de las 19hs. Los guías Santos y Ángel muy buenos y entretenidos , aprendimos mucho durante el paseo. 
El sitio arqueológico está invadido por vendedores, fuera de este detalle, mantiene su mística. 
En Valladolid comimos muy bien, comida regional bien variada. 
Los tiempos se cumplieron como fueron prometidos.
La puntualidad y la organización es de resaltar. los buses son cómodos y limpios. es la segunda ocasion que hago el viaje y todo sale perfecto.
Puntualidad muy  buena, Bus 5 estrellas, tour guiado, Distancia un poco larga, pero el tour lo vale.!!

Tomé le plan Deluxe que ofrecia alimentos y bebidas en la unidad así como una botella de agua para el recorrido de la zona arqueólogica, así como disfrutar en la bella Valladolid en el restaturant La Casona los alimentos tipo buffet y las bebidas que uno quisiera degustar, claro esto no incluia bebidas alcoholicas, lo que note si fue un poco de elitismo de parte del guía llamado Rafael el cual no quiso atender aun turista asiatico ya que le solicitaba una sombrilla para el tour y se negaba porque no traía identificación, si el turista iba a regresar a la misma unidad no entiendo porque negarle una atención, la iba a regresar de todos modos, a parte de que nos separó de las personas que hablamos español de las que hablaban inglés como si fueramos personas inferiores, deben cuidar mucho eso porque el turista méxicano da más que cualquier turista extranjero. De ahí todo fue excelente.

Booked thus tour through Experiencias XCaret and they took care of everything. We enjoyed every step of the entire tour since the morning to the night (it is a full day 12-hr tour). 

The bus ride was comfortable. They gave us a simple but good boxed breakfast, which consisted in a turkey ham sandwich, orange juice, a small muffin and coffee. 

The team from Experiencias XCaret- Santos, Enrique, and Felipe the bus driver provided excellent service throughout the day. Santos and Enrique spoke Spanish and English very well and provided good historical information as well as a few jokes. 

Chichén Itza was great, and then the trip to Valladolid to have lunch at La Casona was awesome. The food was plentiful and delicious. The trip to the Zaci cenote was also good. We had a great time!
Lo máximo es súper súper familiar...y me encanta el sensatorium...pues te encuentras contigo mismo.
Esta bien pero no volvería a ir. No es un parque para niños menores de 10 años
Nos gustó  muchísimo  el parqué  es super divertido sin duda si volvería,  la atención  por parte de todos excelente, esperamos volver  pronto! !!
Todo fantastico ideal para pasar un buen rato con la familia, magnificas actividades... MAGNIFICO TODOOOO¡¡ 100% recomendadisimo  �

Our family of seven (five kids aged 16-24) spent New Year's Day here. We spent the whole day and LOVED every minute of it. There were no crowds and we rarely waited in line. The park is clean and the employees are friendly. We loved the ziplines and since there were no crowds, even did them a 2nd time. But my personal favorite was swimming in the underground river. The caverns here are gorgeous and rival many caverns we have visited in the US, but here you can swim in them! Worth the money. If you have teenagers, don't miss. We did the photo pass and got quite a few great photos (it took us a few days to get into the website--probably has lots of traffic). However, next time I would get one of the lanyards with a waterproof pouch and take my own photos.

Located right next to our favorite park (xcaret that we have been to 16 times) it was our first time that we had people with us who could physically do xplor (we are 50 somethings). So it was with anticipation we went. 

Upon arrival it was a very disappointing with the horrible line up to get your helmet and wrist band. It took us 65 minutes from time we got off bus at xplor and were able to get into park after getting the gear. This is the main reason for 2 versus 4 star rating.

Once in it was okay. Big lineup to get onto the zipline route though. Had to wait for people to get their harnesses properly sized. You have choice of "deer" or "jaguar" paths. Deer being lower than the higher jaguar. We chose the jaguar. You have 14 points to climb up the stairs in the towers to get to the next zipline section. Be prepared to get wet. IMPORTANT NOTE: once you start the zipline there is no paths to walk back if you decide to quit. Apparently you can "leapfrog" at a couple towers by going from jaguar to deer as we saw one couple do. We were at tower 4 and they still had to go 3 three links to get back.

Did the ATV thing twice, once for each route. Be prepared for nervous nellies slowing you down and not moving over at the pass points to let you get by. Very rude...

You can eat as many times as you want at the restaurant. Food is okay, not great like at xcaret. 

Another IMPORTANT POINT: there is no alcoholic drinks available. You would think they were based on the number of collisions generated by the ATV idiots (saw 3 of them). :)

Probably wouldn't go back again except to maybe try the night time option. However will definitely do again if travelling with teens in the future.

O parque é nota 10. Vale gastar um dia todo. As atividades não são recomendadas para crianças pequenas. É necessário minimo condicionamento físico, para aproveitar (nada cansativo, porém). As refeições são gostosas.
Excelente experiencia para chicos y grandes, recomiendo llegar temprano para aprovechar bien el dia sin tanta fila. La comida es buena y tiene variedad.

Nous y sommes allés une journée un peu plus froide qu'à l'accoutumée pour le Mexique car nous ne savions pas quoi faire d'autre...Quelle belle journée nous avons eu! Le site est très beau, bien entretenue, le personnel est accueillant et professionnel, tous les passages sous terre sont fabuleux et se doivent d'être vu, c'est impressionnant comme c'est vaste! On a adoré la tyrolienne, on a pris celle du jaguar si je ne me trompe pas mais on a vu aucun jaguar...C'est seulement la tour la plus haute des 2 parcours je crois. L'environnement y est securitaire et super bien pensé. Le buffet est surprenant avec ceviche de fruits de mer, pates, viandes, poissons, etc. Ils sont soucieux de protéger l'environnement et demande donc aux touristes de se conformer à ses exigences afin de preserver cette nature si precieuse, vous voulez vous proteger du soleil assurez-vous d'avoir une crème solaire biodegradable, ou de vous en procurer à leur boutique.Donc en résumé on adoré notre journée, oh oui! Surtout planifier des souliers d'eau absolument sinon ils en vendent sur le site, c'est un must! Bonne visite!
Un bonito lugar para gente que le gustan las emociones fuertes muy recomendable para ir con adolescentes y la comida deliciosa

La verdad el parque es muy bueno, pero lo recomiendo para personas no muy avanzadas en edad por las actividades físicas que se realizan dentro del mismo. Las bebidas y el servicio por parte de la fuente de sodas muy buenas. Lo unico malo es que al acercarse la hora de la salida del parque (17:00), los trabajadores bajan la calidad de su servicio y hasta un poco groceros son algunos, no todos cabe aclarar, fuera de eso recomiendo vivir la aventura xplor!!

Amazing experience! Keep reading for the tips.
Plan: You should be ready to spend a whole day at this place. All the activities are super fun, the park is well maintained, food is delicious. Don't forget to buy biodegradable sunscreen in advance (any other sunscreen is forbidden, we bought one in Walmart). If you are not sure what to wear and what to bring, check out "Safety and recommendations" section on their website, it's very clear and informative.
Price: The best price you can get is if you purchase on their website at least 21 days in advance (don't forget to bring your printed ticket and ID). Bonus: they'll send you coupons for other activities like Chichen itza tour and Xcaret park) and 10% discount on their photos.
Transportation. I don't think that their transportation is worth it. We took a "colectivo" (local public minibus) from Puerto Aventuras and paid 30 pesos (taxi would cost 280 pesos) instead of paying $32 to the park. 
Pictures: If you have GoPro or at least waterproof case for your phone - bring it with you. They say that you can't use a selfie stick on ziplines but they mean that you can't unfold it because of safety. It's totally fine to hold your GoPro on a short stick or put in on your helmet. In my opinion, it's ridiculous to pay $60 for their photos. However, their system is great and automatic so the choice is yours.
Have fun!
The first park we played in Cancun. The best one in the park is the zip-lines, the vehicle is good too. The cenote rafting is ok.

What a trip! Zip lining at night, through canopy, with fireballs. Need I say more?

The cavern swim was super fun too. 

The Buffet was stellar as well. Try the ribs!!

We visited Xplor park on a chilly day but it was a blast nonetheless! The ziplines required everyone to walk up tons of stairs but it was so worth it. Did all the activities and had a great time doing all of it!
Обязательно возьмите с собой обувь и одежду для нахождения в воде. Там всё продается конечно, но на семью будет очень дорого. Еду можно не брать, обед очень разнообразный и качественный.
Awesome place! Amazing zip lines, caves(cents) are beautiful. A great day for all! My boys had a great time. Ages 13/10/8 ! Great fun for adults too!
Excelente experiencia para todos. Recomendado para loa teens. Todas las atracciones buenisimas y divertidas

Lindo parque com atividades aéreas e subterrâneas. Pacote com alimentação incluída e uso de snorkel e outros equipamentos. Não gostei do método de fotos pois ao baixar acabam vindo fotos ruins e de outras pessoas.
It is not cheap place but at the and it’s worth it. The food is great too you have so many options to choose from

I love this place... Awesome time. The staff is super friendly and helpful. 

Not one complaint. If your thinking about it. Don't think just so. You won't regret it.

I will say this is more of an adventure Park. So not for the faint of heart. But not crazy either.

Este parque cuenta con 5 actividades principales: recorrido en buggy (2 opciones), tirolesa (2 recorridos), nado por túneles subterráneos, remo en río submarino (no apto para novatos e impacientes) y acuatizaje en hamaca (tal vez la actividad menos interesante). Si tienes el tiempo suficiente y no hay tanta gente recomiendo hacer las dos rutas de tirolesa que son distintas una de la otra. Cuenta con un excelente restaurante tipo buffet con buen surtido de platos, una amplia tienda donde se compran bonitos souvenires. Altamente recomendado comprar el servicio de fotografía, pero hay que verificar después de la compra que el numero de los cascos concuerde con los números que aparecen en el ticket de compra para evitar que te envíen fotos de otros grupos. No recomendable para personas de avanzada edad.

Overall, this excursion was great! It was the only one we did during our trip, as the other ones trip advisor recommended didn’t peak our interest. 

This was a fun excursion for couples. We did the nighttime Xplore and it was great, as the presence of children was few and far between (very ideal for us) (note: we are 22 and 31). 

You MUST do the zip line first. This is to ensure it is still light out to see the scenery. If you wait, you will be EXTREMELY cold and won’t see a thing. The zip line was a highlight for us!! Note: you WILL get wet. There’s no way around this, as the last line back to the main park ends with a big splash in a water basin. 

ATV vehicles: this was awesome and thrilling! The ATVs went pretty fast and it seemed to be more thrilling, as the paths were narrow and terrain was rough. It was awesome! It got cold though. Unless there is no one else in line with you for this activity, you will get held up by slower people ahead of you. This was pretty annoying but it was awesome. Felt rugged and very adventurous. Also a top activity for us that we wish we did again. Note: you will also get wet if you fly through the puddles, if not, bring a sweatshirt as it’s cold in the dark forest! 

Rafts: it was very warm in the caves on the rafts, which was nice. Got slightly woozy toward the end. You paddle your own raft with handheld small paddles that look like sandals attached to your hands. Kind of goofy but effective for the most part. The stalactites and stalagmites are really cool. 

River swim: There’s a 5 minute route or a 30 minute route. We opted for 5 minute route, as the water was really cold. The life jackets made it very hard to move. The end of the route you go in a sort of man made waterfall area and it’s hard to get through as it comes right down on you in a large area and it’s disorienting. We only did this activity to be able to say we did all of the activities but I’d skip this if we came to Xplore again. The raft ride gives you the same ambiance without the hassle of getting soaking wet and freezing cold. 

Restaurant: surprisingly impressive spread! Served buffet style and there was something for everyone. A couple of salad choices, different meats, pastas, salad/veggie bar, fruit, desserts, warm drinks, etc.

Photography: We refused to pay $60 for the iffy quality photos that were taken of us throughout the trip. It was fun posing for the 25+ photo stations, but we opted to just enjoy the moment and rely on our memories. Xplore sells waterproof cases to enable people to take their own photos but we didn’t do this either. These gimmicks were $30. Not worth it. You can do it, but I wouldn’t advise it. I would trust a piece of plastic to protect my $1000 iPhone, especially as all activities you get very wet in. No thanks. 

Wardrobe: many reviews say do not wear flip flops but that’s what we did and it work out great. We held them around our wrists on the zip line and took them off while swimming. I’m not one for water shoes, but those would work well too (note: Keens, Tevas, or Crocs would do well here). Again, you’ll be cold during the night Xplore. I wouldn’t advise wearing just a swim suit. I wore all dry-fit clothes and a suit underneath. This was probably the best option, even though I hate walking around soaked in clothes but that’s the nature of this beast. 

Terrain: if you are not in shape, do not come to Xplore. There is a ton of walking and the zip line experience would be nearly impossible for you. It was tough enough for me as a 22 year old. I was huffing and puffing after climbing each of the 9 zip line towers. I would recommended this to the older crowd either. You may find the walkways very slippery and frightening.

Our family of 5 active teenagers last visited Xplor 5 years ago. It was good then, and excellent now. They have made massive needed improvements to really make it great.  So let's start. Get to thsee park early.  It "opens" at 9. We pulledinto the parking lot at 8:15am.  We had prepaid but it still takes a while to get started.  Head to check in which takes some time to get helmets, bands, lockers and your photo package (more on that later). That took 20 minutes plus a nice long walk to the lockers. We put everything in the lockers and already had swim trunks and water shoes on.  You can buy the cheap water shoes before you go or invest in nice ones which we did. It pays off. They also sell them at Xplor.  You will need water shoes and you will be wet almost the entire time at the park. We always do ziplines first. They are great and amazing and really fun.  Now, let's be smart here. We saw plenty of 8-10 year old kids screaming because they didn't want to go and families backtracking down the lines becuase the parents felt the kids would be ok once thy got there. Think with your brain please. Second, if you can't walk 0 floors down your office building during a fire drill, then back to your desk without needing a 30 minute rest this is not for you. There is a lot of stair climbing. And there are some serious STEEP climbs up some ladders when you get to the tops of certain towers. If you are fit, no problem. Saw plenty of elderly and out of shoe people turning back. Some wearing loafers.  We did thnot ziplines twice even though they have a sign saying you only have the "right" to do the activity once. It was a slow day and they didn't care. On to the ATV vehicles. It's smart to avoid the river swim at this point becuase your legs need a rest. The ATVs are much improved. You need to be 18 to drive. They do eyeball it and you don't need to take your ID unless you look really young and want to drive. There are no singl drivers, minimum of 2 in an ATV and max of 4. You will get wet here as well. There are two tracks and one goes through a huge waterfall and crosss a number of standing water pools. Very cool. We did the the water fall track first then went back and did the other track after lunch. YES, the ATVs are bumpy. What did you expect?  But, they are really fun. The good part about doing the ATV in this order is the lunch buffet is right outside the exit so we sat down and had a wonderful lunch which was included with admission. Plenty to eat and everyone was stuffed. Off to the underground river. You don't really swim as it is shallow enough for an adult to walk in waist/chest high water. But, water shoes would be really smart here. No snorkels or fins.  It's more scenic than anything. There is an area where bats live and fly around and hang from the ceiling. Very cool.  Now pictures. If you buy the photo package in advance it is well worth it. They have cameras all over the park on the ziplines, ATV and rivers that take wonderful pictures all by scanning your wristband.  We had over two hundred pictures from the day so well worth it. We also had a water camera and the photo deal is much better. We did not do the rafts and hand paddles section of the river. Doesn't seem smart and lots of work. We headed to the showers, cleaned up and left exhausted but thrilled from the fun we had. Everyone was tired but happy that we did it. Will do again in the coming years.
hay muchas cosas en las que podria mejorar, calidad de alimentos y bebidas por ejemplo, es muy agradable el recorrido.

Es un parque excelente. Repetiría la experiencia sin dudar! Las tirolesa muy seguras y la comida excelente. Recomendable para toda la familia, en mi grupo iban niños, adolescentes, adultos y abuelos y todos disfrutamos al máximo.
очень интересное и захватывающее местечко. советую всем посетить. занимает целый день, т.к. парк огромный.
Un dia completo de aventura la recomendación es llegar temprano para disfrutar todas las atracciones que presenta el parque

Xel-Ha is a great place. Not cheap but you can spend the entire day there with various activities and food/ drink is all included. We went snorkelling, tubing down the river, ziplining, zip-biking through the jungle, swam with a dolphin (extra $).

The actual park was great, well laid out and a lot of fun for our family. It is on the pricer side but i believe the night version is cheaper. You can bring your own adventure camera like gopro but if you go to the night excursion you will most likley not be able to get great pics yourself due to lack of lighting. So my family purchased the photos that they take all throughout the resort which we also paid a lot of money for. Now its been almost a month and i am still hounding them for my photos. They replied only 2 times, and sent me one of my photos to confirm they were mine and then never replied again.  I paid a lot of money to go on this trip and then for the photos and I would like to have the captured memories with my family. Unfortunately this has left a very poor taste for me. I go to Mexico every year and I always go on a XPLOR excursion and i believe this year will be my last. Very Sad.

A quien le guste la aventura y la naturaleza tiene que visitar este parque ya que se encuentra perfectamente integrado dentro de los arboles.

Se necesita todo el día para hacer todas las actividades. Todas son increíbles y la comida (bufet) está riquisima.

El único punto negativo es que solo puedes hacer una vez cada actividad aunque haciendolas todas agotas el tiempo del día.

Lo recomiendo totalmente.

We had a good time and got all inclusive with food which I recommend. But also we wish we knew 3 things. 
Bring water shoes towels and change of clothes. 
Ziplines is the highlight. Get full fast so u may want to do it 1st. You only get to go 1 time. 
It was good. Not great.

Vale a pena ir, principalmente para quem gosta de aventura e esportes radicais. Você anda o tempo todo com capacete e tem 14 descidas de tirolesa. Muito bom, porém muitas subidas e fica um pouco cansativo. Vista linda.

If you want a really great blast day with your group/family, this is it! We had so much fun here! The park is clean, well laid out, well-staffed, and directional signs are everywhere. There are dressing rooms, locker rooms, restrooms, a gift shop, a fabulous buffet, and even a juice and coffee bar in the middle of the jungle! We loved the numerous ziplines that were very fast, the amphibious vehicles, the water slide, the underground river rafts, and the underground swim. It's not cheap; we had to pay around $149 US because we didn't buy in advance. It's $108 US if you buy directly from their XPLOR website.  If you want to see what it's like, there's a 19-minute video on YouTube; just Google it.
Muy buen lugar....

This place is amazing!  It is definitely a fun filled day.  We had the best time.  We loved the zip lines.  They are very high and fast but also provide gorgeous views.  The waterfalls ones are really great too.  Be warned you will get very wet.  I wish I had packed a wetsuit jacket because most of the place is shaded so when you're wet and not in the sun - it can be pretty chilly.  We loved the underground caves.  Go left if you want the longer routes on both the rafting and swimming.  The caves are gorgeous and a real natural phenomenon.  The ATV rides are pretty incredible too.  They take you through caves and waterfalls - it's so fun.  
We were there on a cruise tour excursion so I just wish I could have stayed longer!
Me encantó...

Coches anfibio, rutas de ríos a nado o en balsa, las tirolesas son lo mejor, las dos rutas. Estarás mojado todo el tiempo, así que procura ropa que se seque rápido, zapatos de agua indispensables, NO LO PIENSES, definitivamente vale su precio. 

TIPS: 
1. Zapato de agua indispensable, traje de baño.
2. Lleva ropa para cambiarte e irte seco al hotel.
3. Si tienes go pro, llévala!!!!
4. Tiene descuento para mexicanos si compras anticipadamente en la página de internet.
Fue un gran parque! Lo único malo que vitarlo en enero no es recomendable, pasamos mucho frío ya que es un parque con actividades en agua! Todo lo demás excelente. Es imperdible!!!

It is great for a day activity, I don’t recommend the night one at this time of the year cause it can be cold. There are zip lines, buggies, canoes and a river to swim. The food in the buffet has a big variety and it tastes great! Very recommended for families with small children or couples.

A really cool trip, bus pick up and transfer was easy with friendly staff. The park itself is fascinating ,with stalactites and stalagmites, the ziplining is cool and the amphibious vehicles are really good fun! The food and drinks are amazing and everything is well signposted . After catching the first bus at 7am and transferring, we arrived at the park at 9am, pickup was at 5. The day was probably a little too long in all honesty, but it was a very good day out and good value for money. I would recommend for couples and families - very child friendly

Es un imperdible de la zona, vale cada peso que gastes, los alimentos deliciosos, pertenece al grupo Xperiencias Xcaret por lo que en su pagina puedes encontrar promociones. El precio es alrededor de 100 dolares, toma en cuenta que es un parque todo incluido que no incluye bebidas alcoholicas; las fotos que te ofrecen seguro encontraras una que te guste.
Recomendable ir con los amigos.

Hola saludos, mi opinión: es un parque  principalmente para las personas que gustande la adrenalina en agua y tirolesa, pero tienen un regalo de la naturaleza las grutas, agua, estalactitas y todaa increibles en fin todas las actividades son muy buenas, así como el personal son muy profesionales y con un trato digno con sus visitantes, eso merece UNA FELICITACIÓN!

Io e il mio ragazzo abbiamo visitato questo parco nel mese di Agosto durante la nostra vacanza, che dire.. Ci siamo divertiti un casino! Abbiamo trascorso una bellissima giornata tra risate e quant’altro. Ottimo il buffet, ci ha sorpreso, meglio di quanto potessimo mai aspettarci! Abbiamo acquistato il pacchetto foto che ci ha regalato dei ricordi magnifici, ovviamente il prezzo è un po’ alto. Noi abbiamo acquistato tutto online, così da ottenere un po’ di sconto. Ps. Ricordatevi di portavi un cambio perché ci si bagna parecchio, le scarpette per gli scogli a noi si sono rilevate molto utili!

This place was amazing. Me and my dad are adventurous and love doing things outside of the hotels and this adventure park was perfect. It had so many activities and it was a perfect place to go to spend the day.
Me encantan las aventuras y atracciones con naturaleza.  Es un lugar muy divertido el tiempo pasa muy rápido pero con mucha diversion.  Tienes que ir con amigos y disfrutar de todas las atracciones.

My family of 5 and I went to XPLOR on Christmas Day. It was crowded, but not overwhelming. I would recommend doing the zip-lines first in the morning so it isn't too hot and you can get wet by the end. They took all morning from 9-12pm. Lunch was buffet style and had very fresh food. They had a lot of options and a grill. The dessert options and ice cream weren't good. After lunch, we did rafting, river swim, then amphibious cars and finally hammock swing. Rafting wasn't that much fun, there were 30 min and 15 min options. The river swim was cool, but cold. It ended in a cenote. Amph vehicles were fun, they didn't go too fast but you can go in cave, through water, over bridges. My sister and I liked the hammock swing. 

I would recommend women/girls where shorts and a bikini tops with sneakers. Men can wear board shorts and sneakers. There's a bit of walking on the zip-lines and the river swim had a sharp bottom floor. 

Great day activity!

Came here as a cruise excursion and loved every minute of it. Karla, our guide, was great! Definitely recommend you bring comfortable shoes and a change of clothes as you will get wet. You will be exhausted at the end of the day!

Having done a whole day at Xplor, it was the best day of our 3 week holiday by far! Here are some top tips that we learnt throughout the day-
1. Buy tickets online/ at the entrance. Lots stalls/ shops in the streets claiming they can get you cheap entry but having compared both, the official website in advance (7 days or more) gets you a good discount.
2. Take water shoes. It’s a lot of walking on wet floors and getting soaked throughout the day. 
3. take a towel and leave in your locker. You can’t walk around and use the attractions with a towel so leave it in your locker and head back if you need to dry or warm up.
4. Take waterproof camera! The photo package is quite expensive, $70 for two people. The images did look good but we prefer to take our own.
5. The buffet lunch is really good, compared to the other parks in the area. If you are hungry enough, you can eat and drink your way through the price tag pretty easily. 
6. Do the zip lines early, we absolutely flew through and didn’t have to wait. When we saw the line after lunch it was quite long and a waste of time when you could be having fun. 
7. If it’s not due to be a really hot day, wear wet suit or suitable water clothes. It rained in the afternoon and I was cold in a bikini all day. 
8. Have fun! It’s the best park in Playa by a mile and we loved it.
Had lots of fun with the family and to pick the best part of it would be very hard.  The ziplining was good and so were the water activities.

We are in route to the Xplor Adventure Park. We were contacted and briefed by Fabian, the guide from Xplor.  Free food all day, free drinks, fres lockers, free equipment, and all helmets. No towels are provided, so you may need one.  We filled out the incident waivers on the bus enroute to the park. When we arrived at the park we had to exchange the family waiver document for family helmets and locker keys to secure everything that we brought with us. WEAR YOUR HELMET!! My wife took hers off when leaving the park and struck her head on the ceiling, sooo, don't do that! 
-You will need water shoes (any type that covers your foot like a shoe)
-‎You will need a swim suit: guys may want the shorts type with a speed dry type shirt; girls may want to have boy type shorts on their bottom and  sturdy top that will not come off when dragged in the water by zip line.
-‎Water proof camera or water proof bag that floats for your cellphone to bring it with you to take pictures in the park. They will try to sell you one at the park for $45. They are $5 at any department store.
-‎GoPro like camera is a great option I used. You can always buy the camera package they offer for $100 USD which will provide all your pictures in digital format to your email address when you leave.
-‎There's a juice bar that opens early and has various fruits out to snack on in the morning if you missed breakfast.
-‎The zip line portion of the park is an activity that stretched from tower to tower taking all of 40 seconds to reach the next tower. There are quite a few stairs and a lot of climbing up and down for someone who has limited mobility. 
-‎The Amphibious Vehicles are not that fast, but do travel under ground and through waterways, water falls, and water holes. 
-‎Lunch was free at El Troglodita for everyone and included in the admissions price. The meal was a buffet and it was great option for any family to have with picky kids in tow. 
-‎You will need a set of dry clothes and possibly other sneakers to leave the park. Walking in the wet ones could cause you to fall as my wife did as a result of the slick surfaces encountered during the trip in the park. Soooo, don't do that.
-‎There is a paddle boat experience that would be good to tire out the kids, but bad for adults who are not in paddle boat condition for (15) minutes. Definitely send the kids on this one, ALONE, and meet them on the other side when they are dog tired, huffing and puffing. That's the best type of kid to bring home!!

Hace 15 días estamos tratando de hacernos de nuestras fotos por las cuales abonamos Uds 85. Preciosas salvo por el ínfimo detalle que pertenecen a otras personas. Hecho el reclamo no las encuentran, nos han preguntado por el número de casco que llevábamos, como estabamos vestidos, etc (verdaderamente hay que tener un gran sentido del humor). Lo otro bien opacado por lo comentado.
Amazing Experience...
We went to this park twice during our vacation... in January wasn’t crowded at all, we were able to get into everything!!! Really cool, my 5yr old loved the amphibious cars...
Lastima el frio...

Me and my husband went here, we got our tickets online so all we had to do was get the helmets. 

Zip lines- These were good, me and my husband only done one route as once you have done the tallest one they are all pretty much the same! 

The water rafting - me and my husband had a lot of fun with this activity, you have hardly any control over the raft so bash into a lot of the rocks but he made it really funny, if you don’t take it serious it is fun and really nice scenery. 

Hammock splash - me and my husband loved this activity, we thought it was the best thing there, it’s so fun! 

The 4x4 car ride - the first time my husband drove and it was really fun and we had a good time. The second time really put a downer on the day. My husband said I should have a go driving the car, so the second time I went, the woman at the start was perfectly fine until my husband said “so if we need to change drivers we can pull over in the safe parts and swap” with that she got rude and started saying do you drive, I said no but I have had lessons, she then started being really rude and started saying if we crash we will have to pay for the damages. Which the cars are battered anyone. No where does it say you need to know how to drive or no one tells you that. I understand health and safety and all that but we are decent people and if they had said to me it’s safer if your husband drives I would have been fine with that but they said go, so we drove off. Someone was tailgating us as soon as we set off which really annoyed us, we pulled over to let them pass not even driving for 5 minutes and we discovered it was one of their workers. She come over to us and said “ SWAP” really abruptly. Which myself and my husband was taken back because no hello or is everything ok, she was saying I was all over the road which wasn’t true because the thing barely even moved it was so slow. We moved and my husband drove which she was still tale gating is most of the way until my husband got pissed off and started driving quicker then we lost her. 

I really do understand health and safety and would have been fine with swapping but her attitude really was unacceptable and rude, and no one explained anything about if a staff member wants you to pull over or not so we didn’t know.

So overall was some fun activities but for the price so over rated.
Very organized. Handles...

Certa vez que estive em cancun não fiz questão de ir neste parque, mas nesta última vez vejo que me arrependi de não ter ido, minha esposa, eu e mais amigos, nos divertimos o dia inteiro, tem bastante coisa para fazer, e aconselho começar o dia nas tirolesas. Só nas tirolesas irá se divertir por horas.
Exelente tienes q...

I came here with my parents and two of my siblings and we all found it enjoyable. The activities were unlimited and I did all of them except the ATV ride and hammock zip line. The only reason why I didn’t do those activities was because it was cold that night and I just wanted to stay warm and dry up. The only activity I did somewhat regret was the cave swim. The water is pretty deep and swimming with a life jacket can be tiresome and exhausting so we ended up taking the shortcut.

The buffet was surprisingly good and surpassed my expectations. My only suggestion for people who choose to visit Xplor is to make sure you wear water shoes, not sneakers because almost all the activities involve getting wet or require you to be submerged in water. I would also recommend that you wear board shorts too if you don’t want to walk around in a bathing suit only.
El mejor parque...

Our teenage kids loved this place!  And, so did the adults!  It's a great place to try out zip lining if you've never gone before.  Make sure you buy your tickets with the photo pass online.  There's a discount for advance purchase, and the photo pass costs way less online if you book as a group over the internet.  Also, the amphibious vehicles can only be driven by those 18 years and over.  If your teen looks younger, it's a good idea to bring photo ID.  Our 18 year old was not allowed to drive and that was upsetting.  All in all, we had the best time here.  Food & drinks are available all day.

There were 8 of us in the group and we had a great time.  We've gone ziplining in Cancun before but not here.  These ziplines were WAY better then what we did the last time.  The vehicle drive was pretty cool, we were stuck behind some slow pokes but it was alright.  Water was cold in the river swim (we took the long route) but I don't regret it for a second.  We loved this place and it's a memory we'll never forget. 

A nice feature is there are cameras literally everywhere.  You can take as much pictures as you want and download them after the trip.  The included lunch buffet was also delicious, tons of food choices.  Make sure to bring water shoes.

What an awesome place and quite the adventure.  Thanks for a great time!

Activité qui vaut la peine pour le long parcours de tyroliennes  et les rivières souterraines. Les infrastructures du site sont intéressantes. Attendez vous à passer une bonne partie de la journée à l'ombre.
Worth the money...
Rewelacyjna organizacja i urozmaicona oferta. Nie warto wycieczki kupować w hotelach . W punktach sprzedaży na ulicy w Playacar o 40% taniej . Wspaniałe spędzony dzień

This part has so many great options, we choose to go at night.  It was spooky yet breath taking.  The Zip Line was cool, we got to see the sunset as we went from tower to tower.  The Heart beats to keep you always coming back to the middle.  My favorite part was the under ground river swimming.  Felt like we were really exploring.  Recommend for families, hoping to bring our boys 14 and 12 back with us this winter.

Una vida llena...

We took our family of 6; 3 adults, 3 kids-16,13,11. Super amazing time! Easily accessible by all of us. I highly recommend making time to go here. Food was good and tons of selection! Well organized. Felt safe throughout! My mom lost her ring, so I’d suggest leaving valuables at home. Praying they find it still. Overall, a must go see & play. Bring a waterproof phone case. Thanks for a great time.

Xplor was different than other amusement parks.  It was definetly something my 3 boys ages, 11, 17 and 18 enjoyed.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants adventure in a truly untraditional sense.
Fabuloso si no...

Xplor y Xcaret fabulosos Xelha aburrido los bufets regulares.
Snorkeling was amazing as was everything else. Suggest your own snorkel gear as their gear was a bit worn out .

Wow!  What a great day at Xplor.  My first time doing a zip line - conquered my fear and did both circuits!  Loved the underground river swim, beautiful stalactites and stalagmites everywhere.  Everything about the park is great. Tips - wear water shoes, buy the photo package, grab a snack before you leave the park because all food in the park is free, but as you leave you have to pay for drinks and popcorn/chips.  Glad we waited to do this until the day before going home because we are sore and tired.  Great end to our Cancun vacation celebrating our 25th anniversary!

Xplor is one of the best adventure parks that I’ve been to. I loved the way the attractions are intertwined with each other, and you keep getting surprised throughout the day. The zip lines are a true adrenaline rush taking you up up up with each line until you’re able to see the entire park. What a view! The ATVs take you on a real life Indiana Jones ride through the jungle, across swinging bridges, and dark caves. The raft and river swim attractions are done so well with the lighting and let you truly enjoy the beauty of the underground caves. Since the restaurant and refreshment counters provide all included drinks and food, you never have to worry about carrying your wallet. Highly recommend purchasing the photo package as there are cameras all through the park taking photos of you in action! As others have suggested, do the zip lines first thing, then the ATVs, lunch, river float and swim. Make sure you do this one if you’re in th area!
El parque está buenísimo. Muy bien cuidado. Las actividades valen todas la pena hacerlas. Solo mi hijo mas chico se asusto en las tirolesas. Que son increíbles!
Lugar simplesmente maravilhos, comida gostosa, recomendo, não vi nenhum ponto negativo.
No olvides llevar water shoes porque los vas a necesitar.  Los coches anfibios y el hamacuatizaje valen la pena.  La comida no es muy buena.
Totally recommended we had a lot of fun in all the activities. We went on September and we didn’t make any file every experience was perfect!

Many zip lines, and adventure in wheels, in water and lot´s of nature. I loved the adventures. I felt safe and we had lot´s of fun!. You will need to arrive early, to get in all activities!!! It is better to stay all day. The buffet is the biggest/best served that I have seen ever!. Very nice quality and variety of beverages and food.
Fuimos con mi nieto y mi hija, nos divertimos a la par de ellos, en todas las atracciones. Nos encanto a todos por igual grandes y chicos

This place was amazing and run about as efficiently as Disney World! We had an unbelievable time. The place was immaculate and the grounds were absolutely stunning. Even my six-year-old went on the zip line and had a great time. We did everything that they had to offer. The zip lines, the ATV ride, The underwater cave swimming and rafting etc. The buffet lunch was extraordinary with the selection. And the place where they had refreshments for you had the most unbelievable juice bar. They had delicious choices of drinks and blended juices to try. They also had a whole array of different coffee drinks and hot chocolate. My advice is to arrive at least 15 to 20 minutes before it opens. We got there at about 8:45 AM and we went on our first zip lineAt about 9:45 AM. It just takes a while to register get your helmets put your stuff in the lockers get suited up for the zip lining etc. we stayed there all day and left at about 5 PM. It really was a spectacular day and we highly recommend it!

I am over 64 years old and thoroughly enjoyed the zip lines. It was raining very heavily as we were in the middle of a thunderstorm but it was great fun although somewhat wet. The whole park is fantastic even in the rain. The reason I only give it 4 stars is because the ATV experience is pretty useless as you are not allowed to go over 20 miles an hour and there are no life guards in the underground pool. There are some at the beginning and some at the end, but if you get into difficulty half way round you're left to your own devices.

This place is for the adventure enthusiasts for sure. They have unbelievable zip lines, quad trails, rafting and so much more! It was raining the whole time we were there and we didn’t even notice because we were having so much fun!  The food was great....huge buffet style with tons of options to choose from!  FYI all of the tours in this area make you have environmentally friendly sunscreen and bug spray and yes they check your bottles of it and so I recommend buying some before you get to the parks cause the stuff they sell there is crazy expensive!  I brought baby sunscreen and they were totally fine with it!

It was a very fun day with about 15 other people.  The zip lines were my favorite, but I also loved the all-terrain vehicles & I had fun paddling through the cave.  It's good to wear a swim suit with board shorts that can dry quickly & take dry clothes to change into.  We took their bus, but were ready to leave well before they were to pick us up & took a cab back instead.
When to Explor park in the early evening great fun and the zip lines where awesome, would definitely go again

We ignored the bad reviews and decided to go and see for ourselves. I am glad we did. The park is clean. The rides are awesome. The zip lining is amazing!! We had a great day. So much adventure in one place.

The buffet food is very good. No complaints. 

Would 100% recommend it. The only negative was the ticket process which took a while but everything after that made up for it.

Este parque é muito bom para quem gosta de uma diversão como tiroleza, nado em cenotes, andar em cavernas, andar com uma especie de bug e gosta de comer a vontade! Além de tantas atrações que toma fácil o dia todo há um buffet de comidas a vontade muito farto, variado e gostoso. Os funcionários são todos simpaticos e passam muita segurança! Recomendo muito a visita!
Xplor es un parque interesante para este lugar y para pasar un día verdaderamente diferente. Es divertido en familia y con amigos , solo o en grupo. Es entusiasmante al punto de querer volver.

My family of 4 had a great time.  I didn't know if my 9 year old would like it but he loved it. We did a lot of tandem rides together.  Important - Bring aqua socks or water shoes. They sell them for about $30 but Walmart has them for about 1/2 of this price.  You could go barefoot but it is not as comfortable.  You end up in the water so tennis shoes are not the way to go.  We did a tour bus but arrived early and did both zip line options first.  We had no waiting in line!  It was great.  Then we did the swim through the cenotes.  The cenotes are so beautiful and large.  You even drive the ATVs through them.  The water in the cenote is cold but doable.  The paddling of the rafts was difficult with a 9 year old but then some adults really struggled too.  We ate lunch and then did the ATVs.  It really fills your day and if it is busy you might not be able to complete all the activities.  It was pricy but it was the favorite part of the vacation.  The people in charge of the zip lines were very careful and we felt very safe.  The "smoothies" had some unique flavors.  They were not my favorite.
Great place to go in Playa del Carmen, we choose the night pass, this is the place for some action..

Fomos com uma criança de 6anos e uma adolescente de 15 anos. Vá de sapatilha própria para praia ou um calçado do estilo papete. Na compra do ingresso, já está incluso a refeição, bebidas (há um local onde fica disponível suco e água) e o transporte. Portanto, não há necessidade de levar dinheiro (somente se quiser os souvenir). Exigem a utilização de protetor solar e repelente biodegradável. Caso você não tenha, eles comercializam lá. Leve  documentos e uma toalha (para uma ducha após o passeio). Na entrada você deverá deixar seus pertences no armário.
As atividades são super seguras e muito radicais!!
Recomendo o passeio!

Fun thrilled adventure park with 5 different activities you can choose from.  Two different zip line courses with about 8 lines in each course.  Raft through cenotes.  Swim through cenotes.  ATV course is fun and takes about 25 min give or take per route.
The layout can be pretty confusing when you arrive since it is the off season and they are not fully staffed.  The entrance seemed very gloomy and quiet.  Not too much direction in where to start or where to go to check in.  They also allow smoking near the lockers which is horrible being that it is a nature and eco friendly park.  I didn't eat at the restaurant but you get a meal included with your entry.

Highlights are the Ziplines, rafting through the caves and the buggies. Buggies were loads of fun and much longer than expected each track 5+KM through waterfalls, caves and river crossings...you get wet!  Paddling through the caves was extraordinary. Would never get to see something like this up close in the US...you get wet. And finally the Ziplines. Awesome and terrifying!  6-7 interconnected towers take you all over the park and then though a waterfall...you get wet.  Unlike any experience I have done. A must-do.
Es muy bueno si te gusta la aventura, las tirolesas y el vértigo. El río es bueno si quieres algo tranquilo y el nado entre las estalactitas igual. Sólo hay un restaurante.
Este parque es el mejor de todo Cancun las atracciones son de adulto y el restaurante lo máximo, todo es muy bueno.
We were busy the entire day with activities! The underground rivers were the best part in my opinion! I wish we would have had time to do them a second time.

zipline понравился хотя это развлечение на час-полтора. Еще можно минут 20-30 можно потратить на покатушки на джипах. Остальные развлечения парка меня не то что не впечатлили, я бы скорей категорически не рекомендовал их к посещению ибо это бессмысленное и разочаровывающее времяпрепровождение. Неплохое питание на территории парка.
В целом если без очередей то развлечение на два часа а по соотношению цена/качество максимум 2,5 балла

I went to this park last year and really enjoyed it.  I am an old lady, so I thought it was impressive that I was able to do 14 zip lines.  It is well laid out, and they are very concerned about safety.  When they put you in the harness they do not let go of you until you take off.  I thought is would be a bit scary, but it was easy, and sooo fun.  Great underground water ways you can explore on a boat, all in very well done.  Not cheap, but they give you a lot for your money.

From driving through caves in the amphibious vehicles to zip lining across the jungle canopy before landing in water at the end. It’s a hell of an experience. Swimming through real caves before an all you can eat buffet and drink why more could you want.

Not for people wanting a relaxing day, best done on a day that is warm but maybe a bit of cloud to keep the sun off.

If you are lucky enough to get a quiet day you will have an even better time

Andar de noche en la selva con los anfibios o carritos diseñados para lugares de difícil acceso llena de adrenalina la tiroleza y pasar por cuebas von estalactitas ,súper maravilloso toda  una experiencia .les contaría más pero mejor tenien q vivirlo

Fui a Xplor y me encanto, en el grupo que con el que iba había unas personas que eran mas grandes que nosotros y pensamos que no se iban a subir a las tirolesas y para nuestra sorpresa las disfrutaron como niños.

No importa la edad que tengan la gente se divierte en el parque.

Un parque de aventura muy bello, la comida no es tan buena pero las actividades si .
Es un parque algo caro y pequeño pero vale la pena , en un día logras realizar todas las actividades . El río con estalactitas es simplemente hermoso , recuerden llevar camisas térmicas y zapatos de agua y con solo esto pasarás un día fenomenal .

With a focus on hitting the ziplines, cave walk/swim and cave canoe, plus one side by side ride, the day flew by!  Buffet was great.  

Side by side: Really, really slow.  I would leave that for last, and ensure you have done everything first.  Ziplines were top notch; great views and good arrests (I am 250 lbs, and hit those stops HARD!).  No issues.

Fui con mi hijo de 12 años sin saber bien a donde iba en realidad, fue sin ver ni leer folleto, nos vendieron el paquete en el hotel y nos fuimos. Muy buenas las atracciones, las tirolesas muy buenas, el anfibio excelente y divertido y nadar por cuevas de noche (iluminadas) es algo muy bueno realmente. Recomendable pero para ene grande sin niños.

Went here with a small group from 12 to 60. Be prepared for lots of waking up stairs but it's so worth it once you see the views from the zip lines. The dune buggies were my favorite part. If you don't want to be wet right before you leave then don't do the zip lines last as the very last zip line takes you into a large pool of water.

This is a for sure YES for your bucket list. I never had so much fun in all my life. I cannot wait to go do this again. Zip lines, driving ATV's over bridges, in & out of caves, swimming in a cave and did I mention caves? The whole center HUB is in the CAVE!  And I have a fear of heights but with these sip lines I didn't fear a thing.

Wasn't the hottest day but that didn't matter.  Really surprised how efficient all the activities were and how the place never seemed overly busy even though we knew there was many, many people there.  The food was great!  I'd recommend leaving the phone/camera in the locker and just focus on using all the in house cameras.  It costs $70 to get all your photos but if you make sure to hit them all, the quality is high and the angles are great.  You can end up with about 100 pics if you really work at it.

How awesome is this place!  We arrived early and got right to doing the Zip lines.  We went through each of the courses which were amazing.  We then went off to the ATV enjoying lunch before going under ground.  I'm a bit claustrophobic, so I opted for the shorter runs of the paddle and swimming underground.  If I did this again, I would go through the longer route for swimming in the caves.  

We were not going to get the pictures as I preferred to go with the experience rather than posing at every photo opportunity.  While we did not pose, there were some great pics and we ended up getting the photos we had at the end of the day.

We wore our suits to Xplor and water shoes all day.  We then changed into our dry clothes at the end of the day as others have mentioned.  The locker setup was excellent and the place is easy to find your way around.  

This is a great tour!
the zip line was our 1st experience wow what a great felling that was. also the cenotes where very nice to visit

Conquered my fear of heights and went on the ziplines - amazing, and yes I was still scared but did it as an almost 50 year old mom of 5 boys.  Had a great day doing all the activities.  Underground river swim is amazing.  ATV ride is fun, not as fast as I thought it would be, but fun going through the caves and jungle.  Make sure you wear water shoes.

realmente el ir a Explor es tener un día lleno de actividad física pero vale la peno sin duda , cuenta con dos tramos de tirolesas estupendas, los carros anfibios son geniales así como el rio subterraneo, les recomiendo los licuados que sirven! son exquisitos!, lleguen temprano para aprovechar todo el parque

Fomos no xplor de dia . O parque é muito grande e existem 2 diferentes tirolesas a escolher ... A mais longa e a mais curta . Escolhemos a mais longa ... Ufa !! Foi um pouco cansativo e tinha muito sol ! Como escolhemos a mais longa e depois fomos almoçar , que aliás um menu bem variado e gostoso !! Conseguimos fazer o carro anfíbio, e logo depois tentamos voltar para fazer a tirolesa de percurso menor , não haveria mais tempo ... Uma pena . O parque as 17:00 já recebe a galera da noite .

We booked this as part of our honeymoon. I’ll be honest, this one was my husbands choice as I’m not an adrenaline lover and wasn’t really looking forward to this. However I quickly changed my mind! It was a brilliant day. I wondered how only 5 activities would fill our day, but most have 2 courses and most last about 30minutes. The food and drink was the best I’ve ever had at anytime of park and the lockers/toilets are brilliant. Such a clean, organised place to visit! We did all the activities and I would defiantly recommend this to anyone, even if it’s not your usual trip
This was the best money we spent on a tour ! It rained 1/4 of the day and made the lines shorter and the rides more fun .Make sure to bring a camera to record the fun
It was outstanding visit, lots to see lots to walk food was great, to many things that you have to pay extra to do

Muy bueno, lo mejor las tirolezas, a mi me gustan actividades de adrenalina moderada como ejemplo parapente, pense que este parque me daria un poco mas de emocion, es muy bueno pero no repetiria, quizas en grupos se disfruta mas por el relajo de todos. Pero quien no lo conozca y le gusten esas actividades lo recomiendo

If you have kids 6 +  you are in the right place. This is something you are going to enjoy as well. Everyone is happy in this park. This place makes you do things about which you dreamed all your life and which   scared you to all the time. I visited this park twice and I am pretty sure that the next time I am in this area I will visit it again.

Thought the price was steep but once we showed up and did the first vehicle activity it was already worth the price! Super cool place, full of caves and underground tunnels. Incredibly built, ridiculous amount of ziplining and caves to explore. Will definitely go back and do the night version!
Nos hemos divertido mucho, las actividades están muy bien organizadas y son geniales. No hubo esperas y todas están incluidas en el ticket de la entrada. No incluye toallas.

We loved this park.  There's ziplining (2 different routes), hammock zip lining, water landings, water slides, amphibious vehicles (2 different long routes through caves, and water, and over bridges), underground river swimming, and rafting.  We bought the picture package and it was awesome.  It's a little expensive- $120 for 5 people.  I just downloaded 250 pictures of which 100 were awesome!  I think they charge $20 a picture there.  Definitely do the picture package!  Can't say enough about this park!
El tour lo ofrecen por 5 horas más o menos, son 4 atracciones que se hacen en dos horas... La comida es deliciosa.

Si vas a playa del carmen y tienes un día disponible para explotarla adrenalina al máximo y saber de lo que eres capaz? No dejes de visitar el parque X-Plor.... es una experiencia de lujo, tirolinas, coches para entrar en las cuevas, nadar en los ríos subterráneos, etc... pasad de todos los parques e ir a este parque!
Super fun and very well run.  Efficient staff.  Thrilling ziplines and great food.  Underground river paddle very peaceful.

I'm really glad I could be there because I enjoyed all activities. We were there in dusk, so zip lines together with lighted towers looked very impressively. The driving carts during the night jungle was such amazing. 

The experience I will remember a very long time!

El parque es un lugar obligado a disfrutar, sólo hay que ir dispuestos a pasar un día empapado de agua, cada actividad termina en el agua salvo el anfibio, aunque está última es una actividad poco atractiva. Es hermoso, navegar en las balsas con las manos porque es muy divertido, desafía la coordinación. Las tirolesas son increíbles!!! Lo más atractivo como así también el nado en el interior de un río subterráneo de aguas cristalinas y de estalactitas, te transporta a un lugar maravilloso!!!. El precio es elevado pero vale la pena pagarlo!!! Podes encontrar promociones si realizas dos excursiones de un 20 % de descuento o 25% si realizas 3 excursiones.

We had a great day zip lining, swimming in an underground river and riding in amphibious vehicles. Zip lines are set up in a very safe manner with nice big decks and a great crew to help you out. Be prepared to get wet throughout the day. Good quality water shoes are highly recommended.

Un parque de diversiones en medio de la vegetación de Playa del Carmen y Cancun. Si estás en Cancún manejarás una hora hasta el lugar . Si estás en Playa del Carmen pues solo unos 15 o 20 minutos. Muy bien organizado. se camina bastante pero cada uno pone su ritmo. Lo más divertido hacer los zip lines (nada peligroso) y para los pequeños las hamacuatizajes.... el nado subterráneo también es una opción . Para ir una vez y divertirse todo un día . Ojo cierra 5 pm . Un Plus ... usar la opción de comida buffett.
O parque é fantástico do início ao fim, as tirolesas os rios as grutas..tudo lindíssimo, quando voltar ao México vou repetir sem duvida.

Xplor was amazing and a MUST if you are in Cancun!  There are five main attractions you can chose from and we did every one and it was highly worth it!  The zip lines are incredible, the underwater caves are beautiful and completely worth it.  They have a good selection of food there as well.  I will be back to Xplor next time I am in Cancun, it is an amazing experience and I HIGHLY recommend, A+
Es tal cual como se promociona todo de primer nivel  y aventuras, excelente para pasar buenas vacaciones, verificar dias que tenga poco publico, por lo general siempre esta completo .
My son got to do the dolphin experience and loved it.  Memories were made that will last a lifetime.  This was fantastic and worth the $$.
Geweest in februari 2015, maar het schrijven van een beoordeling waard. Superleuk om te doen als bijvoorbeeld het weer iets minder is. Leuke activiteiten en gezond en lekker eten.

Fuimos el 5 de enero, un día q amaneció fresco y nublado y como llegamos a las 9 y el sol aún no aparecía, comenzamos con los recorridos en sheeps anfibios, q si manejás despacio cuando pasás por los charcos no te mojás, hicimos los dos recorridos, son muy similiares, creo q si hacen uno está bien!
tomamos unos jugos y batidos en la barra y nos metimos en una psicina natural de agua templada con rocas hermosa q hay al lado del bar de jugos.
Ya siendo las 11 y habiendo calentado el sol nos fuimos a los circuitos de tirolesas, tenés q hacer la misma fila para los dos y cuando entrás elegís, fuimos como casi todos los q estábamos ahí primero a Yaguar que son las más altas, rápidas y secas, te mojas solamente en la última q aterrizás en el agua, en algunos tramos tuvimos q esperar 20 min, tardamos casi dos hs.en hacerlo, no hay baños en el medio y vimos gente q se cansaba de subir escaleras o quería terminar antes y se puede salirse cuando querés, son 7 tirolesas en total, en uno de los tramos ves los yaguares cuando pasás volando, yo fuí con mi hija porque el peso no le alcanzaba para ir sola y estuvo muy divertido ir de a dos! para cada una de las tirolesas tenés q subir bastantes escaleras, eso es lo más agotador! pero también está muy bueno y las vistas son hermosas!!
Salimos y fuimos a hacer el circuito Venado donde había menos gente, así q tardamos una hora, está muy bueno también, te mojás en más tramos y ves los venados cuando pasás volando!
Siendo ya las 14 hs. nos fuimos al buffet a comer, está incluído las veces q quieras igual q los batidos porq tiene sistema all inclusive, nos gustó mucho más q el de Xcaret pero no tan bueno como el Xel ha, habíamos comprado para hacer los 4 parques de experiencias Xcaret.
Luego fuimos a hacer hamacuatizaje q nos encantó y lo repetimos vs veces!
Recorrimos un poco más el lugar, y tomamos y comimos algo antes de irnos. 
Aclaro q fuimos por nuestra cuenta, estabamos hospedados en el centro de PdCarmen y nos tomamos la vans (transporte público q es muy bueno) en la calle 2N y entre Av.15 y 20, q nos salió $25 mex por persona y nos dejó en la puerta.
Para volver un taxi de sitio nos costó $200 mex. Aclaro esto porq para ir en taxi es más barato, sale $150 mex, yo ya había ido a Xcaret y Xense en taxi q están al lado uno del otro, el único alejado es Xel ha.
Muy amables todos los chicos q trabajan en el parque!! Excelente el diseño del lugar, un mantenimiento impecable, instalaciones grandes y hermosas!

We booked our tickets the day before through the travel agent in our hotel.  Our price was higher than booking through the site, but we were doing it last minute.  We took our two sons - age 11 and 15 and this was the highlight of the trip.  Most everything has been covered by other reviews - but a few things to note...
1) take dry clothes
2) take a towel
3) buy the photo package (AND SAVE YOUR RECEIPT AND PHOTO BRACELET!!  We didn't do this and didn't have our download code when we got home and had to call Xplor,etc.  They were fantastic and helped us get our photos but best to avoid all of this).
4) do the 2 zip lines first - this way you avoid the line where you get the gear (there are basically two lines - one to get the gear and fitted and one to get on the zip line).  Both zip lines are great!
5) do the cave rafting last - there is a short option and a long option, so if you run out of time you can do the short version on this one
I would highly recommend this trip!  We are very safety conscious and we always felt very safe and the staff was very professional!

My fiancé and I visited this park in January when the weather was not the best, but we still had an awesome time. Highlight was definitely the zip lines. Prepare to get wet in all the activities, which may not be ideal on a cooler day. 

The rafting was not great, seemed more like hard work then fun but the scenery and surrounds of the underground river were still cool. The ATVs do not go that fast and you are at the mercy of the person in front of you but they are still quite fun.

Other activities such as the river swim and the hammock swing were both good fun and the buffet food was a real treat. 

We would recommend taking water shoes and going on a warmer day

I purchased tickets to this park as a birthday present for my significant other while we were in Mexico - it couldn't have been a better way to spend a birthday!

The park is well maintained, has over a dozen zip-lines, side-by-side vehicles and an underground river. 

The buffet was also excellent.

Volvimos a visitar el parque con la familia y amigos, algunos no habían tenido la oportunidad de visitarlo, como siempre, con mucha adrenalina y diversión dentro del grupo.
Las tirolesas, los vehículos anfibios, el nado en el río comlementan la experiencia de de pasarla bien, aún cuándo no se ha tenido la costumbre.
En las balsas se puede observar el las estalactitas estalagmitas a lo largo del río subterráneo.
La comida es algo que dejamos de último, para poder degustar y relajarse con lo que el bufette ofrece.
No olvidar llevar toalla y una vestimenta extra para poder bañar o combiarse al final de los recorridos (cuando se sale de los ríos) si es el último a visitar, tomando en cuenta que es por la noche.
Great place for a couple or a family. We have been as a couple and with our kids and parents. Lots to do plan on all day with lots of walking. loved it!
I've been to all the parks here and this one is the best in my opinion. A great way to spend an entire day

Fantastic adventure for all the family.
Easy access from playa del carmen. 
Staff are friendly and helpful, your ticket gets you free lunch and soft drinks all day long! Highly recommend this for a fun day out!

My mom, sister and I went during the late session and we enjoyed doing the zip line during the sunset! They recommend water shoes but we wore flip flops and had no issues. Lots and lots of walking! They have a photo package with photo ops allll over, which was very convenient.

maravillosa experiencia, si vas a mexico tienes que ir a xplor y conocer las cavernas, los ríos subterráneos y las tiroteas. Lo mejor de todo es la comida, cuenta con el mejor buffet abierto de mexico

Everything at Xplor is beyond words. 
Pictures do not do it it justice. We did it with a group of us, 3 days ago, and I can't wait to go back. 
I would highly recommend this to anyone!

Xplor é um parque para atividades radicais. Encontram-se, nesse parque, tirolesas (um circuito todo), cavernas, rio subterrâneo, carros anfíbios e muita aventura. É muito legal. O parque é gigante, por isso não tem fila para participar das atração. Almoço com cardápio internacional, muito bom, saboroso e com diversas opções (tem até máquina de sorvete). Em vários lugares do parque tem lugares com preparo de vitaminas e frutas para se servir a vontade. As vitaminas são muito gostosas. Tem armário para guardar as coisas que temos acesso a qualquer momento. Segurança é priorizada com colete e capacetes. Recomendo conhecer esse parque. Certamente voltarei um dia. É preciso ter disposição para passar o dia todo no parque, pois vai ficando cansativo.
Really no words necessary. You CANNOT go to Cancun or Playa del Carmen without going here. Seriously, just do it.

Molto bello ,ben organizzato ci tornerei volentieri è proprio divertente.
Impegna una giornata intera

My husband and I had an amazing time here! It was the highlight of our trip! We booked it thru carnival as a shore excursion. We are going to make a special trip to Cancun and plan on revisiting. Y
Our good guys was named Hugo Banderas and he did a great job of explaining everything for us and he made sure we were good on time to get back on the ship.
First time zip lining was best experience for the whole family from age 8 to age 37 ... we enjoyed all activities

Fomos em uma quinta-feira(11/01/2018). Bem tranquilo. Compramos pelo site 7 dias antes com desconto (demorei para decidir se íamos ou não pelos comentários de que é um parque muito radical), mas resolvemos encarar e sem arrependimentos. Parque organizado e muito limpo. Usamos 2 armários, somos em 4. Uma dica importante, deixe as tirolesas para a tarde, ficamos uma hora e meia na fila de manhã , fomos na mais baixa, super tranquilo, todos iam para a mais alta. No final do dia conseguimos na mais alta, sem ninguém. Comida excelente e a vontade. Só não gostamos do sorvete e nem do café. Deu tempo de ir em todas as atividades até 17 hs. Todos muito divertidos. Eles não fornecem toalhas, tem que levar de casa, caso queiram se trocar.  Enfim, vale a pena, apesar do alto custo.
Estupendo parque que solo os puedo decir que ofrece bellos escenarios naturales y altos estándares de seguridad y mucho mas...........

Xplor park will take up a full days activities.  The underground river raft and swim is excellent and the sights are breathtaking.   Never knew that nature could produce such underground caves that take your breath away.  
The raft ride is good - the short route is ideal.  The long route will appear too long and nor worth the extra 20 minutes.
it wouldn't disappoint you.

This park is amazing! It well organized and feels like your right in the middle of a beautiful jungle! The zip lines were insane but safe! The fee included unlimited beverages and food!The underground raft ride is a must! We used BD Travel they were prompt and knowledgeable.
long lines for zip lines in the morning make it difficult to do all of the attractions in 7 hours. big buffet, clean park. bring bathing suit with change of clothes because you will wet all day
This is a must when visiting Cancun! Best zip line ever and loved the amphibious vehicle. The amazing huge buffet topped it off!
Tirolinas larguísimas y...
Buenissssssimooooo!!!!!!...
Many activities to...
Espetacular. Vale muito...
El mejor de...
It's an excellent...
Très beau parc,...

The Xplor park was the most amazing excursion we did our entire trip to Riviera Maya, Mexico!! Our kids are 13 and 10 and we all did everything the park had to offer. We all had a blast! We went on New Years Day so the park was pretty empty which allowed us to do things more than once. We did the dune buggy trek as a group of four and got to go through caves and across a bridge.  We did the zip lines - that was our favorite part. There are 2 different tours for the zip lines. One has 4 normal landings and 2 water landings (keep your feet up for the water landing for sure). The other has 5 normal zip lines and 1 water landing with 2 rope bridges to cross on foot. You can do both routes included in your admission. We also swam in the underground river (cave) and we did the individual and tandem rafts in the underground river too. You wear a helmet the whole time and as your walk through the caves there are picture spots where your helmet uses a chip to identify back to your photo library along with the zip lines capturing your helmet chip and taking photos of you as you fly through the air. You can purchase your photos at the end (totally worth it). Lunch is included in park admission as well. It is a buffet lunch. Have fun and don’t miss this awesome adventure. Be ready to spend the whole day there. Enjoy!!

We had an amazing time at Xplor. My husband and I chose Xplor over Xcaret as we loved the sound of the zip lines. 

There are 2 zip lines courses you can take, each one has 7 zip lines which can be done by yourself or with a partner. Both feature some water zip lines so expect to get very wet. 

Theres a raft 'ride' where you are on a kayak like boat and are given pedals to steer around the cave, you have two options - either the long route which is around 30 minutes or the short route which is around 10 minutes.

Theres also a swimming 'ride' where you swim through the caves, again with the long and short route. 

We loved the amphibious vehicle ride where you drive around in a 'jeep' like vehicle through water and caves. Its a great laugh.

The buffet is really good with lots of choice. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

Would definitely recommend!

Es la segunda ves que visito este parque , la primera fué hace 5 años y tristemente veo que conforme pasa el tiempo la calidad en el servicio va decayendo.
1) De todas las personas que nos atendieron en las tirolesas , sin mentir la mitad , parecía que te hacían un favor y te trataban de manera seca y mecánica .
2) Hay una chica morenita , un poco gordita de cabello medio largo ( no recuerdo el nombre ) que nos dió el acceso en 2 ocasiones a los 4x4 , que bárbara que manera tan grosera de tratar a la gente , si no le gusta su trabajo no sé qué hace ahí.

Tengo 2 puntos buenos que rescatar:
1) La comida y las estaciones de refrigerios son buenísimas, muy completas y en magnifico estado .
2) Contratamos el servicio de fotografía , por encontrarnos de viaje no pudimos descargar las fotos en el lapso que nos indicaron , pero mandamos un mail y amablemente nos mandaron las fotos .

** Un poco de capacitación a su personal no estaría mal.

You couldn’t get away with Xplor in America. Someone would slip on the wet cave floor, crash their ATV into a tree, or walk head first into a stalactite and then sue the crap out of the owners. 

This is too bad, cause Xplor is fun. Driving their suped up gas-powered golf carts (complete with roll cage) at full speed, at night; barely maintaining control as you run into a 90-degree turn at the bottom of a slope, inside a cave, through water.....is just awesome. Yes, somewhat dangerous, but not TOO dangerous. Just don’t be ridiculously stupid. (You don’t even sign a waver!)

The attractions at Xplor aren’t death-defying, but many get the adrenaline going. In America, it just couldn’t happen cause we’re too lawsuit crazy; so, we’re stuck with cars on tracks and the same tired roller coasters. [sigh]

Fun, organized, clean, easy to follow. Recommendations: 
1. Be there before 8AM
2. Start with the long ride for zip lines "Tirolesas" otherwise you will be stuck in a long queue. 
3. Use water shoes
4. Take several small snacks, instead of a a formal lunch
Parque muy divertido,...
Un lugar lleno...

Un excelente lugar...
Me encantó ,...

Excelente parque experiencias...
