Excelente lugar....
I enjoy the...
Es un parque donde te diviertes muchísimo, pero lo que más me impresiona es que hay bridas y comidas por todo el parque , muy bueno

We weren't sure what to expect at this park but it didn't let us down. You can book either for the day time or night time, we went in the day! Entrance is expensive but it is around what most of the parks are in Mexico. Bring dry clothes as most of the activities leave you wet. Also, some sort of water shoes are essential. We ended up buying them at the park. The main attraction for us were the zip lines and they were amazing! Do  this first thing as they can't get busy. There are 2 routes. Then there is the buggies which also have 2 routes and are great fun! Lunch was great, lots of variety and the ice cream was fab! Then we did the underwater rivers. There are 2 routes that you can do in a rowing boat (short & long) and the same swimming! Both are amazing! You don't really need sun cream as the park if covered in trees etc and so not much sun gets in! There are also hammocks and animals. In all a great day out! The only complaint I would make would be regarding the pictures. You can buy a package but you can't purchase individual pictures which was a great shame. There were a couple of picture that we would of have liked to buy but that wasn't possible.

We started out on the many zip lines, some of which you go under a waterfall and land in the water in the cave. Then we explored the caves and waterfalls and found our way to the cave swim which was breathtaking. After the swim,  lunch was open if we were ready and they had a large selection of food that was included with admission. They also had small snacks and rinks throughout the park as well. After lunch we went on the buggy ride which went through water, caves and waterfalls all around the park. We spent all day at the park, but I wish I had at least another day to enjoy the park so I will definitely be back, worth every penny. I would suggest wearing shorts over your swim suit for ladies during the zip lining portion of this excursion.
Impossible de s'ennuyer dans un cadre pareil! Le parcours de tyrolienne est super et toutes les autres activités valent la peine d'être testés!

익스플로르 : 대형 세노테를 기반으로 만든 익사이팅 워커파크(짚라인, ATV 등)
셀하 : 스노클링과 돌고래 체험 등 자연형 테마파크(오픈세노테, 가족중심적)
스칼렛 : 멕시칸 문화와 수많은 동물들을 만날 수 있는 곳(2시간 짜리 멕시칸 쇼 관람 등)

나이가 젊어서 과감히 익스플로르 선택했고 후회는 없습니다. 정말 재밌고 스릴 넘치는 놀이공원입니다(감동의 눈물을 흘렸어요) 저희는 현장 발권했지만 일정 확정이신 분들은 21일 전에 예약하면 15%할인이고, 7일 전에 예약하면 10% 할인이니 미리 할인 받고 가시는 것도 좋을 것 같아요.

준비물은 수영복이나 티셔츠에 반바지, 비치타월 미제공이니 꼭 챙겨가시고, 워터슈즈는 구매할 수 있지만 챙겨오는 것이 좋습니다. 선크림은 화학물질이 없는 것만 사용가능하니 미리 해당 제품을 사오던지 귀찮으시면 현장 기념품샵에서 구매하면 됩니다.

개인적으로는 렌트카 끌고 가시는게 좋아요. 아침에 느즈막히 일어나 조식먹고 현장에 11시쯤 도착해서 5시까지 신나게 놀았는데- 패키지로 오신 분들은 새벽같이 일찍 오셔서 놀고 점심 먹고 2시쯤 빠지시더라구요. 전 개인적으로 여유있게 즐길 수 있어 더 좋았던거 같아요.

결제가 끝나면 손목 락커키와 헬멧을 주는데 락커키에 맞는 락커룸에 짐을 풀면 되요. 화장실만 남녀구분 있고 탈의실과 샤워실은 공용으로 사용합니다. 깨끗하게 씻는다기보다.. 겉에 묻은 오물이나 세노테 물을 씻어내는 개념으로 보는게 맞을 듯-

헬멧에 자체 내장칩이 있어서 카메라 존에서 자동으로 사진이 찍혀요. 사진을 사려면 1인당 거의 70달러를 내야해요.. 2인이면 140달러니 가격부담이 꽤 됩니다. 방수팩으로 사진 열심히 찍으세요.

짚라인은 총 2가지 코스인데. 총 14개로 구성되어있습니다. 한 코스를 완료하려면 적어도 연속 7번은 타야하는데 감속장치에 부딪힐때 살짝 아픕니다. ㅜㅜ 으으 마지막 짚라인은 물속으로 풍덩~빠져서 시원했어요.

패들보트는 손으로 노젓는 건데 방향전환도 어렵도 생각보다 잘 안나가서 체력의 60%를 이 곳에서 써서 녹초가 되었습니다. 종유석 동굴 수영하기 코스도 있는데 350m 코스랑 25m 코스 두개 갈림길이 나오니 체력에 맞게 코스 선택 하면 되요.

뭐니뭐니해도 4륜 ATV가 제일 재밌었습니다. 물구덩이도 지나갔다가 동굴도 지나갔다가.. 전조등 어떻게 켜야할지 몰라서 하마터면 사고날뻔 했던 아찔한 기억이 다 나네요 ㅎㅎ

신나게 놀고 카페테리아에서 뜨끈하게 마셨던 코코아 생각이 지금도 간절합니다. 코코아 들고 양지에 설치 된 해먹에 누워 낮잠도 자고 행복했어요. 이런 스펙타클한 워터파크는 난생 처음이었고 너무 재밌는 추억이 되었네요. 이 곳은 멕시코에 다시 간다면 또 가고 싶은 관광지입니다.

Me and my husband visited Xplor and it was a fun-filled day with beautiful views. We rode the amphibious vehicle (the path is made in such a way that your vehicle has to go on a bridge and in water, through a small water fall etc), hammock splash was relaxing and fun, zip lines were pretty tall and long (we liked the option of zip lining 2 people at once), rafting in the caves was fun (and tiring at the same time). Facilities are very well maintained, food was great. We loved the option of being able to buy pictures. There will be a chip in your hat and you can pose for pictures as many times as you want for the same price (costed about $60 for both of us). We made some beautiful moments here. Would even recommend for a family with kids (above 5yrs)

Es un lugar muy bonito. Tiene actividad es que pareciera solo te tomaran un rato pero en realidad puedes estar ahí todo el día sin darte cuenta. El acceso es caro pero tiene todo incluido. Las actividades son muy bonita. Lo malo es que todo es subterráneo o a la sombra excepto las tirolesas.

This place was AWESOME!!!  It was like an all natural Disneyland. It was so cool to get the same thrills without anything fake or digitally enhanced.  
Highlights and tips:
-Start with the ziplines - we arrived right at 9 am and did the ziplines first - no lines AT ALL!  It took about 2 hours to do all 14 ziplines.
-Lunch buffet was amazing!  There was something for everyone and you could go back as many times as you wanted.  There were also juice bars throughout the park for a quick snack or a cup of coffee.
-Lots of staff available to help.  Everything was very well marked - very professional all the way!
- They will give you as many lockers as you want.  I was hesitant to bring a lot of stuff  because I only thought they would give one locker.
-Picture package is a MUST!  We had the coolest pics from our day - and we didn't have to carry a camera or a phone around to get super pics. It was a breeze to access and download them.
-This is a VERY physical day - be ready to walk and play A LOT!  We all wore water shoes with thick soles (ie Keen, Merrell and Chacos) and my feet were still sore.  I don't know how you could do the day with anything else on your feet.
-We included a transfer in our package, but ended up taking a taxi home because we were done with everything around 2:00.  
-I bought our tixs on Black Friday which made them really affordable...look for deals on the website.
Overall this was a highlight of our trip!  So worth the $!
lots to do here. 2 Atv courses which were amazing, careful, they check to make sure you don't damage them. Lazy river raft ride was nice but got backed up.

We booked this attraction through our hotel (Riu Playacar and Lomas Travel) as it was very close to where we were staying. The whole experience is designed with a lot of thought and taste, from the entrance into the caves, to the signage and the different sections. We first went zip-lining, as it is the main attraction there. The equipment is in top condition and the operators are highly trained and do not let anything pass by. We ended up doing both circuits twice. The cherry on the cake is the landing of the last line through a waterfall. We also got to ride buggies in caves, swim and canoe on an underground river and zip down in hammocks. The buffet lunch (included) was excellent with all kinds of local delights. We also signed up for the photo package, which allows to have pictures automatically taken at the best spots in the park with a special bracelet. The shots were all fantastic and we got to download them by 5PM the next day as announced. Overall a great indoor/outdoor adventure. There is also a night option, but not all the attractions are available I was told.
Amazing!!! Must go back with kids...a highlight! Zip-lining was beyond expectations, great food, fun atmosphere. So worth the money!!

We brought our family of 12 here and it was so much fun!  It was very busy but we were early enough only the zip lines had any amount of a wait.  Loved the food, the "amphibious jeeps" were a bit of a let down and had to breathe with all the exhaust but still enjoyable.  Well worth the price.

Una manera de convivir con la naturaleza de un modo extremo, tienes carros anfibios, nadas en un río de cuevas, vas en balsa, tienes muchísimas tirolesas, la entrada es all inclusive puedes comer y tomar lo que quieras, la comida es muy buena para desayunar y comer, todo tipo de comida y es un lugar muy mágico lleno de actividades y convivencia con la naturaleza!!!

Minha viagem foi realizada com minha namorada e outro casal de amigos. Estávamos em busca de um parque onde pudéssemos desfrutar de boas atrações e também apreciar a beleza natural do lugar. Achamos o Xplor perfeito por isso, é o parque com o maior numero de atrações (que para nós são classificadas como ótimas) e ainda podemos aproveitar os rios naturais, etc, alem poder ver um pouco mais da região em cima das Tirolesas. 
Algumas atrações que valem muito a pena: Circuito de Tirolesas (opção entre as mais rápidas ou mais altas, podendo ir em duplas e individualmente), passeio de Bugres (dica: se você quer um trajeto um pouco mais emocionante, pegue o primeiro carrinho, se não você terá que obrigatoriamente ficar seguindo alguém) e o passeio em rios naturais (água gelada, mas vale muito a pena). 
Há opção de comprar o pacote de fotos que funciona a partir do numero do seu capacete. Um pouco caro mas dependendo das fotos vale a pena. Tem alguns lugares espalhados pelo parque onde você pode tirar fotos, além de algumas atrações também. 
Quanto a comida e bebida, estão incluídos no pacote e tem bastante opção dos dois. Resumo do parque: em um dia você consegue se divertir muito em todas as atrações, comer e beber muito bem e tirar ótimas fotos. Não faltou nada.

They swapped my credit card!!!
We were there a few days back. The attraction itself is nice with lots of trees. I was impressed with the amount of trees they left and built around them. It is quite cooler in the park even when it is 80F outside. But then as we walked around, we found many attractions are minimal in what they have to offer. We paid extra for the X-Caret Plus and that includes Snorkeling which is good. We enjoyed that part. However, even with a $125 per day ticket for X-Caret plus, you are not even offered a towel at the end of the snorkeling. So we had a rent a towel for $4. Now get this, they charge $4 for the towel, take your picture and HOLD your drivers licence all for a used (and washed I assume ) towel. So we are forced to make our way back to the Towel Returns which closes way before the rest of the park. We were literally on the other end of the park and rushed back skipping back attractions to be on-time to return the towel and get my Driver's License back.
And we left the park and later when at the airport realized that they gave someone else's credit card! It was the same Chase Saphire card that belonged to someone else. That was the only card that I had that had a travel alert to be able to use in Mexico. So we had to call one of my other credit card companies to be able to use a credit card.
Except for that grand fiasco that added undue stress while traveling and for the over-price admission cost, it was OK. 

I would not go back again.

We had an absolute BLAST!! At Xplor Park. If you are planning a trip to Cozumel or the surrounding area this is definitely a must do spot which we booked as an excursion through a Carnival cruise (which I would recommend do to get back to the boat late). Water shoes, GoPro and a change of clothes are a must. Huge buffet with great food and drinks, unbelievable attractions (zip lines, cave swimming, cave rafting, off road cars, etc...) friendly staff and our guide “Sergi” was very helpful and directed us on how to maximize our experience. “Thanks Sergi”. En el hotel nos ofrecieron como excursión la visita al parque si queríamos pasar un día de diversión y de aventura. No teníamos mucha información del lugar salvo el folleto que nos ofreció el guía, nos dejamos llevar por las fotos del folleto y aceptamos la excursión. Llegas al parque y en principio solo ves arboles y empiezas a pensar que esto no es como lo imaginas, bajas a la entrada te pones unos cascos y comienza la aventura. Empiezas por una gruta siguiendo el bum,bum,bum de los latidos del corazón que es el centro del parque desde donde empiezan todas la actividades.Nadar entre estalactitas y estalagmitas, en las cristalinas aguas, nos encantó. Conducir los coches anfibios por los caminos de la selva, increíble.Deslizarse por los cielos y  volar sobre la selva pasando por puentes colgantes, y acuatizar en un cenote.toda una aventura extrema.
Pasamos un día increíble difícil de olvidar. Lo pasamos genial.
Desde aquí solo me cabe recomendarlo y  la para la gente indecisa que no sabe si realizar la visita no se lo piensen, no se van arrepentir.

It's our second time in Mexico. Previous time we visited XCaret park and wanted to come back to check on the XPlor park. Yes, it worth it !!!
The XPlor park gives you many different places to explore, many   activities to participate in. There were 2 amazing zip lines (one has less water activities comparing to another one). Riding on Jeeps in caverns. Swimming in water and by kayaks exploring caverns.
So many activities and options at this beautiful park. Not really recommended for small children but ages 6 and up!

There is plenty to do at this park with the underground caverns and rivers, ziplines, and ATV's. The buffet was fantastic with so many choices.  Bring water shoes and an underwater camera. And make sure to get there as early as you can.  The park is big and you will want the whole day to take in all of the activities.  I will have to do an update on the photo package as we seem to be missing a bunch. Just waiting on the parks photo team to respond to our email. It was a great experience.
This park has only 4 activities, underground swimming, rafting, zip-lining, amphibious vehicle. Amphibious vehicle is a bit exaggerated, but the zip-lining, and underground swimming are amazing.

Absolutely loved this trip. However queuing for the buffet is a bit of a pain with little shade. We got there and did the zip lines first and we go them down in about 1hour. later we spoke to a family that did the zip lines later and it took them 3 hours to do one. So definitely advise To do zip lines as soon as you get in. Swimming in the caves was fantastic , definitely better than the caves at xcaret! Highly recommend this trip to everyone who likes a bit of adrenaline.

Loads of fun, great free juice bars for the price! Pics allowed some places only, water proof camera recommended. All day fun. Dude buggy a but slow and not terribly fun, has a governor. You are liable to pay for buggy if you hurt it. Very professional over all and great for family fun! Lots of activities to do, including underground cave and river. Lockers given for valuables.
O muito legal são as tirolesas as outras atividades são bacanas. Comida boa, funcionários muito atenciosos.
Tirolesas circuito "Jaguar" muy bien!. Buffet muy bien!.. anfibios bien!.

Todo estuvo increíble, me gustó mucho la comida, las tirolesas, el trato del personal, lo único que no me agradó fue que la mayoría de las cámaras no funcionaban bien, entonces no tuvo chiste haber comprado un paquete de fotos si no servían casi todas las camaras. Fuera de ahí todo fue muy divertido y genial!
Una experiencia increíble lo visite por la noche, lo mejor las tirolesas, la comida, el auto anfibio,  Jejeje todo me encanto, sin dudarlo regresaría pero ahora de día

We weren't sure what to expect at this park but it didn't let us down. You can book either for the day time or night time, we went in the day! Entrance is expensive but it is around what most of the parks are in Mexico. Bring dry clothes as most of the activities leave you wet. Also, some sort of water shoes are essential. We ended up buying them at the park. The main attraction for us were the zip lines and they were amazing! Do  this first thing as they can't get busy. There are 2 routes. Then there is the buggies which also have 2 routes and are great fun! Lunch was great, lots of variety and the ice cream was fab! Then we did the underwater rivers. There are 2 routes that you can do in a rowing boat (short & long) and the same swimming! Both are amazing! You don't really need sun cream as the park if covered in trees etc and so not much sun gets in! There are also hammocks and animals. In all a great day out! The only complaint I would make would be regarding the pictures. You can buy a package but you can't purchase individual pictures which was a great shame. There were a couple of picture that we would of have liked to buy but that wasn't possible.
Me encantó el parque, el personal muy amable, las comidas riquismas, los zipline me encantaron (aunque hay que subir muchas escaleras), Los vehículos anfibios me encantaron.
This was our favorite excursion on our whole trip. Absolutely loved the zip lining‼️ Food wasn’t bad, depending on what you like, but it was something for everyone.❤️
Went there with my husband on December 12th/2017 and it was a lot of fun for the both of us, all the activities were great and made us feel like kids again, I would definitely go back �

First, a shout out to Ruben who works in ziplines.  He went out of his way to help me do the last phase of the ziplines and I super appreciate it.  Gracias!

We were on the fence before going but very glad we did as we've never done anything like this.  It felt as though we were in Jurassic Park (minus the dinosaurs).  Amphibious cars were fun.  The river swim was amazing. The Hammer zipline was exciting.  The buffet was surprisingly bountiful and the food wasn't bad.  The only small disappointment was the rafting, as our little paddles didn't do much and we wound up just pushing off the walls.  We even wound up buying the photos.  Great experience.

La experiencia es muy buena, me divertí muchísimo, hay algunas cosas que hacer y pasas un buen rato si vas con la familia. Las instalaciones muy limpias, los baños impecables.
La comida es excepcional! El chef en verdad se merece un aplauso.
Lo único que me desagradó:
Los temos de las balsas es una decepción! Deberían cambiarlos por remos normales y, el personal de la tirolesa en las torres dejan mucho que desear, realmente no parece que les guste su trabajo, quizás deberían de entender que la gente va a divertirse no a darles más trabajo.
El personal de los anfibios y el restaurant son súper amables y simpáticos ! Muy gentiles. 
Gracias xplorer me la pase increíble.
A lot of fun with zip lines, ATV (though they are on the slow side) and rafting. The buffet is also very good. You are going to be wet so bring clothes to change (they have free lockers).

Destacado el aprovechamiento de la naturaleza en el diseño de sus actividades bajo tierra en sus cuevas. 
Sus ríos subterráneos con las estalactitas y estalagnitas son increíbles. Muy buen diseño del parque. 
Actividades divertidas para niños mayores de 8 años (no excluyente) y adultos. 
Buen Buffett. Mejor que el de Xcaret (mismo grupo de parques).
Recomendable contratar servicio de fotos automáticas. 
El día es corto y para hacer todas las actividades no es recomendable tomar descansos intermedios. 
Sugerencia: hacer todas las tirolesas temprano a la mañana, sumar alguna otra después, almorzar no más de 13hs y luego hacer el resto. 
Te mojas prácticamente todo el día. 
Sobre todo en algunas tirolesas, hamacuatizaje y nado en río subterráneo. Por eso quizás mejor hacer esto a la mañana si diera el tiempo. 
El nado en río y el remo son bajo techo, por si conviene cubrirse del clima.

Si de diversión hablamos ,Xplor es sin duda el mejor .La diversión es al máximo,es excelente para ir con amigos ,las tirolesas son espectaculares! Lo recomiendo totalmente para toda la familia y amigos!!!

I was so unsure about visiting Xcaret but I should not have been! I kind of hate crowds/theme parks but this is not like that at all. I don't know why people don't rave about the beaches and snorkeling areas...they are so beautiful and easy to use.  I saw a manta ray 7 feet across-gulp. He came in from the ocean and then after circling awhile went back out. I also saw about 10 varieties of colorful fish. We spent 2 weeks in various parts of Mexico and Xcaret is one of the last places we went. It was such a pleasant surprise and such a nice way to cap off the trip. As others have said the shows (including the final one) is phenomenal. It made me proud of Mexico and I'm not even a citizen:-) The buffet is also top notch and includes a beer! Definitely buy the ticket that comes with a meal. The exhibits throughout were so nicely done and the river floats are pretty special too. Thoroughly enjoyed it and highly recommend!!!
Fue una experiencia inolvidable, nos gusto mucho todas las actividades que realizamos y en especial el nado en el rio. La comida estuvo deliciosa y la idea de una reserva natural es perfecta.

Un incontournable sur playa del carmen !!!!!
Famille de 3 enfants ( 10, 3, 1), journée complète indispensable ( sinon vous le regretterez ) de 9h jusqu’au spectacle incontournable de 19h > 21h 
Prévoir : poussette, pochette téléphone étanche pour les photos dans l’eau car vous n’aurez pas de poche ou le mettre, sac a dos, bouteille d’eau, goûter, crème solaire bio, anti moustique au cas ou, serviette de plage, rechange pour le soir. 
Côté organisation : tout est pensé!!! Casiers, vestiaire, palmes, tuba, sac a cadenas qui vous suivent automatiquement entre le début de la rivière et la fin ( cela vous évite de revenir au casier )
Prenez le xcaret plus ( cela inclus pas mal de commodités et surtout le repas du midi ( entre 12h et 17h ) qui est sous forme d’un buffet du monde ou tout est bon et surtout en quantité incluant les boissons ( vous ne pouvez y aller que une fois ) il y en a plusieurs de buffet sur le circuit mais vous ne pouvez en choisir q’un seul et le meilleur est celui du centre  après le jaguar.... ( le plus gros et donc plus de choix ) 
Nous avons pris les dauphins sur place en négociant : 2 achetés et le 3eme offert ou alors 20% de rabais, mais négocier sinon nada...  
pour les photos du dauphin, c’est pas mal mais trop cher, il parte a 176$ le pack complet mais je pouvais l’avoir a 80$ après négociation mais encore trop cher !!! 
Le spectacle est extraordinaire pour les adultes et les enfants, même mon dernier de 18 mois ne voulait ps fermer les yeux !!!! Faite le, nous on voulais partir avant mais on a lutté et super heureux !!!  
Pour finir, je ne comprends pas certains commentaires négatifs : trop cher !! Faux, on en a pour son argent !!!! Mais il faut rester la journée complète... 
Eviter les jours d’affluences : les samedis et dimanches.... commencer pas par la rivière car tous le monde y va en premier... faite le parcours de la jungle d’abord !!! ( tout le monde a la rivière et vous tranquille sur le parcours de la jungle ensuite repas et après la rivière )  
Pour les familles avec jeunes enfants, tout est faisable sauf pour un bébé en rivière car pas adapté mais faisable a partir de 18 mois sans problème. 
J’ai pris le temps d’écrire un commentaire constructif et objectif sur cette attraction qui est pour moi un 9/10 ....( la perfection n’existe pas )

My family allocated a full day of our vacation in Riviera Maya to Xcaret and I feel we got our money’s worth. We purchased the Xcaret plus package, which included a storage locker, one (and only one) buffet meal, and access to the water activities. 

Highlights:
 “Sea Trek”  manta ray experience (extra charge).
The underground river: they have a convenient system in which you put your belongings in a bag, which they lock and provide you a key to, at the start of the river and which they take to the end of the river for you to pick up. The river itself is a lot of fun. 
The Mayan cultural shows in the evening.
The “day of the dead” cemetery.

Tips: bring a towel (or purchase one there).
We weren’t charged for parking (had a rental car).
Lockers and changing areas enable you to change from wet to dry clothes easily and walk around unencumbered by your extra clothing.
Was able to use Visa credit card throughout park.
Xcaret plus package includes only one buffet meal; additional ones will have a charge. I think we paid about $12 USD per person at that day’s exchange rate for our second meal. Buffet is vegetarian/vegan friendly.
It was much cheaper to just buy digital copies of all of our photos than to select individual printed ones.

We bought the Xcaret Plus package with transportation and it would have been a good deal if it hadn’t been so packed. The bus pick up is at the hotel at 7am arriving at the park around 9am, there are 2 schedules for the return 4:45 and 9:40pm. We stayed for the late departure and enjoyed the show at the end of the day, the bufete was good, they give you a brand new straw for snorkeling, and in general it is all good. The only reason we didn’t have a great experience is that we went during the week between Christmas and New Year, the place was so packed you couldn’t swim or snorkel without kicking or getting kicked by someone else. I think I would have rather have been denied tickets for those dates than going into a park packed to the gills. We also got the pictures package but the park was so full 90% of our pictures have a bunch of strangers in them. I haven’t been able to download the pictures and I’m still waiting for their support team to get back with any kind of answers. The place is beautiful and I’m sure any other time it would have made for a great visit, but for us was a terrible first impression.

We had been to this park for our honeymoon 18 years ago, and it's amazing how much it has grown.  So much, in fact, that a day is definitely not enough.  I would recommend planning for the two-day package, and splitting it so as to have a "wet" (all water activities, sectors green, blue and red) and a "dry" day (no water activities, sectors black and white).  The Mexico Espectacular show in the evening is definitely a must, including a full-fledged Maya football game, historical reenactments and Mexican traditional music and dances, carefully choreographed and staged.  I recommend watching it from mid-level (neither too low nor too high), but you'll need to get there early, because it gets full.  The horse show is also great.  We saw the Voladores de Papantla, but if you miss that, a small-scale recreation is part of the evening show.  The butterflies and the aviary are really huge and impressive, much better than anything else I had ever seen.  There are several free workshops available, and I strongly recommend planning to attend one.  We went to the chocolate one and got to make chocolate paste from the toasted beans, following the traditional methods, accompanied by an excellent (bilingual!) explanation.  Those 45 minutes really added a lot of value to our experience!  Just like in Xel-ha, food at the restaurants is truly excellent.  The only real issue we had is that use of towels is not included, and while they are available, you need to bring money to rent them, which was an awkward surprise at the end of the river swim, and meant we had to walk all the way back dripping.  There is free Wi-Fi on the park, although I wish there had been a web or app map rather than use the paper ones.  Another issue is that the logistics for the return trip were not well organized and the walkway is dark, so it got confusing when everyone came out at the end of the show and had only minutes to get to the right bus for the ride back.

Si vas de viaje a Cancún no puedes dejar de ir a Xcaret.
Increíble por el lado que lo mires, llegas al rededor de las 09:00 de la mañana y te vas a las 12:00 de la noche.
Al llegar te entregan un mapa de todo el parque para que recorras tus lugares favoritos, en lo personal recorrí todo, y aun así me quedo tiempo para hacer unas actividades extras como nadar con delfines y bucear.
Lo más bello de todo fue el show nocturno”MÉXICO ESPECTACULAR” donde se muestra la cultura mexicana desde la época prehispánica hasta hoy. Mi espectáculo favorito fue el juego de la pelota.

Nice big water park with los of extras. Adrenalina was an exta $59 per person but was very fun. Think of a speedboat doing 180 turns(they claim 360) and braking at about 80-90 mph. The boat gets dunked by a huge wave of sea water. Very fun. Lots of free rides in the park too. Big pools, man-made beaches. Make sure you get the vip package that includes 1 free meal. Head up to the seafood buffet near the top. Delicious food and they have horchata. Think of Hurricane Harbor but the Mexican version with less queues.

El parque es muy hermoso, esta bien mantenido. Es mas bien como un zoológico lo cuál no se me hace muy agradable. Allá podes nadar con delfines, alimentar dinosaurios y hacer distintas actividades bajo el agua, todas ellas son pagas (no se incluyen en el paquete). Para recorrer bien el parque se necesitan 2 días, si compras dos días juntos el segundo te sale la mitad. Igualmente si solo tenés un día se puede hacer, tenes que elegir bien lo que  queres hacer y crear la ruta mas conveniente. Es importante destacar que no se puede llevar protector solar o repelente de mosquitos que no sean biodegradables, pero en la entrada hay un puesto donde podes intercambiarlo por uno apto para el parque.

It's overpriced if you don't go to all of the live shows. More of an amusement park than a study of Mayan culture. Have a game plan beforehand so you can see all of the main attraction/events because they don't have a pre-planned schedule or tour to give you, and don't get reeled into doing the 30$ per person buffet unless you're desperate and can put away over 3 plates of food on your own. If you eat at the restaurant with a menu (they have 5-6 different restaurants to eat) , be careful with the ceviche because I got food poisoning! For picky children, the restaurant near the entrance makes burgers and sandwiches as well.

If you like snorkeling and fun, then check out this place! We only got to spent half a day here but we are dying to go back.  My husband loved the Cavern Snuba!  I opted to snorkel.  We went down the river, which didn't offer much to see underwater but it was beautiful scenery.  Along the way you can stop to jump off cliffs or do ropes course or a zipline into the water.  It was a ton of fun!! Get the photo package because getting a few photos will cost you the same as unlimited ones!

Xcaret es una experiencia que no debes dejar de vivir si estas en Cancún  o playa del carmen, es un parque en el que podrás conocer acerca de las costumbres y tradiciones mexicanas, estar en contacto  con la naturaleza, disfrutar de la gastronomía, todo es una aventura, sin duda lo repetiría  mil veces.
Puedes ver aves, shows culturales, la zona de especies acuaticas es hermosa.
Todo el día  puedes estar recorriendo el parque pero sin duda lo mas hermoso de ir a Xcaret es el  show de la noche que se llama México espectacular, es MÁGICO! 

Super recomendado este lugar.

Acerca de Xcaret:
Adéntrate en los senderos de Xcaretpara descubrir como se combinan la selva maya y la cultura de México en más de 50 emocionantes atractivos. Localizado a la orilla del mar, en la Riviera Maya y muy cerca de Cancún, Xcaret tiene actividades para todos; disfruta una tradicional Fiesta Charra y el Juego de Pelota Maya; o si eres amante de la naturaleza visita la Isla de Jaguares y nuestro colorido Mariposario.

¡También puedes disfrutar del mar Caribe! Toma un tour de snorkel, refréscate en Ríos Subterráneos y disfruta del Nado con Delfines. Al caer la noche, serás nuestro invitado de honor a la presentación “Xcaret México Espectacular”, una fiesta de luz y color con 300 artistas que te llevarán por la historia de México.
Excelente lugar, amplia variedad de actividades, show nocturno espectacular, algunas cosas externas al buffet (agua, alimentos, souvenirs) son excesivamente caros

It is a beautiful place with a lot of great tropical scenery.  We were dropped off at 9am when the park opened and picked up at 4:45pm. Many of the activities required additional cost, and there weren’t enough ‘included’ activities to spend all that time there. We did enjoy the 45 minute swim through the underground caves/river. If you bring your own snorkel gear, you can see all the fish that are swimming with you :) the butterfly exhibit was a let down in the first area (not a single butterfly) but when you get to subsequent areas there are more butterflies. They have a cemetery with beautiful memorials that form a spiral up a hill. The flamingos were fun to watch. We had a good laugh at their antics and trying to figure out what they were up to. The raft ride was boring. The orchids were beautiful. The beach was nice but it was extremely crowded so it was hard to be in the water without bumping into people.  Most lunch options are included. We chose the seafood buffet that cost extra but it was lacking on seafood. Not recommended. Bottom line is that I would recommend xplor instead of xcaret.

El precio lo vale . El espectáculo de noche inolvidable! Me quedo sin palabras al describir este hermoso lugar y lo mejor es que su creador es MEXICANO!
Hay algo que decir? Jaja

Uno de los mejores parques de toda la Riviera maya, con un gran atractivo natural y con grandes atracciones que llaman la atención de sus visitantes.
Además de los restaurantes ubicados por todo el parque con una deliciosa comida en cualquiera al que vayas.

Genial, un show completamente imperdible, si no compras la entrada que incluye el almuerzo no hay problema, recomiendo la parrilla famialiar y economía  pueden comer muy bien hasta 4 personas y por los casillero no hay que preocuparse pues si te deseas meter al rio metes tus cosad en las maletas que ellos dan y te lo llevan hasta el final del recorrido. 
Un experiencia familiar genial

Better than Disney!  Well worth the money.
Súper divertido
Excelente experiencia
Fantástico! Comida excelente, estrutura de banho, passeios, atividades!!! Surpreendente!

Este parque es una locura aunque es algo costoso para el cambio de algunos países los vale, es realmente sensacional el lugar, las cosas que hay que hacer, ver y disfrutar son muchas y como recomendación entras alas 9am y esperar el último show que termina a las 9pm aunque es tiempo es demasiado corto la experiencia es única todo lo vale. Pagar las fotos también las vale esos recursos serán únicos.

Top tip- buy your tickets online! There are lots of stalls and shops in the town centre of Playa selling packages which turned out to be quite expensive in comparison. The earlier you buy them online the cheaper it will be. We got a taxi from Playa town (220 peso) and paid upon arrival for the plus package which included a buffet lunch. The park wasn’t very busy first thing, but we later realised that many of the coaches and large groups don’t arrive until late morning. So I advise to get there as early as poss to avoid the large crowds. And man it gets busy!!!!!! 
We decided to pay the extra $39 each and swim with sting rays which was a good experience. But we took a pass on swimming with the dolphins and nurse shark, just because it was so expensive. 
The rest of the activities and shows are very family orientated, not much else to do for a couple in our 30’s that kept us very entertained. 
The lunch was OK. We had the buffet lunch included in our ticket price, but would have been $30 each if we hadn’t. Worked out about the same. They had a good selection of meat, fish, veg and salad etc. However, having seen some of the smaller lunch vendors that sold simple sandwiches for much less money, we wish we hadn’t paid the extra for the Plus package, because there is no way we ate a combined $60 worth of food for lunch! 
The snacks and drinks throughout the day were more reasonable though, so you could always snack on crisps and popcorn and eat a bigger evening meal to save more.
We didn’t stay for the evening show because again, it would have been an extra on top of a very expensive day so far! 
If you have kids- you’ll love it. For the more The Adrenalin seekers reading this, there are other sister-parks that may be more enjoyable for you.
Impresionante

O parque é um dos mais conhecidos do mundo e não é à toa. Organização impecável. Muitas atrações. Vale o investimento. O show noturno é impressionante, embora a sua duração (1h45) canse quem está o dia todo no parque.
Excelente

There are only three things that really impressed me at Xcaret. Two are surcharged.

Sea Trek: Such an unique experience! You literally walk on the bottom(20ft under) of the sea, surrounded by countless fish, couples of statue and even stingrays! Definitely the top highlight of our entire Cancun trip! Worth every penny we spent on it!

Photo package: not all photos are great but the great ones are irreplaceable, especially the ones with parrots and Sea Trek

Night show: we are not familiar with Mexican or Mayan culture. It was not easy to understand but really fun to watch. A little bit long though. But busses are all waiting outside so no worries about transportation.

Besides these, I was quite disappointed by the arrangement and management of the park.
Things I wish I knew ahead of time: 
1. Go to underwater in the afternoon!!! Like 3pm. We went around 11am and it was awfully crowded and noisy. No private space at all! It was a nightmare! 
2. No need to bring water shoes because they provide fins
3. No need to buy xcaret plus because food was just okay and lockers are not really necessary.
4. No one checked your sunscreen

Pricey and overly crowded. I would not go again. Sea trek is a must if you plan to go. Otherwise nothing special.
Super lugar me encantó!

Fue la excursion que mas le gusto a mi hijo y sobrino, recomiendo para todas las edades, los rios subterraneos una de las cosas que no se puede dejar de hacer, el mariposario espectacular, los guacamayos, el espectaculo final, las vistas desde las reposera hacia la costa indescriptible, almorzamos en el Bar en las rocas, muy rica la comida y excelente atencion. Sin dudas volveriamos.
Un parque espectacular...no se puede dejar de visitar!!!
Muito bom; tem chegar mais cedo para dar tempo de fazer todo trajeto! Nadar com golfinhos, atividades desportivas e nadar nas grutas é imprescindível!
Muy bonito buena experiencia, y dan descuento por ser mexicano

Simplemente hermoso tantas actividades y lugares que recorrer cada rincón es hermoso para una foto de postal el show nocturno impresionante la comida variada  y amigable con el ambiente se preocupan por todos los detalles exelente lugar
Wonderful place a lot ecpensive although it's worth all the experences.

For the price you would expect a 5 star place, but the showers are horrible, the dressing room full and the food is acceptable. 
So the river was really cold, really dark and not worth it. The staff in the park removes your water shoes and they make you walk into a hard and awkward floor that hurts a lot. I would say pass on that. Nothing really great to see. 
The lockers are really far from everything so you are literally freezing all over the park since you can't take your towel with you. 
It was so expensive that I was hoping for an A+ experience and I didn't get that. Bought my activity during my booking and when I got into the park I was left to 4PM to take the activity. It's better if you buy the activities in the park and not online. 
Bought the package of photos in the park, that's unnecessary and really expensive the park doesn't have a lot of places to take advantage of the price. 
The only nice part of the experience was the show at the end. I bought Xcaret exclusive and it was the only thing that was worth it. 
I would say save your money and buy another trip.

El parque es fascinante, enorme, lleno de atracciones para todo tipo de público. Pero por encima de todo, debo reconocer que el show de la noche es uno de los espectáculos mas memorable que visto en mi vida. No solo lo recomendaría sino que volvería con gusto.

The GOOD:

My children are 15 and 18 yrs old. They did the Dolphin encounter and we paid extra for a private session. Well worth the extra money as my kids really experienced the Dolphin encounter with many many many more activities. My kids were all smiles and my 15 yrs old kept saying "i want a pet dolphin". Their guide was amazing! We purchased the tier 3 photo package which included all the pictures (in a external key and DVD and app) and a beautiful picture album book. It was expensive ($362 U.S) but worth the money! There are 2 dolphin encounter areas. Our Sunwing rep at the hotel (we stayed at Barcelo Maya Palace) advised us to chose the one further from the main attraction areas as it was not as busy....the best advise ever! Lunch, snorkel  equipment, towels and locker (a down payment of $50 US was needed but you get this money back when you return your towels/locker key) was included with the package (we paid $962 CAD, for 5 adults, on the Sunwing plane, on route to Mexico, as we paid in Canadian dollars instead of US). If you purchase at the hotel, you pay in US or pesos. There are multiple areas in the resort where you can enjoy quietness but most areas are occupied and it's a 1st come. We found a place that had a slide going into a area of the sea where rocks keep the swimming area calm....beautiful! Many buffet restaurants to choose from which is included with our package. There were shows at night. We were not able to see the main show as it was busy and lots and lots of people. We did see a Mexican rodeo and a Mayan show and it was wonderful and entertaining. There are vendors throughout the park you can purchase authentic Mayan things (blankets, hats, etc). There are 2 beautiful catholic churches....one on the hill in a hut and one by the main entrance called Ourady of Guadalupe (see pictures of both churches). There is also a cemetery of ancient Mayans buried. Make sure you visit the basement of this cemetery as there is a beautiful statue of Momma Mary and a woman saint (see picture). There are Mayan ruins you can also visit that will take you back in time....so wonderful! There is a zoo (butterflies, panther, jaguar, etc) in the resort but not the greatest especially since I am from Canada and we have an amazing zoo in Toronto. There are many water activities you can do and buy (Not included with the package) but the best is the Dolphin encounter. We did one of 2 snorkel paths in the caves. There is also a snorkel area by one of the lagoons we did.

The NOT SO GOOD:

It was soooooooooo busy and over crowded. My husband and I visited Xcaret 20 years ago when Xcaret was only 5 years old. My husband's family owned a time share and visited Mexico and Xcaret frequently and I visited with my friends when I stayed in Cancun 20 years ago. My husband and I chose Xcaret because we wanted our kids to experience this beautiful place we visited 20 years ago. Well.....totally a different experience this time around and nothing like 20 years ago. This time....Xcaret became a "Disney world like resort"....overcrowded, with sometimes rude people bumping into you. The restaurants were over crowded and wait time for a table is long. The snorkel area by the lagoon is WAY OVERCROWDED and my husband and I wondered how it was even safe to have that many people in one area swimming? You didn't really see anything while snorkeling as it was so crowded....it scared the fishes away. My husband and I were disappointed and expected Xcaret to be how it was 20 years ago. 20 years ago, when you first entered Xcaret, you are instantly welcomed with an open space where all you see are the white sands, the sea, the lagoon and one restaurant on the hill with one dolphin encounter. The scenery was just breath taking. It was like the scene in the movie The Blue Lagoon with jungles in the back ground. I felt like I died and went to heaven 20 years ago. It was not busy at all back than. And it was almost an untouched resort....all natural. I remember when snorkeling in the cave pathways, I saw lots of fish. I didn't see one in this same snorkel area this time around, and it was overcrowded and people knocked into you, especially the areas where it was sooooooo dark and no lights (thank goodness for my FitBit Ionic that has a flashlight app). You need to make sure you do not get kicked on the head with someone swimming. This place became an over crowded touristy resort that got rid of the natural beauty, people like myself crave for. My husband and I said that if we knew how much Xcaret changed, we would have chosen another excursion that was cheaper and not as developed. The staff who worked in Xcaret are not the friendliest. So don't expect a smile and an "hola" from many of the staff. The lunch (that's included in the package) was ok. It's a buffet so you get lots of food to eat and chose from, but not the best tasting (at least in the restaurant we chose that is beside the turtle area). I was told the restaurant (I believe #21 and 40) are the best ones, but who knows. We weren't able to see the main show as our bus was picking us up at 8pm and the main show started at 7:30pm......and it was soooooooooo busy and packed! There is no seat reservation unless you purchase the VIP which is expensive (includes reserve seating, dinner and all you can drink wine). At the end of the day....at the bus pick up area, the line up was huge! Like huge! Don't get lost and miss your bus back to your resort hotel!

Overall, Xcaret is a great place to visit if you do not mind the touristy kind of resort that is very very overcrowded and the very expensive entrance fee. But the Dolphin encounter was the best and extra payment for this excursion was worth it! 

If I can recommend another place we visited, while on this same vacation, is the Extreme excursion with ATV, zip lining and snorkeling in a beautiful cave, and they feed you lunch! It's cheaper and the resort is in a jungle.....yes folks....in a beautiful jungle! Bring either running shoes or water shoes as you will need this. Bring towels as well as the resort does not provide towels. You do have lockers that is included. If you go, ask for Jimmy as your guide. We paid extra for a private tour with Jimmy and my family only. Jimmy was the funniest and kindest tour guide. He will make you smile and laugh until you pee your pants! We tipped Jimmy $50 US and he was worth every penny! 

GOD bless!
Muy buena experiencia, solo que hay que estar organizado y ver seccion por seccion ya que sino se ara muy cansado y repititivo

Ni un detalle librado al azar. Todo en su lugar y armonioso con la naturaleza. Los paisajes, el cuidado del ambiente y los animales y la cordialidad de los empleados hacen de este lugar una verdadera maravilla
Muy padre , se diviertes desde el niño hasta el adulto, y el cierre es espectacular

El lugar es muy hermoso pero como no si es Cancún. El río y la playa es algo q no te debes perder. El detalle es que si es costoso aparte de la entrada si quieres hacer otra afectividad todo tiene costo adicional así que hay que llevar suficiente efectivo.

I went to check out the infamous night show and day of the dead celebrations. I went with a mexican friend and spent the day there. I enjoyed floating down the river and cenotes and exploring the mexican cultures. the night show was amazing!!

Las entradas son muy costosas para sacarle el provecho que uno como cliente quisiera, en esta época de año nuevo hay demasiada gente, no puedes disfrutar del parque como uno quisiera, TODO TE LO COBRAN, ojo es muy importante, nosotros adquirimos la entrada "PLUS" pero creo que lo único bueno que esto ofrece es el almuerzo, nada más, las actividades que realmente valen la pena vale muchos dólares y No Se incluyen en la entrada, necesitas más o menos unos 400 o 500 USD por persona para acceder a las buenas atracciones; a nivel cultural ofrecen pocos shows, de pronto puedan considerar mostrar más de la cultura mexicana a lo largo del día.
Muy caro pero lo vale, sobretodo el espectáculo nocturno
Amazing
Mi favorito de los parques de Cancún
Great park, a lot of fun.
Me encanta!.
Lo maximo
Excelente
Me encantó!
Un parque con muchas atracciones y lo mejor que solo puede encontrarse en este hermoso país.
Lo mejor de los paseos ❤❤❤

This is a very expensive place, for almost anyone (including myself).

But I can certainly assure this place is worth the money, (at least the general entry ticket fare)

You cannot miss the night show at the inside theater, there is nothing else like it!

Its a paradise in all aspects, and you will have lots of fun, especially if you like water/swimming/aquariums 

I didn't pay anything extra inside the park 
But I paid the premium ticket with meal, locker, and transportation to my Hotel at Cancun area, all these are totally worth it, as otherwise, you will have to pay more for the locker and the meals anyway, and the park is something like 80km to Cancun Hotel Strip, which will cost you a fortune in taxi cab, and if you are bringing a car prepare to pay no little parking fee.

Also you will spend a whole day in here because its a marvelous place.(and because of the distance of traveling if you are not staying in a nearby  Riviera Maya hotel)

Be sure to get transportation with the xcaret company (xperiencias xcaret) because they are logistics wizards and will make the difference between having a nice trip to the park or not.
Also you will get discount for buying entries to other parks (Xelha is the very definition of paradise, you might want to go there also)

Be careful to avoid buying transportation from third parties as I think that would not be a safe bet in terms of quality of service.

Anyway, inside the park lots of activities are extra, and you can purchase any you may like at something around $50 usd per person, it will sum up pretty quickly if you decide to go for them.

I couldn't afford to take any extra activity but I guess one or two of them would be a nice touch to your trip, but I think that some of them are not worth it, like swimming with some animals (except dolphins) or using a scuba like helmet because you can snorkel without paying extra. 

There is also a nice photo package with self-service cameras all around the park, even inside water attraction like in the underground river, you just need one package per group I guess, as you can take the pictures with the barcode of the wristband of one person, and get all the pictures you like, even for other persons of your party.

Also, you can buy water protecting case for your phone to take your own pictures, either option would be nice if you like pictures

Definitivamente es una gran experiencia visitar xcaret, hay varias actividades que puedes realizar, algunas más extremas que otras, así que realmente puedes encontrar actividades para el gusto de los diferentes integrantes de la familia. No se pierdan el rio subterráneo ni el snorkel, son grandes experiencias. El espectáculo final cuenta con una gran calidad, realmente te hace sentirte orgulloso de la cultura mexicana. La comida del restauran es buena, y me gustó que cuenta con una pequeña vitrina donde puedes tomas dulces típicos mexicano. Un punto que me gustó, es que tienen una buena organización y atención al cliente para objetos perdidos, así que si extravías alguna cosa puedes ir a los módulos de información y probablemente lo puedas recuperar.

Xcaret es un parque grande, con 3 ríos para hacer nado, acuario, tortugas, delfines, manatíes, jaguar, aviario, mariposario y muchos más. Todo el día recorres y haces un break a mediodía para almorzar (mi entrada incluía el almuerzo). Hay muchas atracciones típicas, como el show de los caballos y los voladores. El cierre es con un espectáculo que representa varias zonas de México y de su historia. Realmente un imperdible. Si vas a Cancún, Playa del Carmen o Riviera Maya, no dejes de ir! Yo incluí transportación y paquete de fotos...no me arrepiento, mi familia y yo tenemos más de 400 fotos maravillosas.
Un lugar excelente para pasar el dia.
Hermoso lugar

Este parque siempre me sorprende, su mejora constante en sus áreas y servicios son de lo mejor. Pudiera parecer un poco elevado el precio pero si lo comparas con otros parques de atracciones del mundo está equiparable. Enaltecen el orgullo de ser Mexicano y de decir: ¡Todo esto es mi país! Sugiero si se lo pueden permitir la cena en el Teatro Tlaxco un deleite al paladar un menú degustacion que te deja sabor a México en el paladar. El espectáculo... EXCELENTE!!!  Trabajo de bailarines, cantantes, músicos, técnicos muy muy muy loable (solo ver el espectáculo vale el precio de entrada al parque).
Lleguen temprano para hacer lo más que puedan de actividades incluidas, compren la entrada que incluye una comida, es muy buena!!
Siempre volveré y recomendaré Xcaret!!

Definitivamente es uno de los parques más completos en México,  en Diciembre, 2017 fue mi segunda visita al lugar; sin embargo mi valoración de este lugar no es excelente, debido a que ya lo  había vistazo antes y creo que han bajado la calidad en su atención al cliente y los atractivos que ofrece. Uno de sus principales atractivos es es el espectáculo musical nocturno México Extraordinario, en el cual muestran un poco de la historia y cultura mexicana, agregando ahora el carnaval Xcaret que me pareció grotesco y no aporta nada de lo que México es. Espero pronto eliminen esta parte del espectáculo y le den un mejor cierre. Mejoren la atención al cliente principalmente del personal que orienta para proporcionar los chalecos y equipo de snorkel.
Super...muy bien parque. Costoso
Me agrada mucho el cuidado que tienen por la naturaleza

So, to begin, my review is tainted. We travelled with two very young children, 6 and 4. We paid half price for the 6 year old and my 4 year old was free: nice, or so we thought. There is a SIGNIFICANT amount of walking on not always easy to navigate terrain and, further, there were quite a few things not appropriate for children as young as my kids were, including snorkel equipment that doesn't fit, which means we had to carry them through the rivers and couldn't do a whole lot in the snorkel coves. Plus, taking the resort tour option means a 7am departure from the hotel zone in Cancun and a 10:30pm return after the show. Again, not great for the young ones. We understand there's a 4:45 departure; however, that's too early. If your kids are older. Perhaps 7-9 and up, great place. Much like a very well stocked interactive metropolitan zoo. Pricey.. Actually... Too pricey, but would be fun. Still wouldn't earn a 5 star even with the notreallylittlekidfriendly because of the price, but, a 3 is a fair objective score. I'd still give it 4 if they realized even with the kid discount, the parents who can't do much since their kids are small are paying full price too. Fine. I'll say 3.5.
Hermoso
Older, rather tame, lots of walking.
eхcelenтe lυgar... al 100% recoмendado, dιverѕιón a lo grande
Simplemente otro mundo...
Expectacular, un lugar para ir en familia
SO MUCH TO SEE... SO MUCH TO DO... FOOD DELISH... ALOT OF WALKING BUT WORTH IT!!! 2 DAY PASS IS SUGGESTED FOR THOSE WHO CAN'T LAST ALL DAY!!!

Great window into the Mexican culture. The swim in the underground (man-made) river is a must. You leave your stuff at the entrance and it is transported to the exit (including your towel). The evening show is very colorful and enjoyable albeit, two hours was a bit long for me. At the end of the show the crowds were a bit overwhelming but still worth the experience.

Xcaret consiglio a tutti bellissimo parco per una giornata splendida e indimenticabile e con i suoi rio da visitare sono 3 e buffet a volontà amache per riposare puoi nuotare con i delfini a parte si paga il tour.

Muito bom, faça o passeio pelo rio subterrâneo primeiro, pois mais tarde talvez não tenha forças;  o show que finaliza o dia, é simplesmente emocionante. Compre a bag para colocar o celular e entrar no rio no Wallmart, pois no local é uma facada.

El show es grandioso y convivir de esta manera con la naturaleza es increíble!
El servicio, el buffet y el ecosistema que tiene es algo muy diferente
Massive park to adventure through.  Was truly amazing to experience all it had to offer.  Just need a couple days to get through it all.

El parque sigue siendo bonito, sin embargo, han hecho cambios en los servicios que lo encarecen, por ejemplo:  cobran las toallas para secarse al salir del río,  ya no proporcionan visores, ni bebidas. Ahora incluyen en el precio de entrada unicamente la comida con un vaso de cerveza  y todo el refresco que uno desee durante este servicio. Si en el transcurso del día uno desea una bebida, ésta se debe pagar a precio dolar.  No estoy de acuerdo que en el espectáculo nocturno incluyan la historia de la aparición de la virgen de Guadalupe, pues da la impresión de que México tiene al catolicismo como la religión oficial y no es así.

The unique thing about the Park is the river float.  We really enjoyed it.  But it take a significant time to get the gear and to keep things in the lockers and be ready for the river float -- especially if you have young kids. 
While the river float is good it ends at beach and that means you have skipped a big part of the park and have to walk back quite a bit if you really want to enjoy those activities.  We didn't realize this and that made us miss out on quite a few of the activities.  Snorkelling was closer to the beach, but it was extremely crowded and there wasn't much fish variety worth the effort.  
My younger one did enjoy the kids park, but the rest of us didn't have much to do for the hour while he played.  
Food was good at the buffet.  Lots of variety.  
The evening show was good especially the first part where they had the game and the history.  
The rivier float saved the day else I wouldn't recommend spending 100+ on this park.

O parque é muito bonito e divertido, muito grande para ser explorado em um dia.

O passeio dos rios subterrâneos é incrível, bem calmo e tranquilo, feito com colete (não leve chinelos pois vai atrapalhar) e a água tem boa temperatura.

Fomos na praia artificial que é bacana, no México Espetacular (show de duas horas que conta a história do México), na piscina natural para experimentar o snorkel e comemos no restaurante de carnes (parrillada).

DICA: compre o pacote Xcaret Plus, pois você pode deixar suas coisas no armário trancado, escolher um restaurante, 1 bebida alcoólica, e já está incluído o aluguel da máscara de snorkel.

Compramos os ingressos pela internet com 1 mês de antecedência (com no mínimo 21 dias de antecedência você tem mais desconto), incluindo um nado com golfinhos para a minha esposa. Chegando lá às 10 horas, o nado com os golfinhos foi agendado para as 2:30. OK.

O nado foi realizado, e após fomos para uma sala com computadores para escolhermos as fotos do álbum. Pasmem, um álbum pequeno com 18 fotos custou 100 dólares. Sim, foi isso que vocês leram, 100 dólares. O atendimento foi muito demorado, coisa de 1 hora, pois não encontravam as fotos na minha esposa no sistema, e a loja das fotos já ia fechar.

Ficou combinado que poderíamos pagar e pegar o álbum mais tarde ne loja principal do parque, que fica na entrada. Antes de ir para o México Espetacular, por volta de 6:45 da noite fomos à loja e pagamos pelo álbum, que não estava pronto. A atendente nos disse que entregaria no sábado às 8 da manhã em nosso hotel em Playa Del Carmem (isso foi em uma quinta-feira).

Pois bem, chegou sábado e o álbum não tinha sido entregue. Após ligar para o atendimento da Delphinus, a moça afirmou que o álbum não tinha sido pago, sendo que estávemos com o comprovante e pagamos US$100.00 em espécie. Ela então confirmou o pagamento e disse que não seria possível entregar o álbum no hotel em Playa del Carmem, e que este chegaria em nossa casa no Brasil.

Após 2 semanas, o álbum chegou via FeDex com um valor declarado de apenas R$ 9.80 + R$ 160.80 de frete. Ou seja, a Receita Federal Brasileira cobrou bizarros R$ 214.94 de impostos pela "importação" deste álbum de US$ 3.00 que nos foi vendido a R$ 100.00. Paguei com cartão de crédito e cobrei o reembolso da empresa responsável (Delphinus), e estou esperando a transferência para o Banco do Brasil.

Um nado com golfinhos nos parques da Flórida é muito mais profissional e bem menos amador do que neste parque Xcaret.

La verdad algunas cosas como el paquete para fotos , estando sólo no lo recomiendo porque es muy caro ! Ofrecen un paquete no recuerdo como se llama pero es en una lancha grande la cual te dicen que en adrenalina es la mejor y obvio más caro  ! Lo cual no encontré nada de adrenalina sólo clava los frenos por así decir y la trompa se clava de punta en el agua y eso hace que te tape de agua esa es la parte de adrenalina la cual no me gustó porque ínsisto no tiene nada de eso ! Antes de subir no quieren que lleves cámara de ningún tipo ya que dicen que por la velocidad se desprende y puede golpear a alguien y perder la cámara, lo cual yo tenía 1 GoPro con guante y era lo único con lo que podía subir para captar ese pequeño viaje , después de insistir me dejaron subir y ahí fue cuando supe que sólo hablaban por hablar para que pagues las fotos que la cámara tiene en la lancha ! Insisto no es nada grave ! En lo demás el parque estaba bueno muy grande había para recorrer , ise lo del río subterráneo que no es natural  ! En el trayecto había cada 100 metros salidas para quienes se cansaban y unos puntos sin iluminación la verdad no me gustó.
Al final el shows de la cultura e historia Maya del que tantos hablaban que muestran un poco de como empezó la conquista y demás,
Maravilloso lugar!!!
Costoso para las atracciones que ofrece y que son adicionales a la entrada
Increíble!
Excelente
It was pretty awesome visiting this park, we had so much fun and the food was so delicious.

Muy padre el lugar, la comida y todo, lo malo es que las actividades extras son muy caras para el turista nacional y no acabas de recorrer el parque en un solo dia, se necesitan dos o hasta tres dias para terminarlo, los espectaculos México espectacular y el nacimiento del Dios del Maíz son hermosos, Fantasticos!!!

Xcaret is an amazing park!!!! We brought 2 kids, 7 and 9 years old, and we all had a blast! We did the full underground river run and at every turn, it was an amazement. We had a great dinner at one of the restaurants near the beach. The fish tacos were amazing!  My husband had a health episode at the park(not related to the park) and the medic team was amazing and very caring with us. They took care of my kids, me, and my husband. Israel from Xcaret was an angel. He came to the emergency room to check on us and made sure we received our bag we left behind in the locker room. We stayed at a resort an hour south and they sent our bag all the way to our resort before we left Mexico. They are such wonderful people. We are very blessed to meet these people.   Even with our misfortune, we still had a very memorable time there.  Thank you Xcaret, the medic team, Israel, and many customers who tried to help us.
Increibleeeee

Nous sommes allés avec les enfants dont un en poussette. Il y a beaucoup de marches et donc, ce n'est pas évident. Néanmoins, l'endroit est super beau. Nous n'avons pu voir la majorité des animaux qui étaient cachés. Il a un habitat de papillons qu'il faut vraiment visiter, c'est de toute beauté.

I expected a little more for Xcaret plus admission ticket. 
If you do not have the money to pay for the extra activities, I do not think the park is worth the visit. We bought extra activities and enjoyed them, but they come at a high price. 
People told us the park is like Disney world but in a waterpark theme, trust me - it’s not! 
Most people said the kids would LOVE it too, but it didn’t live up to the hype. 
The visit would be the biggest regret if we did not have money to purchase the extra activities. 
Too me and my wife, the $6-700 would be better spent elsewhere. 

One surprisingly positive thing was the buffet in the Mexican restaurant. I expected the food to be cheap and basic, but was actually good. 

A tip to a family’s like ours for example is to not purchase the photo package per person but for one only as anyone can joins the pic of the person whom scans the wristband. 
A waist of money to buy the photo package for every single person. 
We are two adults, and two kids at 4 and 9. 

I am sure a person from Xcaret will come up with some standard protective excuse for my review but the place is not for everyone. 

I would revisit Disney world, but unfortunately I would not revisit Xcaret. 
Not recommended if your not a tourist trap kind of family that loves to visit and see authentic things. 

It’s a tourist trap kind of money machine. 

If that’s your cup of tea, go for it!

We went to xcaret and had a blast, even my 4 year old, just try to bring a wet suit if you don’t think you can handle fresh like cold water.. since the cenotes are flowing natural water and my lil one was complaining during the river swimming 😁 we all love it!!!

We visited Cozumel in Dec 2017 on Rhapsody of the Seas. Usually we schedule our own excursions but we selected a ship's tour to the Xcaret Eco Park about 6 miles south of Playa del Carmen on the Mexican mainland. The trip was butter smooth with a special ferry to Playa, a bus waiting in town for a short ride to the park and entry into the park. And what a park! Think Disney World with nature as a theme. Beautiful grounds. Animals, birds, butterflies, fish, dolphins, turtles and so on. Great photo ops, swimming, snorkeling, aquarium and so on. It was so large the paths had colored lines - "Follow the black line to the red line. Cut over on the blue - you restaurant is just down the white line" A really fun day. Highly recommended.
Es un lugar muy lindo y amplió con una diversidad e interacción con lo natural y lo cultural, desestresantes y ecologistas son las instalaciones.

Visite este parque en el 2014 y vale la pena ir siempre, tiene de todo para todos los gustos, por favor no te pierdas el show México espectacular que lo dan al final del paseo, es largo pero cuentan toda la historia de este maravilloso país. La comida en el bufett ahí es deliciosa y lo rico es que tienes todo el día para explorar animales y hacer lo quieras.
Planning on getting married here!

This is exactly like a Mexican Disney Park.

Booked via a tour agent in Isla shopping centre few days before. Included travel one main buffet meal and snorkelling with lockers. 

Got there at 10.30ish spend 2-3 hours easily going through the caves using flippers and life jackets- surreal first time experience. Loved this. Although very rocky hit my knees few times under the water. Was so fun though!!! GOES A BIT DARK BUT HANDY WE TOOK OUR PHONE we used our phone as a torch which the other people appreciated haha

After this got changed and dried off using our clothes which we packed in advance and put in their bags which they give back to us at the end of the river.

After this we went to our dolphin interax package which we bought at the entrance on the same day.  They guy was selling it for 50% discount so tried to haggle with him but he didn't budge. He said we had to book another single excursion to get 50% off so I told my Hubbie to do the foot spa with fishes as it was the next cheapest thing. 

DOLPHIN INTERAX was amazing. First time with dolphins and hubbie was super scared of dolphins but I made him come with me as I knew he would not regret it!
The package was great although was only 30minutes. Wish I could have spent more time with the dolphins but we had a group of 10 which took time for everyone to take photos with the dolphin. Next time I would do the primax dolphin package as the dolphins do a lot more and we got to watch the others do primax. Looked more entertaining. 
After this we bought 2 printed photos in a dolphin wooden frame, USB with all photos and video package all for $150 and thisnwas with haggling. Easy enough to haggle. Worth getting some pics otherwise no point really doing the dolphin package. 

HIGHLY RECOMMEND- 
+buy aqua shoes from walmart in advance
+get a waterproof phone cover to take pics
+do dolphin primax for extra charge but great and professional and fun experience
+buy photos, videos from dolphin agents but must HAGGLE

The mexican extravaganza was surreal.and an experience I will never forget. The best live performance I have ever seen second the the lion king. Was great to learn the history through song and dance and role play. Special effects was AMAZING and the finalli was great! We got to the show last but the staff brought us chairs on front row which was an added bonus!

Es un lugar repleto de naturaleza en el cual te olvidas un momento de la tecnología y te conoctas con la naturaleza, disfrutas de los rios subterráneos tanto como al aire libre, puedes tener una agradable comida frente al mar, ver a muchas especies animales en su reservam y en la noche disfrutar del espectáculo el cual simplemente es maravilloso, además a lo largo del día puedes difrutar de diversos pequeños shows en el parque.
Lugar maravilhoso , cozinhas maravilhosas, show espetacular, vale muito a pena, uma experiência fantástica.

Parque Resort Ecológico con entretenimiento para chicos y grandes. El paquete Xcaret Plus que incluye transporte, una comida con bebidas sin alcohol, la ruta de ríos y espectáculo nocturno “ Xcaret Mexico espectacular “ es suficiente para familias. De las actividades extraordinarias  ( costó extra) sugiero la de caminar bajo el agua  ( Sea Trek) admirando la belleza submarina, el nado con delfines y el Paquete de fotografías. El parque y su concepto está de primer mundo

Estuve con mi familia en Xcaret hace pocos días, el parque en general es bueno, bonito y bien conservado pero su relación precio beneficio es realmente pobre. Dada mi experiencia negativa, comienzo por lo Feo

Lo Feo: El manejo poco serio y exagerado de precios.
- Nos habían comentado que había una promoción para nadar con los Delfines 2x1, es decir, USD por persona (Adicional a una entrada de USD135).  En el bus que nos recogió el guía fue insistente en que comparamos los planes a la entrada dado que se acababan las reservas, (la mayoría de los planes de XCARET son adicionales al pago de la entrada lo que lo hace muy costoso), hice la fila de casi 30 minutos y le pregunté al vendedor por la promoción, siendo específico en el precio.  Me dijo que no era cierto, que el valor eran USD 100 por persona, ante el valor me abstuve de comprarlo y pagué por nadar con las Mantarayas.  Pasada una hora, en el parque, se nos acerca una persona del puesto de ventas del parque, de las mismas que me había atendido, y nos ofrece de frente nadar con delfines por USD 50, es decir, el 50% menos que en la entrada.  Me pareció deshonesto, una falta de respeto, de claridad y me molesté, pedí que me cambiaran el plan de las mantarayas por los delfines a ese valor, la persona se negó y me dijo que ya tenía que tomar lo que había comrpado, que si quería delfines era adicional.  Realmente esto me molestó y luego de pedirles que me dieran por escrito el nuevo valor de los delfines el supervisor se puso nervioso dado que la discusión alejó todos los clientes y se acercó para acceder a hacer el cambio muy a regañadientes.     Nadamos con los delfines y al salir nos llevaron a ver las fotos, el paquete completo valía USD 170, me pareció costoso y agradecí la oferta pero no la tomé, en cuestión de 1 minuto el vendedor me las ofreció en USD 100, que falta de seriedad, los precios son exagerados y además los cambian descaradamente.

Lo Malo
Los precios son exagerados y casí todos los planes son adicionales, lo que lo hace un parque de mínimo USD 200 por persona por visita.

Lo bueno:
Está bien cuidado, es bonito, el rio sí está incluído y es bueno, la comida es buena y abundante.
Excelente!!!

El parque es precioso y hay atracciones de todo tipo. Tal vez los mayores de 12 no tengan tantas opciones para ellos. El show final es imponente pero muy largo (de 7pm a 9pm). Yo saqué el paquete plus que incluye el almuerzo y había bastante variedad en el buffet. Si van con niños pequeños vayan primero a la zona de Kids World porque hay juegos y tobogán de agua así no queda para el final.
we enjoyed

Xcaret park is WASTE of time and money. You pay 60$ per person for each activity and waste whole day, walking around the park. You pay 15$ per a photo at the park. Basically, you pay over 100$ per person for food and walking only.

The 2 pluses of the hotel overall are: heated pool and shuttles to/from adventure parks and airport. The price tag is BIG for this hotel. Unless you are planning to go to the adventure parks with your kids, think twice before staying here.

We got the Xcaret Plus package which included a bufete lunch, we also added the transportation and photo package. The Plus package and transportation are a good value, they pick you up at your hotel to arrive at the park around 9am, there are two return schedules: 4:45 and 9:40 pm. We stayed for the late departure and had a chance to see the night show which was really worth it. The park is beautiful, the food at the bufete is really good and adding transportation is the way to go... that said as we were arriving to the park we were told that the week between Christmas and New Year is the busiest and they were not kidding! The place was so packed you couldn’t swim or snorkel without kicking or getting kicked by someone else. We also bought the photo package, but the park was so full 90% of our pictures have other people in them. Also I haven’t been able to download the pictures and I’m still waiting for someone to assist with that. I would have preferred to be denied tickets for those dates rather than paying so much to have such a crowded experience.
Amazing, so much interesting things to do, and the show is incredible
Excelente lugar muy bonito para visitar
Excelente experiencia!!
Muy bonito lástima que no cumplen lo que ofrecen en los paquetes hay que leer muy bien las letras chiquitas

The park in general is so big and pretty there are animals everywhere and the activities are to die for

Fue sin duda alguna la mejor de las experiencias!! Volveria sin duda alguna, vale totalmente la pena, lo tiene todo. Te hace sentir orgulloso de ser mexicano! todos los shows son increíbles pero el nocturno se lleva todo es algo maravilloso. Fui sola con mi niño y fue muy pesado por que las actividades cansan pero lo volveria a repetir mil veces, es un lugar fenomenal. Eso si no alcanza un día para ver todo, así que hay que priorizar lo que quieres conocer, yo ya había visto criadero de tortugas y en isla mujeres había nadado con delfines, así que priorice aviario, playa y demás, que me fue muy conveniente ya que no me hubiera dado tiempo de conocer!! Mi pequeño y yo amamos este lugar!

We were looking for a day out during our holiday and decided on this park. 
Upon entering the park we soon realised it was a full day trip. 
We followed the highlighted routes on the park map and this really helped making sure we saw what we wanted to see and saved time and energy. 
The butterflies and birds were amazing but the highlight was the river trip. I would recommend taking the flippers you will need them and if you only do one river trip we were recommended the Mayan river, which was excellent. 
The show at the end was amazing and the highlight of the day so save some time and energy for this. Try to get their early to avoid the crowds and to get good seats (at least an hour).
Excelente lugar, ideal para visitarlo con la familia

Mi segundo lugar favorito de Riviera Maya, volvería a ir 10 veces

El parque es muy bonito, tiene muchas áreas naturales y cuidan mucho las instalaciones. El problema que yo veo es que hay tantas actividades que no lo puedes recorrer en un día y mucho menos realizar todas porque obviamente tienen un costo extra, pero si realizas por lo menos una la vas a pasar muy bien, también por esa razón es mejor llegar al parque temprano. Te recomiendo comprar el brazalete plus porque te incluye la comida tipo buffet sin límite de bebidas (agua, refrescos, etc) y hay una zona exclusiva para los que adquieren este brazalete. En cuanto al espectáculo de la noche, es increíble, lo disfrutan tanto extranjeros como turistas nacionales y está incluido en la entrada general. Otro detalle son las fotos, en todo el parque hay camaras que toman fotografías con sólo escanear tu brazalete y al final del día puedes comprarlas todas de manera digital por lo que es una buena opción tomar todas las que puedas y si al final te gustan, adquirirlas.

Hola qué tal esto es una experiencia muy grata excelente comida un super trato de todos los que laboran aquí instalaciones super lo mejor increíble lugar Dios bendiga nuestro México estoy muy contento con mi familia quisiera un día traer a mis padres aque conoser estas maravillas
