Uno de los mejores parques de Cancún, muy grandes, con restaurantes muy ricos, gente amable y muy atenta. Es necesario ir más de dos veces para poder conocerlo bien, un lugar que se debe visitar.
Aparte el show en la noche es maravilloso; un lugar muy encantador.
Es un lugar mágico, excelente para pasar unos dias. Todo en este lugar es muy agradable y la comida es deliciosa.

We loved our trip to Xcaret. We were two families who went for the trip. The Park is managed very professionally. We loved the good with the package. The dolphin experience was just awesome.
Te evening show In Xcaret is a must do, if you are visiting the park. 
We would suggest that you take some water and refreshments with you, it is a long and tiring day. 
The park should have some more water activities that are interesting for the kids and one does not have to pay for them separately.

El parque tiene todas las facilidades como lockers , vestidores, baños, restaurantes , bares. Hay varias actividades por hacer y cierran con un show que esta incluido
Hay actividades adicionales pero la verdad que el parque es tan grande que un dia no es suficiente y mas si quieres ihacer actividades adicionales
Rentan toallas tambien y tienen el servicio de fotos que es 60 usd por dos personas y te tomas ls fotos que quieras en los puntos que tienes para escanear tu brazalete.
Pero si tienes camara waterfproof podrias considerar la opcion

me encanta ir a este lugar ya que lo tiene todo, no te cansas de caminar, nadar, correr, gritar y comer muy rico. ahorita con tu brazalete de todo incluido puedes subirte a la torre escénica de Cancún.
Este lugar es muy chido

Es mi segunda visita a Excaret en un espacio de 5 años...excelente y recomendable.  Para quienes no hallan realizado una caminata marina, este es el lugar para hacerlo.   Recomiendo comprar el plan de ingreso y alimentación; los restaurantes ofrecen un almuerzo tipo Bufete variado y abundante.   El punto a mejorar, el ingreso; aún cuando compramos las entradas en la web, lo cual es recomendable por el descuento, nos demoramos casi 45 minutos en el proceso.

This resort needs to get rid of their sad and cruel animal enclosures. The jaguars and pumas are on an island 50ft wide when they are meant for miles and miles of jungle. The aquatic animals are on top of eachother in tanks, but their territory is meant to be the open ocean. The bird and butterfly exhibits are amazing, the rivers are amazing, but please think twice about donating your money to animal exploitation.

We spent Christmas Day at Xcaret with a group of 7 people. There was something for everyone there.  We spent lots of time exploring the entire park and don't think we got to see everything, that's how big it is.
The show at the end of the evening is definitely worth waiting around to see. Such a great performance of song, dance and theatrics. 
Only two minor cons to the park were that with our package deal the lockers that were included were far away at times when we needed them and would have to pay for the other lockers around the park, but we managed.  The other downfall is at the end of the night, after the show the exit is extremely cramped and so if you have small children or strollers be careful. Many people are pushy to get out, even though the buses are there waiting for everyone.
A great escape and well worth the money.
Un lugar maravilloso, no dejes de visitar

Gracias a valeria por ayudarnos. Y el parque muy interesante el show increible solo nos falto tiempo para recorrerlo todo pero no nos arrepentimos de nada y el temascal una experiencia extraordinaria se los recomiendo
un excelente lugar para disfrutar la playa, el acuario muchas atracciones más, muy limpio

Un lugar que debe estar incluido en tu itinerario si vas a Cancún, es lo máximo, se recomienda  ingresar al Xcaret ni bien lo abran ya que el día te va a faltar para visitar Las mil y una maravillas que se pueden hacer en este lugar, si eres muy organizado vas a poder visitar todos los lugares en un solo día. Éxitos.

Si bien es cierto que la entrada al parque es muy onerosa,, también cierto es que cada peso que se paga se desquita a plenitud, ya que desde los amantes de los deportes acuáticos, pasando por aquellos que prefieren admirar  la naturaleza o los que gustan de la historia, e incluso los que prefieren los espectáculos como representaciones teatrales, o aquellos que prefieren simplemente disfrutar de una buena comida y tenderse al sol, todos sin excepción tienen cabida en dicho lugar, porque Xcaret tiene eso y más para cada gusto, complaciendo hasta a los más exigentes, es un verdadero paraiso terrenal, con lo que nos percatamos la razón por la cual nuestros ancestros decidieron habitar dicho lugar. Con la gustosa amenaza de que no podrán conocerlo en un día, es más necesitan varios días para conocerlo realmente y correran el riesgo de volverse Xcaretadictos.
We visited this place for the first time. We enjoyed the underground rivers are amazing. Definitely will visit it again. We recommend to buy Xcaret Plus ( Admission + Round Transportation + Buffet ).

Loved the river ride and the beach.

Very incredible experience at this place. Snorkeling and swimming in the underground river was an excellent experience. Very kid friendly and at the show at the end is very heart changing moment!!!
What can I say so much to do from swimming down underground caves to turtles and dolphins to night entertainment in the main show arena.

My husband and I went to Xcaret for our honeymoon, about 20 years ago.  It was an excursion option on our Carnival Cruise this month, so we jumped at the chance to return.  While visiting through the cruise line didn't give us enough time to do everything offered, it did give us a guided tour for our group of 15.  We raced through the shops, the ruins, the aviary, the butterflies, and the waterfalls, so we could get to the lazy river.  Personally, I wanted to take my time, but we just didn't have it.  We swam down the Azul leg of the river.  The water was cold, but refreshing.  We swam for about 40 minutes, enjoying the scenery and the underground portions of the swim.  It was a wonderful experience.  The park has changed a lot in 20 years, so we'd like to go back to spend a full day enjoying all it has to offer.

We ended the excursion by eating at one of the restaurants in the park.  The food was AMAZING and authentic, not at all like the Mexican food we get at home.

I would absolutely recommend visiting the park, but I'd recommend spending an entire day there, if you can.  If you can't, some time is better than none.
Um parque muito bonito, vale cada centavo investido. Gostamos muito e esperamos retornar. Acorde bem e vá com energia, pois, o parque é grande e vc tem que aproveitar bem.

We spent a day with family and friends there. The children had a lot of fun. You can see all kind of birds ,butterflies ,animals. You can swim in a lazy river. When you get hungry you can have a nice lunch there.

While staying at all inclusive hotel in Cancun we decided to not miss the Xcarat park during our first trip to Mexico. This huge park is build with perfect organization and direction that you neither get lost not miss anything you want to explore. Amazon river, Art & Culture Museum, beach side natural pools and swings as well as Espectacular night show were on top of our list.

Overall we had a great family day at the park, our sons are 8 and 9, and were a good age for the park.  It was well laid out, easy to understand, all of the staff were very friendly, and everyone was helpful.  We were there the week after New Years, so it was not as busy, which was great.  Our kids loved the underground river and the snorkeling area, we all enjoyed the different animals, and my wife loved the fish pedicure.  The food was average at best, but that was what I was expecting.  We took a taxi from our hotel both ways and that made the day easier, with less travel time.  We arrived just before they opened, which was a good move relative to the crowds.  We also followed the advice on Trip Advisor reviews, we dropped our gear in the lockers, then did a bunch of “dry” activities  for a few hours, then had lunch, by that time it was warmer, and then we did the water activities.  Others have commented that the under ground river is cold, I think it is cold if you just float along on the journey, we swam and kept moving, so neither my wife nor I found it to be cold.  I would keep in mind a lot of the items are “manufactured”, so it is an easy way to get the feel for certain local items, but it is not authentic.  If you want a more authentic experience, and your kids are a little older, I think you should look elsewhere.  One issue is how narrow the paths are in some places, I commented to my wife that Walt Disney would roll his eyes at how tight it was.  For us it was a small annoyance, but if the park was really busy it could be an issue, it would also be an issue if you have a stroller, or someone in a wheel chair.  Overall it was great for the age of our kids and it was an easy one stop, self contained, attraction.

segundo piso donde hay unas barandas de madera que dan al primer piso sin embargo en un momento desafortunado el nieto se soltó de la mano de su abuela (este nieto es un niño de 4 años y vive en Quebec) y fue a dar a una plataforma redonda de cemento que es como si fuera un arreglo para colocar músicos arriba que amenizan la comida en fin no había ningun aviso o reja, impedimento para evitar que un niño se encontrara corriendo encima de esta plataforma que no tiene ninguna proteccion, tampoco había ningun guardia de seguridad se pudo rescatar el infante pero con gran susto pues estuvo a punta de caer al vacio.
Creo que deben ajustar sus prioridades de seguridad y vigilancia en este caso fallaron gracias a Dios no sucedio nada, revisen esta plataforma por favor Restaurante La isla segundo piso, por favor sellen la entrada en cualquier momento puede haber un siniestro, muchas gracias.

Both of these items had to meet a special ecological neutrality and biodegradable standard. Of course we found this out on our way to the water park and spent more money on one time use items. 

The lunch buffet was okay and there was lots of food items for all in our party to eat something good. Of course after a morning of wandering and swimming lots of things taste great. I would recommend anyone in the area visit at least once.

The park has something for any age:  Wildlife, Water, and Walks through jungle settings.  But this is also the handiwork of great science and ecology applications.  Look for the botany labs, marine biology, and agricultural science.  There's a lot of brainpower here.  For us, the main event was the big building that held Mexican artwork and historical artifacts.  You'll see reproductions of living quarters, for example that have much charm and hold memories of a culture rich in family traditions.  Look for the children's'  toy display.  My generation of US education spent little time on Latin America, not to mention our wonderful Mexcican neighbors.  We're catching up now . . . 
Dr. Bill Wallisch, Colorado Springs

We were initially put off by the price tag to this place, but quickly realized it's 100% worth the cost.  There are so many things to do and see, plus you're helping with their conservation efforts.  I can't describe everything, but quickly there is:

-swimming with dolphins
-swimming with sharks
-'lazy rivers' for floating
-horse shows
-restaurants/bars
-aviary 
-butterfly house
-animal exhibits
-massage
-those fish that nibble your feet
-so much more

There is so much to do and see, that you might not know where to start!  Grounds are maintained impeccably, and the staff was really helpful. There are maps all over so you won't get lost, and they have color-themed walkways to tell you what part of the park you're in.  

**Make sure to hit the evening show exhibiting Mexican culture! It's absolutely fantastic. Get there a bit early to get a good seat. They also have free wifi in that particular venue!  But seriously, the show was one of the highlights of our stay in Playa del Carmen.

Il faut payer pour tout, limite pour respirer.
Nous y sommes allé avec une agence, on était 6 personnes, on a payé 129 $US chacun.
Honnêtement, si ça nous avait coûté 60 ou 70 $ j'aurai donné une meilleure note, mais 129 $ pour ce qu'on a eu, c'est limite du vol.
Pour commencer il faut nager un bon 40 minutes dans une espèce de rivière. Il faut aller louer un gilet de sauvetage, un casier, un sac dans lequel mettre  et des nageoires (Ou si vous avez des souliers aquatiques, pas besoin de nageoires). Le monsieur de l'agence nous avait dit de ne rien mettre de valeur dans le sac, car il jettent les sacs et donc il y a risque de briser les affaires. Sauf que dans le sac il y a une petite trousse solide dans laquelle on peut mettre les trucs fragiles, la trousse est pas très grande cependant.

Dans la rivière il y avait beaucoup trop de monde, j'ai reçu une centaine de coup de nageoire, et le pire c'est que c'est vraiment vraiment long, au début c'est cool mais après ça devient très pénibles.

Après ça, on se rend rapidement compte qu'il n'y a pas grand chose à faire. Il y a les restaurants, des buffets (donc beaucoup de plats mais aucune qualité), il y une place pour faire de l'apnée mais c'est petit. on peut se baigner aussi. On peut aller voir quelques animaux aussi, mais c'est assez rapide.

À la fin de la journée il y a un spectacle qui raconte l'histoire du Mexique, c'est vraiment bien comme spectacle, très bien fait.

Tout le reste, toutes les activités intéressantes, bein il faut payer. Si vous voulez faire toutes les activités, ça coûte environ 550 $US

Avoir su, j'aurai gardé mes sous pour d'autres activités plus intéressantes

Lo único que a mi criterio fue bueno es el show, por el resto, para olvidar

Xcaret is huge, and there are things to see and do for people of all ages. But, we basically wasted the first two hours of our visit wandering through relatively uninteresting areas before we found the areas really worth visiting. So here is my hint: Look at the visitor’s map, and find your way as quickly as possible to the red area, where the beaches and water activities are. We had the buffet lunch in a restaurant overlooking the sea (the lunch is included in the $129 VIP ticket but extra with the $99 regular admission); then watched the adjacent dolphin show; then wandered over to one of the beaches, found vacant loungers, ordered drinks and relaxed in the sun. 

    From there, we followed the blue sidewalk, which led us past the sea turtles, manatees, other sea creatures and the aquarium. Our ticket included the 7 p.m. stage show, but having arrived at the park before 10 a.m., we were too tired to stay for it. I would suggest arriving no earlier than Noon if you want to stay for the show. 

    The buffet restaurant we went to had a large assortment of good food, with unlimited opportunities to get back in line and replenish your plate. One man at the table next to us went back three times and a fourth time just to fill his plate with desert items. It should be enough to tide one over until the show, but, if not, there are plenty of small restaurants, cafes and bars all over the park. 

    Late in the day, it might be worth visiting the jaguar and puma enclosures. When we visited them, in late morning, we saw only one puma who was active. All of the others, and all of the Jaguars, were asleep. The aviary also is worth a visit. 

    It’s expensive, but pretty much every attraction on the Riviera Maya is expensive, and once we found our bearings, it was worth the price of admission.

Fui al parque Xcaret el pasado viernes 5 de Enero de 2018, mi sorpresa fue que: ¡Ya no hay peces en los ríos subterráneos! Tanto, que ya ni siquiera te prestan el visor y el equipo de snorkel cuando haces la actividad. En el año 2015 que había asistido, si te prestaban el equipo y era un sinfín de peces multicolores los que veías en los ríos, pero ahora ya no. Solo te limitas ahora a realizar la actividad e ir viendo fuera del agua, ya no lo interesante, que es dentro del agua.

Creo que con esto, ya no vale la pena pagar el alto costo de entrada al parque, ya que por eso había regresado, para la actividad de los ríos subterráneos, la cual ya no es nada atractiva.

Lástima Xcaret, perdieron su mayor atractivo: los peces en los ríos subterráneos.

It was a great park, there are so many things to do. I enjoyed the butterfly farm and see all the animals that are in shelter in this place. We've had a lot of fun and learned a lot of things, too.

A very funny entertaining in  which you can do various activities, you can see some shows at night and the food is decent.
Excelente lugar, el espectáculo nocturno de gran calidad
Sencillamente fantastico!!!
Impresionante. Una experiencia que vale la pena repetir.
Excelente parque ecológico, com um show regional excepcional ao início da noite!!!
El lugar es bastante grande y hay varias actividades que hacer, no es barato, sin embargo vale la pena. Sin lugar a duda lo mejor de Xcaret es el espectáculo de noche es una maravilla
Excelente parque. Con muchísimas atracciones todas incluidas en la entrada. Recomiendo pagar la comida. Lo mejor es el río subterráneo.

molto ampio e suddiviso per ambienti differemti quali quello dedicato al mare con delfini, squali nutrice e tartarughe oppure quello dedicato ai Maya ( tra l'altro nel parco si trovano molti resti archeologici dei Maya) oppure le attività da fare nei fiumi sotterranei, gli spettacoli focloristici degli uomini volanti o dei caballeros e il grande spettacolo serale dedicato al Messico.
Molto bello e divertente

Nos encantó xcaret a pesar que nos llovió mucho. Lo mejor nadar en los rios subterráneos. También nadamos con tiburones y delfines (estos últimos son una preciosura y te hacen interactuar un montón)  se come espectacular y lo más importante NO SE PIERDAN EL SHOW NOCTURNO emociona.
worth everypenny  so much to see and do we have been on a number of visits still im sure we have not seen everything upgrade your ticket to include a meal and drink

En mi opinión el lugar está bien, eso si, las cosas como todo en la región se tasa en dolares americanos, la atención del personal es buena, me gustó el SNUBA en el arrecife, es algo muy bonito que lo recomiendo hacer, el personal que nos dio el tour es muy profesional, en cuanto a la comida es buena, y las atracciones también son buenas.
Un paraíso que vale la pena disfrutar
Muy buen lugar. Un poco caro pero vale la pena si vas de paseo y disfrutar del espectáculo nocturno
Excelente!!!un lugar mágico!!!
Excelente, muchísimo que hacer e imposible de recorrer en un día.
Increíble lugar!!!! 100% recomendable!
A MUST!
Trabajo hay
Me gustó hace parte de la cultura mexicana.

Super lugar para ir en familia, imperdibles, nado con delfines, escafandra y show con cena por la noche. 
Lugar increiblemente hermoso, con paisajes impresionantes
Exelente lugar para conocer
Un lugar lleno de magia que te hace recordar cual orgulloso estas de tu país ❤
One of the most wonderful experiences! Must see
Excelente lugar.
Must visit if you are in Cancun, a little but exquisite taste of Mexican culture

You need a 2 day pass, so much to do and see, spa, water caves, family friendly,   great for all ages, food was perfect,   Entertainment.   The shows are great, the History is better.  lockers to store things,  Turtles, Sharks,  Dolphins,  to many animals to share, everything is fantastic
Si visitas xcaret es prácticamente obligatorio que veas el show México espectacular
Un lugar espectacular me encanto
Maravilloso no hay mas palabras

Went to Xcaret in January this year. Cost was $100.00 US for the basic entrance which varies from their website so beware. FYI Mexico law states that they need ID with credit cards so be sure and take your Id with you  I did not think I would need as I took a cab and just about got turned away. I got there by cab for 310 pesos but return cab fare from the park was 350 pesos. (from,/to Grand Sirenis hotel). I did not do the float down the canal but it looked fun. The park is a zoo/aquarium with a few historical ruins in the park that have been saved. They have other activities in the park for an additional cost. You could swim with dolphins or swim with the sharks . There is a beach you can swim at as well.

The animal shows seem to be at 10 am or 4 pm so if you are going with children who would like to see the shows plan to be there earlier or later. I do not think that an all day excursion to the park would be enjoyable, as I believe the tour stays until after the evening show which I think is too long for most people and kids would be done at noon and for sure 4pm if you went at 8am on the tour bus. 

The park has some interesting animals and does a good job on explaining the importance of being eco in terms of the environment and the animals. The coral reef and turtle exhibits were interesting. The park has a small exhibit that shows a traditional Mayan village with some Mayan type crafts and souvenirs for sale. I liked the fact that they kept the historical ruins with explanations of what they were for.

It was a pleasant visit to the park but I do not feel that it was worth the cost of admission especially for families. I would save your money and take a trip to a zoo near your home .
Excelente lugar para convivir con la naturaleza
We went for the dinner show. The dinner was disappointing, but the show, which is included in your admission to the park is FANTASTIC, do not miss it!

Whaouuuuu magnifique très cher une fois payer l’entrée il faudra encore payer si vous voulez faire d’autre activité comme la nage avec les requins mais sa vaux le coup d’y aller vraiment 
Pour notre part on c contentée du parc c’était déjà top et le coin aquatique pour enfants est magique
Una belleza! Muy padre, excelentes atracciones. Les recomiendo ir 2 días así el recorrido será más tranquilo. Ademas hay descuento por el 2do diam
Maravilllosa experienca, esperamos volver pronto, un parque tematico unico como pocos en el mundo, diferente a todo lo conocido.
Amazingly convenient,  better than a lot of theme parks up north. Lots of activities for kids and an awesome show to end the day

Lugar para todos os gostos, aventura, shows, fauna, flora. Excelente passeio para crianças. Comprei o pacote all inclusive. Vale a pena.Há muitos restaurantes que atendem esse opcional, todos sistema buffet. No que almocei a comida estava fria, aliás em todos os passeios que fiz com almoço incluído a comida estava fria ou muita fria.
Hermoso y su show nocturno, Fantástico!!

Não podem visitar Cancún e não ir a este parque, simplesmente maravilhoso!

Só uma observação para desfrutar de tudo no parque são necessários 2 dias, pois tem circuito por dentro de rios e por terra onde tem varias espécies de animais para serem vistos.
Não é um passeio barato,  mas vale muito a pena, sem contar com os golfinhos que é uma atração à parte!

INCREÍBLE, el parque es muy muy grande, lo recomendable es llegar muy temprano para que de tiempo de disfrutar todo el parque. El espectáculo nocturno aunque dura 2 horas vale muchísimo la pena, excepto por unas partes semi-religiosas.
Vale mucho la pena visitarlo. El río es espectacular. Y se come rico en el buffet
Un lugar mágico

We have done most of the parks at Riviera Maya and this is by far the best one. You have wildlife, food, 4 routes for the natural rivers and the best show in the evening to  end your brilliant day! Expensive but worth every penny!

el recorrido es largo... pero se puede hacer con niños. El contenido es  muy variado.
aprendes de naturaleza, información sobre los mayas, disfrutas del nado en río subterráneo, disfrutas playas, snorkel imperdible (nadas entre los peces de todos colores) en la tarde shows , y ...a quedarse hasta el ultimo show no te va a arrepentir!
The main experience is the underground river.  Wish they had other activities like this.  May add ons.  The kids zone is awesome for kids 8 and under.  Easy walk from the occidental hotel.

Es un lugar maravilloso, en el cual caminas demasiado, definitivamente sino tienes una buena condición física seguramente seria un viaje pesado, asi mismo con niños pekeños seria complicado o pesado, mis niños tienen 6 años y 4 años la pasaron increible lo disfrutaron demasiado !!! se aventaron nadando el rio completo !!! disfrutaron la zona para niños muchisimo !! los laberintos, los obstáculos, los toboganes una experiencia única... No olviden llevar : 
- un costal contra el agua, ahí adentro lo venden en $350 pesos creo...
- chanclas acuáticas 
- un bloqueador
- playera para nadar
- repelente de moscos
- un cambio practico de ropa para despues 

No necesitas mas ! es un lugar mágico definitivamente, único, cuando compres tus tickets inclye la comida te conviene mas y no dejes de visitar este lugar único !!

Xcaret Eco Theme Park was truly a fascinating adventure added to our vacation.  There's so much to see and do even without adding the extra cost of the "extra' activities offered there.  Lots and lots of walking; seems confusing at first, but I would suggest  walking "one colour" at a time - they have numerous coloured paths where there are different activites/scenery.  I loved swimming in the "forever" rivers with my family, although the water is initially a little chilly.  It's hot out, so very refreshing!  The night time show was a collaboration of the history of Mexico, with lots of music and various costumes.  There were 19 family members ranging from 4 months - 71 yrs.  Good for all ages.   A fantastic must to your vacation!

I now understand why most of friends and family recommend that we visit Xcaret. This is a unique eco- theme park which offers activity for all family members. I highly recommend Sea Trek- an unforgettable under water activity. Note that this requires extra cost. The photo package is worth it- we ended up with really great family pictures. Staying late for the Mexico Espectacular show was all worth it- very entertaining and informative. I had better appreciation of the Mexican culture and history after watching the 2 hour show.I must say though that as much as I enjoyed this park, I do not anticipate visiting it again in the near future, but will definitelt recommend to anyone who visits Cancun for the first time.

Le prix d’entrée et des excursion sont TRÈS cher , il nous traite un peu comme une pompe À frique. À part ça qui est désagréable tout était beau, organisé pour recevoir milliers de personnes. La pilule elle   Était  moins dure à avaler en voyants tout à la fin un beau spectacle qui raconte l’histoire de Mexico.

un esperoenza incredibile!
appena entri sei catapultato in un mondo magico ,circondato dalla giungla 
divertimento assicurato lungo il rio con il battello potendo ammirare i pappagalli colorati e i fenicotteri rosa, con i rumori e i versi degli uccelli che ti donano un esperienza incredibile.
poi il percorso  sotto acqua al buio un tocco di adrenalina ....ma il vero tocco magico è lo spettacolo dalle 1900 con tutti i personaggi in costume maya fino alle 22 seduti in arena ad ammirare lo spettacolo con tutte le canzoni del mexico
eccezionale

Me and my husband loved it there, we stayed all day and watched the show in the evening too. 

There is so much to do there, we didn’t have enough time to do everything but we really enjoyed the day. The river swim was amazing and so fun, I’m not a strong swimmer but they give everyone life jackets which kept my float. The river boat ride was also amazing, we got front row seats so was able to take some fantastic photos. 

My husband also really wanted to do the underwater walk, I agreed to do it with him but I’m scared of fish so was very nervous. 
You go 6 meters deep under the sea, they put this helmet on you and a diver walks you down. You hold onto a railing all the way and there are divers who make sure you are safe. Even though I was frightened I felt safe with all the divers around. But my husband loved it, the fish swim around you, there are statues under the water to see, string rays and just an amazing experience to have. I was scared but really happy I done it because it was amazing! 

The show in the evening was fantastic, the actors were amazing, the place was beautiful, the atmosphere was like no other, myself and my husband really enjoyed it and would recommend to anyone, it’s a long day but great value for money !!!
El parque es muy bueno y la atracción del recorrido del rio es espectacular. Sin embargo, es muy costoso para los servicios prestados.

Perfect place to spend a day. Not cheap but worth for every penny. The under ground river about 500 meters is good fun. Use the photo possibility on the way and buy nice photo souvenir. Restaurants good be better.

we spent most day in natural pools and beach area as children enjoyed this the most.  The river that heads from start of park and finishes at far end/by natural pools was a bit of an anticlimax- very dark, very slow and very busy.The childrens adventure park was a bit too shady and therefore more mosquitos so we headed back to coast/beach.  We discovered Xel_ha a few days later and this was definitely much more fun for us as a family of swimmers/snorkelers

Well organised, plenty to see and do. A highlight was the lazy river which look about 40 minutes and was a real adventure.
Wonderful to see all the turtles in such a beautiful setting and the Dolphins were a joy!

We really enjoyed the park, clean, easy to navigate. Wish  USA parks to note.
Loved the turtle nursery, and education. 
It was a long trip from our resort from Cancun, but worth it. 
Go early less crowded, and you are almost done by the time it gets overwhelming, and you are ready to swim... 
Great park for all ages. .

I knew before hand that Xcaret was some kind of water-adventures park. Actually, that's what pretty much it is. Very clean and well designed for families. I have to say that if you want to enjoy XCARET to the fullest you have to spend the whole day in here. I paid for something that wasn't originally included; it was called "Xcaret Adrenalina" which basically is a tour on a fast boat (the speed increases up to 55 miles per hour). Then, the captains will do 360° turns (in a fun and safe way of course). Then your guide will make a pause, to start with the immersions into the waves (again in a fun and safe way). This activity took around 20min.
Then, I spend the whole day seeing the rest of the attractions and eating (they have really good restaurants here, the service was always really kind)
But, I want to focus on the very last activity that Xcaret offers; it is a Broadway type show called "Mexico Espectacular". I've never seen anything like this before. I've been to Cirque du Soleil but this was something else. Basically, "Mexico Espectacular is a two-hour show in which they represent the whole history and heritage of Mexico. The level of performance is magnificent (actors, actresses, costumes, music, sound effects, FX, make-up, everything was incredible). Please don't miss this show. It is worth seeing it and I am sure everyone will enjoy it.

Es un parque extremadamente grande por lo tanto un toma todo el día recorrerlo. Lo visité desde la ciudad de Cancun por ello recomiendo tomar un tourcon transportación,  lo ideal para no perder tiempo es con la empresa oficial llamada "experiencias xcaret", los que te recogen en tu hotel y te regresan de noche o tarde al mismo... En lo que es el parque hay muchísimas actividades para todos los gustos desde snorquel hasta vistas de zoológicos, a considerar que solo incluye una comida en el día,  lo demás es de gasto extra...  Otro punto que no se pueden perder es el show de noche que lleva el nombre de México espectacular,  el que es una gran puesta en escena que impacta. En general un inflatable en la riviera maya.

Ho trascorso una bellissima esperienza nel parco, tra snorkeling, nuoto sotto le grotte, delfini, farfalle e animali ! 
La spiaggia è davvero bella con tanti pesci colorati ..
Non perdetevi lo spettacolo serale in vero stile messicano !

If you are traveling with children, I recommend going to Xcaret for the evening Mexico spectacular show.  My daughters (2 and 1) were both enthralled for almost the full two-hour performance, and my older daughter is still talking about it in detail!  It is impressive on every level...history, sports, music, dancing, cultural performances, animals.  It is like a mini Olympic opening ceremony for Mexico!  Be sure to arrive early to get good seats.  

The Xcaret Park does have some animals, birds, butterflies, etc., but not as many as I expected.  The best part was the sea turtles. The beach at Xcaret is great for little ones...clean and calm with soft sand.  You need to bring your own towels along with you.  We spent about 5 hours at the park to see the animals and go to the beach.  We did the evening show a separate day.

We had a small umbrella stroller, and it was difficult to push through some parts of the white trail (butterfly pavilion, aviary, Mayan village, etc.).  Another couple had a regular baby stroller with the carrier, and I don't know how they navigated parts of the trail.  Be prepared to walk, and wear shoes that you don't mind getting wet.  There are selfie stations for the bracelet photo package, but there aren't as many as I expected, so I would recommend bringing a camera and not relying on the selfie stations.  We did the boat ride instead of swimming in the river because we had the toddlers, and it was fine, but not great.  

I think the evening show was fantastic and exceeded our expectations, while the animal component was lacking.  It feels like the park is trying to be too many different things...zoo, aquarium, cultural center, water park.  I'm glad admission was included with our resort, as I don't think I would have paid over $100 per person to walk around and look for animals and go to the beach.  The show was the single experience that would make it worth the price.
Minha segunda vez no Xcaret, este parque é imperdível pra quem está na região. Tudo é perfeito, organização mil. O show é demais.

O passeio pelo rio subterrâneo e o show noturno fazem valer a pena! Fora isso o parque é muito bonito e muito bem cuidado!

Comprei o pacote plus, e valeu a pena! Almoço muito bom!

Caso queira fazer atividades extras (nadar golfinho, etc), pode ser necessário mais de 1 dia de parque. Conheci o parque todo em 1 dia, mas no ritmo Disney (ou seja, andando mto!!!)
We played the sea trek, swim with sharks. There are lots of fun. But the evening show is the best, we enjoyed time here.

First of all, this place is massive! Be prepared to do a great deal of walking and some of it can be in tight spaces. The park had no brochure maps available, so you constantly had stop and look at a stationary map to figure out where you were going. The whole park is not set up to be English-friendly, so be prepared to try and figure out what is going on yourself. The river is a lot of work do swim, so I would not recommend taking small children that are not strong swimmers. Some of the caves are very dark and this may frighten a small child. 
Most of the food products throughout the park were very reasonable priced, I never felt like we were being gouged. We did not do any tours, so I am not sure how those were. 
The dinner show is the best part about this park. The food was plentiful and the staff at the show was great. If you do not speak Spanish, they do provide a brochure in English that lets you know what is happening in each scene.
Parque temático muito bonito, os circuitos nos rios são brutais a praia e o espetáculo noturno são sem dúvida o melhor de tudo, mas tem sítios muito bonitos pá ver.

Ficamos em um Resort a 10 min de distancia do parque. O parque é enorme, quem tiver disposição chegue cedo para curtir tudo. Tem muita coisa. Fomos em familia, casal e 1 criança de 6 anos. Não conseguimos ir em tudo...rs Rio secreto muuuuito legal, água mega gelada, eles colocam colete salva vidas em todos. em vários pontos do rio não da pé e é escuro. Mais muito divertido. Tem a praia dentro do parque, muito animais, flamingos, araras lindas. Optamos por comprar o ingresso q incluem a alimentação. Comida boa, muitas opções, bebidas a vontade. Dica é comprar uma sapatilha para andar no parque e no Rio Secreto, pq não machuca os pés. Elas são vendidas dentro do parque, porém com preço mais alto.

At the beginning we were hesitating to go to Xcaret thinking it was too familiar. Our hotel convinced us to not miss it. And what a surprise. This park is amazing! You feel like you are in zoo as you have so many animals to see. I particularly enjoyed the birds, butterflies, jaguars and dolphins. Also the show at night must be seen, it is incredible! 
My only disappointment was the free snorkelling area as there is no fishes. And I had one concern about the jaguars and puma wondering if ther are really enjoying to stay on such a small rock.The jaguar was making some strange noise laying at the same place for hours. I hope they are not drugging him. Also I felt some pools were looking small looking at the high number of animals (rays for example).
We had a nice time at Xcaret. It was quite crowded, however the activities are very engaging and they make it easy for you to spend a full day there.

We visited here on the 28th Dec and what a fabulous day out! As we are in our 60’s we didn’t want to swim the lazy river but took the raft-that was brilliant and only took 15 mins! The swim took 2 hours! We walked around and saw baby turtles just hatched in tanks then one month old and then 1yr old in tanks then saw giant turtles about 4-5 ft in diameter swimming next to us in another lazy river-what some fab photos! Then it was on to swimming with sharks and dolphins-we only watched! Tapirs,spider monkeys and a Puma and Jaguar-then on to the butterfly house and hundreds of beautiful butterflies landing on us and that was on two levels then on to the aviary-OMG!- that was on 3 levels with waterfalls and trees and plants and the birds-we have never seen so many colourful Macaws and parrots,Toucans,Flamingos,Pelicans,ducks and many more! They have a beach and lots of restaurants! Then we had a spectacular show from 7-9 pm of the Mayan history like their football using only their hips and arms-flame hockey-with their balls of fire-amazing! Then songs and dancing and Parrots,horses,war games-it was so jaw dropping and totally awesome! Everyone so enjoyed the performances! A definitely go to many times!

En general el parque me pareció increíble, la naturaleza, las atracciones, creo que definitivamente los ríos subterráneos son obligatorios si visitas este parque. Existen más actividades a realizar en el parque aunque algunas tienen costo extra como el nadar con delfines o hacer snorkeling. Además de estas actividades es muy importante investigar los shows que se presentan en el parque porque hay muchos que valen la pena y sobre todo el último show antes del cierre del parque es sin lugar a duda un espectáculo que no se pueden perder, ya que este da a conocer muchas de las tradiciones y costumbres que existen en el país, es un evento que muestra una gran parte de la cultura mexicana.

Superbe parc où nous passons facilement toute la journée, tant de choses à faire ! Une journée bien remplie qui se termine encore sur un spectacle folklorique retraçant l'histoire du Mexique et de leur culture, des costumes magnifiques ! J'avais fait Xel-ha quelques années plus tôt, Xcaret vaut vraiment le supplément de prix !

La verdad es un lugar mágico es impresionante que llegues y parece que lo acaban de hacer y preparar para tu llegada es Staff es muy atento, las atracciones con las que cuenta el lugar son muy divertidas y lindas, fue toda una experiencia inolvidable, el show al terminar la noche te deja sin palabras , mas de 150 personas en escena , es muy mágico, felicidades a Mexico y a Xcaret por esta gran experiencia.

I was very impressed with the Xcaret Park. It has so much to offer you can not do it in one single day if you plan to do everything and take your time and enjoy it. We went 2 days which was enough time. The rivers were amazing to swim in. The only thing I was disappointed in was we got there when it opened and alot of the exhibits didn't open til later and you would have to back track to go back and do them. Remember all the activities in the park are not part of you ticket price. Several activities cost extra. The show at night was very good and worth staying for. We stayed next door at the Occidental Xcaret so we did not spend money on food or drinks. We just went back and forth for lunch and dinner.
Nos pareció MUY caro. La entrada, las atracciones, la comida o el agua. La comida no fue buena, demasiada gente.

If you are staying in the Playa del Carmen, Cancun, or Cozumel area, make the time to stop by this park!  Something for everyone here!  Beautiful beach if you just want to sit around, drink and relax.  Swimming with dolphins.  Lots of animals and sea creatures to see.  The best part is the underground rivers that you can float through that take you to the beach area-- so much fun!  They even transport all of your stuff that you don't want to get wet in a duffel bag with a lock tot he end, so you don't have to leave all your stuff in a locker far away.  Very well done!  If you are only there for a day, no need to do the extras-- plenty to do for the basic admission price.  Don't miss the horse show-- it is excellent and free!  The Mexico show is the biggest attraction, but I enjoyed the horse show while drinking a margarita at a great Mexican restaurant right next to the arena-- that is the way to go!  There are lots of add-ons like swimming with dolphins, and boat rides if you are there longer, and several other X-parks I would like to visit that looked fun too!

Highlight:
1. Parrots, I just like them.
2. like the design of the park. Everywhere you stand, you have view surrounding you.
3. underground river swimming, nice!
4 photo cameras everywhere. the photo package is worth it.
5.the show at night, it is just amazing. high quality. I was touched and cried...

What I loved about this place is that it had some great shows but I would recommend this to families with kids 13 and under. Anyone older can go but the shows I feel are really meant for that age. They show the history of the Mayans and Aztecs but through acting, sports games and more like a show type of setting. A great place to spend the day if you are looking for something to do.

Visitamos los 4 parques de experiencias Xcaret aunque ya los conocíamos, fue un regalo que le hicimos a nuestra hija por su buen desempeño escolar!
Sin lugar a dudas Xcaret sigue siendo el más completo y grande de todos!
Como fuimos en enero y la temperatura a la mañana es fresca aprovechamos para hacer todos los recorridos secos: comenzamos por las ruinas, el pueblo maya, la Hacienda hequenera, el cementerio maya, la iglesia, fuimos al aviario que estaba completamente renovado mucho más grande. me pareció un entorno maravilloso con puentes, cascadas y cantidad de aves en un entorno enorme muy parecido al natural, luego fuimos al mariposario que también me pareció una belleza! 
Almorzamos en el restaurante internacional ya que habíamos sacado Xcaret Plus, me pareció bastante floja la calidad de la comida y el trato de los camareros, a diferencia del resto del personal disperso por todo el parque que eran muy atentos y amables.
Luego fuimos a hacer el recorrido en balsa por el río paraíso donde pasas por cavernas y cascadas. 
Fuimos a hacer el nado en el rio Maya que fue el más lindo de todos porque tiene espacios abiertos y otros cerrados, luego hicimos el nado por el río Manatí que es más que nada abierto y finalmente por el río azul que fue el más difícil porque tiene fuertes contracorrientes aunque tengas cuerdas dónde sujetarte.
 si Bien fuimos con snorkel Admito que no vi peces. Me parece que el exceso de gente hace que no haya mucha vida marina.
Me gustó mucho el show nocturno de México espectacular si bien ya lo había visto, volví a recrear todos los bailes y costumbres Mexicanas!
Es un parque al que recomiendo a cualquier persona de cualquier edad! tiene detalles de diseño espectaculares Como por ejemplo en los baños o cada Rincón dónde dirijas tu mirada, realmente es un deleite para la vista! no sólo para entretenerse!!
 además ahora también tiene un espacio de juego para niños tipo jungla que es hermoso y la playita aunque la achicaron para lucrar con las actividades especiales sigue siendo muy bonita! como para ir a descansar en una tumbona o hamaca paraguaya lo mismo en el agua con los gomones. o hacer el circuito de cuerdas para los más atrevidos, nosotros quedamos exhaustos después de los nados por los ríos!

This is definitely one of the best parks I have ever been to!!!.  Yes it's expensive but if you want to experience the Mayan culture and get a better understanding of the history of Mexico, then this is the way to do it.  The park itself is huge and many people recommend at lest 2 days to see.  Considering it was a short stay on my end, I went for just 1 day but took advantage to see as much as I could in that 1 day.  And boy was there a lot to do.  From an awesome lazy river to Mayan shows to excursions and activities there's a lot to keep you busy.  If you are into nature you will definitely enjoy the beautiful landscape the park offers.  Here's a tip, at the end of the day there's a show at the theater which shows the history of Mexico which I highly recommend.  Be prepared for a long day but this is definitely a must do in Mexico.

Un paraiso en toda su extencion, necesitas muchois dias para recorrerlo. Buen lugar para ir solo, en familia o con amigos. Tienes diversidad de atracciones. Buenos restaurantes, vistas espectaculares, servicio rapido y amable. Una experiencia unica.
Debes por obligacion quedarte al espectaculo nocturno de Mexico.

MY REVIEW OF:

XCARET

First with the good. You MUST go to Xcaret. I prefer this park to Disney because I feel it has substance and isn’t as cheesy as Disney. There are tons of fun things to do for ages up to about 12. After 12 they might want to do things a little more adventurous and go to Xplor Park. They also masterfully fuse nature with Mexican culture in a way that is super interesting and isn’t forced or gimmicky. 
I suggest a multi day pass. I made the mistake of thinking we could cover it all in a day. We might have been able to had we not added two excursions. 

Swimming with the sharks: I mean. Cool AF! Just sayin. Chelsea and I felt safe. We touched the sharks and swam with them as well. 

“working” at 10 months because their gestational period is 12 months (NO THANK YOU!!)
A but pricey if you pay with Mex$ or credit card, but not bad if you pay in US$ (as they have a messed up conversion rate). Super fun for all ages and lots of activities to do!

We stayed next door at the Occidental Xcaret and had unlimited passes, thank goodness!  We covered all of it, I think, but there is just too much to see to do it all in one or two days.  We could walk back to our resort when we got tired and go back to Xcaret another time.  We are an older couple, 73 and 65, and the walking plus stairs were very tiring, but very worthwhile.  We loved the Espectacular night show, the sky tower, all the animal exhibits, the orchids, the horse show (but more seating is needed for the large crowds).  We didn't want to do any water activities there but still got to see the manatees, sharks, turtles, and big skates.  The river ride is good when you need to rest your feet and legs.  The grounds are beautifully kept, everything was amazingly clean, and the restrooms easy to find.  We loved the Mexican folk art, the Hacienda, and the archeological sites.  This was a wonderful place to visit.

Let me say this park it's expensive like Disneyland, but well worth it!!! The park its like a water park but at the natural!! The river and beach are awesome. The best part it's the last show!! I won't put a video or a picture because they won't expressed the beauty to it. The show its tree hours but you won't even notice it. Totally recommend to save money because i won't lie every thing inside its expensive.

Este parque es una maravilla, con actividades para adultos y niños, mucha historia muy ordenado, seguro y sobretodo con un espectáculo al final de la noche que permite conocer de manera extraordinaria la cultura mexicana, es una visita obligada para todos los q lleguen a Cancún...

Xcaret has many sister properties in the Riviera Maya; Xoximilco Cancun, XelHa, Xichen etc.  All of these parks are outstanding for everyone but Xcaret is the biggest with many activities for the entire family.
excellent  love this place a little expensive but worh every cent especial night show.I have been here 2 times and still have not seen all of it?

This place was above and beyond. No rush no long cues, everything was very smooth. Extra activities such as swimming with Dolphins at Delphinus and SeaTrek can be acquired before entering the park with a 10% discount. Activities were great but the night show called XCaret Mexico Espectacular is a must, so do not leave before the show starts at 7 pm.

La mezcla de selva, con ríos subterráneos de aguas turquesas que se atraviesan todo el parque es perfecta. Es un lugar paradisíaco al que seguiré volviendo.
Aunque es enorme la cantidad de gente que lo visita a diario no se percibe la sensación de multitud gracias a que está todo muy bien organizado.
Pagar el paquete de fotografías vale la pena ya que hay muchos lugares de escaneo y es un lindo recuerdo.

XSENCES was an awesome experience.  
I had been in a lot of places around the world (Legoland,  Disneyland,  Aquariums,  big concerts, etc.),  but nothing compairs to this amusement park. 
Make sure that you have a swimsuit if the day is cloudy,  or you will get very cold in one of the attractions. 

Another piece of advise : buy the tickets online,  as they may run promotions on the website,  plus you are dealing directly with the company. 
You will not regret the trip!
The river float was fun, and the night show was out of this world.  You pay a lot to get in and then have to pay for most everything else.  Our whole family got sick after spending a day here.

Los ríos subterráneos !!! Son lo más !! Igual te recomiendo que solo hagas uno sino te perderías las otras maravillas del parque... El acuario,el pueblo Maya que te brinda un espectáculo grandioso!!! Las señalizaciones y las personas que siempre están ahí para guiarte y ayudarte en lo que necesites !! La comida !!! Las artesanías ,la naturaleza como jamás la viste !!! Y lo que no podes perderte ...El ESPECTÁCULO NOCTURNO!!! MÉXICO ES XCARET!!!!

Está increíble el parque, compré un tour que venía incluido tulum, la verdad es que me arrepentí porque es muy poco tiempo en el
Parque y tulum está súper lleno de turistas pierdes mucho tiempo. Recomiendo visitar Xcaret con tiempo :)

Es la 3ra vez que visito este parque y muy probable sea la ultima. Los precios ya son excesivos a mi gusto y el servicio deja ya mucho que desear. Y a eso le sumamos que ya no tienes derecho a bebidas durante tu estancia llamense agua o sodas, y tienes que estar pagando por ellas, siendo que llevas el paquete más caro y todo incluido, que de todo incluido no tiene nada. Por eso recomiendo mejor xelha.

We arrived at the facility and it was a lengthy process to get bracelets and get going in the park. We were told about the photos taken in the park that it is included in the plus package...IT WAS NOT FREE. One picture is $20 USD and all pictures of the day are $100 USD for a family of (4). So they encourage you not to bring your camera or phone, so you have to buy their DIGITAL PICTURES! If that's of interest to you, then budget for it! If not, then plan your alternative and buy a water tight bag that floats for $5 at the department store, and then take your phone with you and take your own digital pictures.

If you don't buy the plus package, then you have to pay for food, a storage locker, and towels, so the plus was worth the extra money.
-The underground cave was filled with water, but you will have a life vest and guide ropes are along the wall in some areas of the cave. There was a rope over a pool cavern that the kids were able to hold on to it and swing in to the water. This whole park is great for the kids to see the dolphins, swim with them and take pictures with them. There are large parrots that you can take pictures with and hold them. There is a manatee with a baby that you can interact with in the water and feed her. 

There are several restaurants in the park that are decent ones for the family to eat and enjoy the time and food varieties.
 
The bus was crowded on the way back and a passenger refused to put the up her seat so I could sit behind her. She said she wanted to relax and sleep. Really...sooo, my being able to even get into the seat behind her did not even matter?  Merry Christmas to me thanks for that gift. I sat facing the isle the whole way back to the hotel.

O parque conta com diversas atividades, muitas dela s]ao pagas à parte. O show de encerramento, apesar de longo, é fantástico. Um dia inteiro não foi o suficiente para ver tudo o que o parque tem a oferecer. Vale o passeio.
En stoooor djurpark men inget speciellt tyckte vi. Krångligt med banden och att dom ska märkas när man äter,lite snålt med tanke på att man betalar ett dyrt inträdr

En nuestro itinerario de viaje pasamos por Ciudad de México, teníamos que abordar el vuelo en el aeropuerto B.J. a Cancún y destino final Playa del Carmen, luego de pasar migraciones, chek-in etc, nos encontramos con un gran estando del parque Xcaret y demás, se nos acerca una joven con la intención de ofrecernos grandes descuentos por comprar en ese stand los tickets para los parques, nos llamó la atención la diferencia entre lo que ubican en web y lo que ofrecían,  que era hasta un 25 % más económico en el combo Xcaret-xelha . El precio era muy conveniente y estaba este paseo en nuestros planes. Los compramos,  pero luego de cerrar la compra con la tarjeta de crédito nos indican que las entradas debían ser retiradas en el Nuevo Hotel XCaret que estaban publicitando, que solo debíamos elegir el horario y día del retiro, y que nos pagaban el taxi tanto de ida como de regreso, e incluso nos otorgaban un desayuno de cortesía para conocer el nuevo hotel(cosa que nos era indistinta ya que en nuestro hotel teníamos all inclusive). Decidimos día y horario y el vendedor nos dejó su wsp por cualquier tipo de consulta. Llegamos al día indicado y para nuestra sorpresa lo que sería un simple retiro de entradas se transformó en una pesadilla. Nos mantuvieron dentro del lugar toda una mañana, con estrategias de ventas muy agresivas de tiempos compartidos, en un principio pensamos que era solo un pequeño recorrido por el lugar y los listo, pues no, estimados, cuando Vendedor se dio cuenta que no nos interesaba lo que proponían comenzó el maltrato y la soberbia, fue un muy mal trago,  insistimos en querer retirar los tickets y retirarnos pero eran vueltas y más vueltas, pasamos un gran disgusto, entre la soberbia y el maltrato del vendedor y sus 2 superiores más por los que pasamos , el verso era este” uds no saben ahorrar, pueden acceder a viajes a todo el mundo con esta inversión.. etc” no había manera de hacerles entender que nos queríamos ir,  en fin, el paseo dentro del hotel comenzó por ascensores y de manera literal nos viajaron por por escaleras. Hasta que logramos rescatar nuestras entradas y retirarnos,perdimos toda nuestra mañana de vacaciones con esta gente tan agresiva. Fue un aprendizaje más para estos viajeros inexpertos. El mal trago ya pasó,  pero creí conveniente advertir esto a los viajeros. NO tomen nada que les ofrezcan a primera vista, luego de esto nos enteramos que es una práctica habitual en estos hoteles e incluso en algunos casos llegan a estafas aún mayores. Se daNada tengo que decir de los parques en si,  por el contrario,  el personal es afable y cálido.
A mi gusto el parque es lindo, pero para lo que ofrece el precio es desmedido. Creo que tenía otra expectativa en función de los comentarios que había leído pero, en mi caso, no las cumplió.

This huge place is an excellent choice for the whole family. It put you in contact with nature in the safest way posible (so if you consider yourself a wanderer, maybe it will be too man-made for you).

It has everything from swimming with dolphins, exotic animals, ruins, a river with caves you swim through, restaurant and much much more...and it offers Mexican shows that are super worth it (I really enjoy the Maya show and Mexico Espectacular, but there are many more).

This is an awesome park. Beats any Disney any day. AMAZING!! You can not come to Cancun and not go to Xcaret. Recommend to do the water attractions first, then jump in comfortable shoes and go see the rest of the park. Be selective, you will NOT see everything in one day, this place is huge. The finale show was spectacular!!!

We visited this place for the first time in December whilst on our honeymoon. We very much enjoyed the underground river, that was an amazing experience. I'd recommend you buy Xcaret Plus (Admission,Transportation, lockers and Buffet lunch), most activities are extra once in the park so take plenty of money!! There is lots to see including some gorgeous flowers. Comfy shoes and camera are a must! We had lunch at the Mexican buffet and that was good, plenty to choose from.
Merece su fama, es un parque temático con opciones para toda la familia, nos lamentamos de haber pagado la entrada de un solo día.

Vale a pena por ter todas as experiências juntas: divertimento, cultura e gastronomia unidas às praia, cenotes, rios e animais. Além de nos divertirmos muito, no fim do dia temos uma aula de história do México. Atendimento muito atencioso de todos os funcionários e atividades mil para todas as idades. Chegue antes das 8:30 (horário de entrada) para estacionar, resolver os trâmites de pagamento e aproveitar tudo do parque e saia antes das 21:00 (horário de saída) para não pegar fila na saída. Recomendo fortemente sapatilhas de mergulho (para não ficar aquele tira e põe chinelo no pé) e cases para celular (indispensável e pode ser comprado nos supermercados fora do parque). Também sugiro garrafas de água, pois lá não tem bebedouros e camisetas de surf (também podem ser adquiridas nos supermercados antes) principalmente para as crianças não se queimarem tanto. Pra quem já for mergulhador, leve seu próprio equipamento. O percurso do rio escuro vale muito a pena, mas é longo. Se tiver claustrofobia não é recomendado.
Disfruta del parque, de los ríos, los espectáculos, las actividades, el aviario, quedó Impresionante no puedes dejar de visitarlo y disfrutarlo; además del espectáculo México Espectacular.
Xcaret, es visita obligada en Quintana Roo!!  Hermosos escenarios naturales, magnifica logística!! Disfrutarlo bien vale el monto y el tiempo!!

Por 129 dólares americanos que incluían pasaporte Plus pasamos una de las experiencias más maravillosas. Vale cada dólar pagado, la travesía por el río es de lo mejor, fuimos el 31 de diciembre y no había tanta afluencia de personas, el personal muy atento y presto a solucionar las inquietudes y lo mejor de todo, el espectáculo de las 7 pm, majestuoso, simplemente espectacular !!
El parque tiene muchos sitios para visitarse, recomendado comprar la entrada de 2 días para poder recorrer todas las atracciones. Recomendado

El macdonalds de la Riviera Maya , quieres una experiencia artificial ? Visita xcaret , la mejor forma de desperdiciar un día de tus vacaciones , colas interminables , puro marketing , una vergüenza , no se lo recomiendo a nadie

O parque é muito bem organizado e os funcionários sempre sorridentes e atenciosos.
Meu pacote tinha almoço e transfer para o hotel e recomendo, pois o ônibus foi pontual e a comida boa. Eu apenas não lembro qual foi o restaurante, mas ele me foi recomendado pelo guia do ônibus, que disse que os outros não eram tão bons.

We have visited both Xcaret and Xelha. Don’t think we’d return to Xcaret. Felt nickeled and dimed at every turn and would far prefer an all inclusive price like at Xelha. The Mexican Expectacular show was very good but the dinner price is ridiculous. If it had even been 50./each I would have considered it but 70.?!
Awesome Park, have been twice! I would even consider returning again in a few years.  Lots of walking, but worth it!

Overall is fun, but very expensive, considering one day is $130+, more than a disneyland ticket.  The river is fun, but very very cold.  Many of us got sick afterwards.  The river in the cave is very very dark sometimes, wish they install some lights in there, coz it could be a little scary for kids and when it is crowded and dark, it's just not nice.  The show at night is quite good, definitely worth to watch it considering the ticket price is so high.  The buffet is $30 per person, very expensive, so better buy the plus package.

Es un parque acuatico muy divertido con muchas tirolesas para hacer de gran altura y longitud. Alguna terminan en el agua. Hay muchos lockers para dejar la ropa y otros objetos. No lo recomiendo par chicos menores de 8 años.

Increíble sitio para pasar un par de días. No hay que perderse los ríos subterráneos, el show nocturno, el nado con mantarrayas, el juego de pelota, el pueblo maya y los distintos espectáculos folclóricos que se realizan.

I think this park is over-priced with rather rude staff (especially restaurants). The river swimming experience is unique (through underground caves). On the other hand I would highly recommend Xel-ha Theme Park which has far more and better attractions at a relatively lower price that also includes all you can eat and drink plus free towels (Xcaret, at least for my package, had one time buffet option no free towel or drinks-but rather than these free options I thought the attractions itself were much better).

I booked Xcaret through TUI at our local travel agent. It was over £100 each for me and my partner. This included entry,  transport to and from the park and lunch. I knew that certain activities would be extra but I wasn’t prepared for just how much. I paid for my partner and myself to swim with the dolphins and to do the sea trek. In total this was an additional £200! Then you had to pay for your photos with the dolphins separately which was another £75! So be prepared...

Now that’s out of the way....

Xcaret is a great day out. There is so much to see and do, it’s difficult to fit it all into one day. 

The dolphin experience was amazing - a must do if you’ve never done it before like me. My only advice would be if you have any valuables lock them up in the secure lockers at the entrance of the park. We left our belongings in the open cubby hole when we went to swim with the dolphins and our GoPro was taken. The security checked the cctv and said they couldn’t see anything but there was nowhere else it could’ve gone. 

The underwater sea trek was a fantastic experience but not entirely as advertised. The picture shows bright corals and loads of fish and turtles etc but the reality was a bit more dingy. There were loads of fish and sting rays and once you get over the initial claustrophobia it’s very enjoyable. They even let you take your own pictures and videos. Which would’ve been nice if our GoPro hadn’t been taken! Again there are no secure lockers here to leave your valuables so bear this is mind. 

The natural river was fun but extremely crowded. Be prepared to be clambered on and kicked! Is recommend doing this later on in the day rather than as soon as you enter the park like we did. It seemed to be quieter in the afternoon. 

The food was lovely - loads of different restaurants to choose from. We went to the  Caribbean hut. 

Xcaret is worth a visit and I probably would return but I’d book it whilst in Mexico as it seems cheaper.

It’s hard to even adequately describe Xcaret in comparable terms to other parks.  First of all, know that they place is a huge business and does everything first class.  It’s like the Disney of eco-parks.  4,000 employees, a totally high-end, immersive experience, etc.  And it’s such a mash-up of offerings compared to other experiences and parks we have done.  It’s like a blend of the Polynesian Culture Center from Hawaii (only massively larger in scale), a water park, a zoo and aquarium, a ruins site, nature trails, shopping village, unique cemetery, etc.  There really was no end to the range of things you could experience there, and this was just the main park of about 5 they run, most of which are directly adjacent to each other (except Xel-Ha which is 45 minutes further south in Tulum).

The signature feature of the park is their “Underground river.”  You float along it in a provided life jacket for a couple miles.  Much of it is literally in caves.  Occasionally you break through to breathtaking sunlight or through dense forests of trees, etc. There are also many optional water activities ranging from swimming with dolphins, with sharks, with stingrays, snorkeling, SCUBA, Snuba, SeaTrek (you walk along the ocean floor with a large diving bell over your head to breath), speed boats, etc.  There are countless trails, animal and marine life exhibits.  There is a beautiful Mayan village, a church, and a cemetery unlike any I have seen before — it’s a small hill circles with layers of colorful, decorate mini houses and other displays that each represents something about the life of the person buried there.  There are also ruins.

And it has the the most amazing and largest aviary I have ever experienced.  It took the better part of an hour to explore it and that’s without stopping to read anything.  There were at least 4 levels of trails and rivers and waterfalls, etc., all inside this aviary.

There were also a dozen restaurants, many of which were full buffets.

Sister parks include more specialized activities like zip lining and adventure courses, spa-like eco-trails, etc.

It’s a must-do if you are in the region.

We booked through Xcaret and they picked us up and dropped us off at our Cancun hotel in the hotel zone zone.  The bus was very comfortable and pick up and drop off was flawless.  We spent the whole day walking thru Xcaret and visiting the many attractions.  We brought our swim wear but there was so much to see and do that we never had time to do the water activities.  You really need 2 days to see the attractions and also do the water activities. The buffet lunch was included and we really liked the food.  They had 3 different restaurants you could choose from for the buffet.  We chose to view the attractions because we could always swim in Cancun.  The river float looked like fun, but just not enough time.  We did not do any of the added cost activities, again not enough time to see everything in one day.  There is a lot of walking, we are in our 60's but managed okay with taking rest breaks throughout the day.  There are different parts of the park and they are accessed via different colored paths.  We would follow one path to it's attractions and then take another, we used the map to minimize back tracking on the various paths.  There are even some Mayan ruins inside of the park. We also went up the revolving tower and as it was a clear day had great views of the area.  You can also use your wrist band to use the tower in Cancun for free (which we did the next day). The highlight of the day was the evening show that highlighted mexico's history, culture and regions.  While the show was in Spanish they did have some English translations on a large screen.  The costumes, music and singing were great and it was a very high energy show.  After the show, when leaving the park they were very organized for lining people up to take the right bus back to their hotels.  A long day but very entertaining and many insights into the Mexican culture.

Ótimo parque com diversão para todas as idades. Se possível escolha antecipadamente as atrações de maior interesse pois não é possível conhecer tudo em um único dia. O show apresentado a noite é bem bacana, vale a pena ficar até o final.

For $100 plus per person that is not including the water activities I was not impressed at all.  While the show was very good it is very difficult to understand because it is done all in Spanish (yes I get that it is the language of the country) and difficult to follow.  The park has many areas and you need to follow a map to understand where to go and it can get very confusing because it is not always clear which area you are in.  I did like what we saw and I can now say I have been to Xcaret but will not go back.

Un hermoso lugar, muy limpio bello muy bien cuidado, el gran espectáculo sin duda es el del cierre los bailes la organización la vdd es de primer mundo la ropa impecable aun sabiendo que eso ese hace a diario. los felicito,, tenia años sin ir, lo único malo es la comida la vdd compre el paquete plus y podías eligir un restaurant buffete y la vdd NO ME GUSTO PARA NADA. deben de mejorar la calidad de los alimentos.

Es una visita obligada. Lo que realmente recomiendo es hacerla “por la tuya” ir en auto, comprar la entrada en la puerta y manejarte solo, sin tour, los tour te quitan muchísimo tiempo que podes disfrutar en el parque, además, el espectáculo final que es increíblemente bueno, si vas con tour, vas a una versión que se hace más temprano, durante el día, y no aprecias correctamente la iluminación, si vas por tu cuentas, vas al espectáculo final de la noche (imperdible) y el tiempo te da perfecto para todo.

Absolutely stunning park. Favourite part was doing the river-swim! Wish I could go back and do it again, as I'm sure I missed a lot of what the park has to offer (it's huge!) Bring good walking shoes!
Como todo lo de esta zona de Mexico es un parque increíble y con unos paisajes muy hermosos. Aventura y excelente el show de la noche. No te lo puedes perder

La atención, alimentos y diversión son excelentes!! Un día completo para disfrutarlo
Si no vas a xelha, no fuiste a cancun
Óptimo! Um dia muito bem passado, com imensas actividades e enorme espaço. Possibilidade de ver imensos animais
Parque tem uma estrutura excelente para voce passar o dia inteiro. O rio de corredeira é bem legal. Ha diversos restaurantes e serviço de "praia". Vale a pena esperar para ver o show da noite.

Count on spending a solid day here or maybe 2. Buffets are $30.00 USpp. Paradise River cruise was neat. Snorkel in the open river, try to avoid swimming in the 'dark river' unless you like to swim mostly in the dark. Do go early for the evening show as it is magnificent. The Mayan village was excellent. Aquarium was also very good. It is a very large complex. Buffet water is drinkable. Very safe complex.

El ticket no es barato y lo único realmente hermoso que tiene en mi opinión es el nado en los ríos que lleva como una hora y no es para personas con problemas cardíacos, tener en cuenta. El ticket de fotos se cobra aparte, el nado con delfines también, y así practicamente todas las actividades, por lo cual es muy fácil pasar los 500 dolares por persona rápidamente. Es un poco molesto esto de pagar cada actividad por separado, pero recomiendo el nado con delfines y el nado por los ríos.

Um dos melhores Parques do México
Apesar que todos são excelentes
Mas Xcaret é perfeito
Limpíssimo, muito bem estruturado, com varias restaurantes 
Admirável beleza

Fui a passeio com meu marido na realidade em novembro de 2016, detalhe que eu estava grávida de 6 meses. 
Optamos por pagar o passeio em uma agência de viagens, a mesma que fez nosso transfer do aeroporto ao hotel e também fechei outro passeio imperdível para o Chichen Itza.
Li vários comentários onde as pessoas relatam problemas e desencontros que eu não tive devido a orientação do guia no ônibus a caminho do parque. Claro que sai mais caro um pouco, do que ir de carro, no entanto creio que o passeio se torna mais proveitoso pois recebemos várias dicas valiosas no caminho. 
Por exemplo, o guia deu dicas dos passeios que deveríamos fazer primeiro para não perder tempo devido os horários de fila. Como o parque é grande demais não dará tempo de ver tudo em 1 dia. Mas com uma explicação do que há em cada rota, você poderá aproveitar o que mais interessa em seu perfil. 
No restaurante que almoçamos a comida e as bebidas já estavam inclusas no ingresso e aconselho a comprar o pacote de fotos na entrada, pois há câmeras em todo parque além de fotógrafos que fazem mini sessões bem bacanas. Eu amei isso!
Na entrada do parque você coloca seus pertences em malotes que serão levados no final do rio subterrâneo para aqueles que optarem por desfrutar esta experiência.
Eu achei maravilhoso o lugar e super recomendo. Creio que as pessoas que não gostaram é porquê não fizeram as melhores escolhas no roteiro ou não entenderam a dinâmica do local.
Ah mais um detalhe... acredito que 80% das atrações já estavam inclusas no ingresso.

Cuenta con numerosas actividades para realizar durante toda la jornada de diferentes estilos, la mayoria sin costo adicional, excepto las extraordinarias.
Vale la pena quedarse hasta el final para presenciar el show de cierre, excelente!!

me encanta la producción del show, es super!!! es un lugar con muchas actividades, cada vez que voy me siento en diferentes lugares de México, como si visitara diferentes ciudades a la vez.  Es extraordinario!!!!

El parque ofrece variaamopcionesmparampasear con niños pequeños y disfrutar en un día largo pero que vale la pena, los animales marinos y los shows resultaron  un gran atractivo sumado a la belleza del lugar  y al recorrido  de los ríos subterráneos. Podrían mejorar el área de juegos /cenote infantil

Não gostei, não acho que vale a pena. O lugar é bonito, mas você paga 120 dólares pra entrar e as atrações inclusas são poucas, o resto tudo é pago por fora, então se você quer ter um dia legal, tem que desembolsar muita grana. Não achei que vale a pena, me arrependi demais. Até por que, bonito por bonito, estamos no México, existem outros lugares que valem muito mais a pena. Não recomendo

If you like to play in water? YES, you have to go. If you like activities? YES, you have to go.
Xcaret is so big.  I went to Xelha, Xenses and Xcaret, so in my opinion, if you're having trouble to choose your first time attraction in Cancun, here it is. Xcaret.
Xcaret has everything. You can swim, relax, eat whatever I want!
When my friends ask to where should I go Cancun in first time, I always recommend Xcaret!
So much fun. 
Also I always give an advice which is you have to nap in Hammock!

Parque muito bem estruturado e bem organizado. Praia, piscina natural e rio subterrâneo tudo muito bonito. O parque oferece diversas atividades para toda a família, além de atividades que se pode pagar por fora, como nado com tubarões golfinhos, mergulho, snuba e outros. A refeição é de boa qualidade e com grande variedade de pratos, sendo oferecida em vários restaurantes dentro do parque. Você tem a opção de ficar para o show da noite que já está incluído no valor pago e que vale muito a pena. Recomendo este passeio.

I visited Xcaret with my husband 20 years ago, and it is the same and better than I remember.  The nightly 2 hour show at the end of the day is incredible, and all the tropical foliage, waterfalls and ruins make you feel like you are in a beautiful jungle.  This place is Mexico's equivalent to Disneyland in my opinion.  Everything is top notch.

El lugar es muy lindo y hay demasiado para hacer, siendo imposible verlo todo en un día. Primero nadamos por los ríos subterráneos, mi hija tiene 4 años y no quiso bajar por lo que sólo nadamos en l primera parte. Esa actividad la disfrutarían más niños de 6 en adelante. Luego hay un parque acuático de chicos que es muy lindo y tiene partes para todas ls edades de 6 meses en adelante. Luego hay ruinas por todo el lugar muy lindo y la playa que es bajita. Tenés animales para ver por todo el lugar, y actividad que se pagaba aparte de partir de los 40 dólares como el nado con delfines, snorkel, fotos y otra. Imposible ver todo el parque en un día. Súper recomendada esta actividad. Aunque como en todo Cancún te atacan con ofertas y precios. El lugar es caro comprado con el resto de Cancún.

Elegí la opción de armar mi paquete para ahorrar dinero, ya que no es un parque económico, el paquete que elegí incluia transportación y alimentos la cual resultó ser una excelente decisión, ya que el transporte en Cancún es bastante caro, así como los alimentos en el hotel que me quedé.

Quedé más que satisfecho con la experiencia, todo el personal desde el chofer, guías, mesero, encargados de actividades, fotográfos, etc,  son sumamente amables y serviciales.

Los parques tienen un equilibrio excelente entre turismo y preservación.

Vale totalmente la pena la inversión.

Una recomendación, las fotos son geniales, pero si van a asistir a varios parque comprenlas con anticipación pues hacen buenos descuentos, yo me decidi muy tarde y me informaron en el centro telefónico que ya no podía comprar el paquete de fotos para varios parques pues ya había empezados mis visitas, fue lo único que no me agradó.

Muy recomendado, con gusto vuelvo.

Muy bueno en general. Armado a la altura de los parques de Disney. 
Si bien la recepcion es un poco traumática x la cantidad de gente una vez pasado el molinete es un mundo magico donde todo funciona perfecto.
Imperdibles: nadar x los rios subterraneos y el show de la noche (19 hs). 
Buenos: Mariposario. Toboganes de agua para chicos.
Prescindibles: show de caballos
Conviene xcaret plus con comida incluida para el que puede. Los restaurantes son muy buenos

Muy buen lugar para visitar en la Riviera Maya, con diversas actividades para todo tipo de personas. Sumamente limpio y organizado. Ideal para estar en contacto con la naturaleza y a la vez contar con muchas comodidades. Imperdible el espectáculo nocturno. Sí se desea recorrer todo el parque en un día, lo ideal es llegar muy temprano. Costos dentro del parque algo elevados; por lo demás, todo excelente.

Este parque es formidable. Sus estándares sólo se comparan a Disneyland o Disney World. Las instalaciones están en muy buen estado. Los shows son insuperables. A nosotros nos encantó el jaripeo, pero sobre todo el show de clausura. Este show tiene una producción increíble; a la altura de los mejores shows del mundo. Solo es justo compararlo con la estructura de Cirque du Soleil. La comida en buffet es formidable, variada y de muy buena calidad (tomando en cuenta que es un buffet y que preparan comida para miles de personas a diario). El parque tiene muy buen tamaño y ofrece variadas atracciones ecológicas y de juegos. 
El precio es un poco alto, pero vale cada centavo.

Es un parque al estilo Disney, muy bueno por cierto.  Hicimos la actividad del nado en el río subterráneo, con la familia, y nos divertimos mucho.  También agregamos como opcional el Sea Trek, que nos permitió caminar por el fondo marino y ver gran cantidad de peces y rayas en su hábitat natural.  Además recorrimos su acuario, que es excelente (las medusas iluminadas con diferentes colores imperdible!).
