Mi spiace contraddire tutti gli amici che danno il massimo punteggio a Xcaret Park. In realtà questo parco non ha nulla di speciale o caratteristico. é una struttura carina fatta su misura in modo artificiale per i turisti, se vogliamo fatta bene ma rimane artificiale. Si possono avere delle belle foto ricordo tutte colorate in questo zoo esotico. Consigliato per le famiglie ma non per i viaggiatori alla ricerca di avventura. Per 100 Euro va bene passare la giornata lì giusto per far passare una giornata. Per fortuna nel prezzo del biglietto c era anche lo spettacolo serale che é stato veramente qualcosa di caratteristico e che abbiamo apprezzato molto. Per il resto niente di eccezionale.
Sin duda lo más conveniente es el paquete de dos días. Con tantas cosas por ver y hacer un día no es suficiente

Great hotel.  Fun time and beauty rooftop 
view.  A lot more to play del Carmen than we thought.  Armando is the best!!!
Un lugar que uno no olvidara jamas, un parque que es imposible no visitarlo y tienes que tratar de sacar las mayores fotos posible, la compra de la pulsera para fotos es lo mejor..

Il parco è’ molto grande immerso nella natura con una bella spiaggia e tante cose da vedere ideale per chi ama la natura una pecca è’ che le  pantere o gli altri animali feroci non si sono visti erano nascosti è’ stata una bella camminata ( all’interno affittano passeggini  per i piccoli). Il biglietto di ingresso  è’ caro.

Meu Deus, em êxtase com esse lugar ainda. Estivemos semana passada, apenas um dia, não me perdoou por isso! Esse lugar reúne tudo que tem de melhor! Praia, comida, animais, rios, Zoológico, shows. Não dá pra fazer tudo! Uma dica: Assim que chegar, faça o rio subterrâneo, disparado para mim a melhor atividade, porém é necessário não estar cansado para fazê-lo. Portanto, não deixe para o final.
Imperdible, la comida, el espectáculo excelente, la playa la gente excelente muy amables, la pasamos muy bien, la hora indicada es las 10 a.m.
Lots to do. Map was confusing. No real direction on what to do. The river was awesome although its long. Be prepared to swim for hours. The best thing was the night time show
Dia perfeito em um parque incrivelmente grande e maravilhoso, muito para se ver, interagir, fotografar, amei a parte do rio em cavernas, muito bom! Só poderia ser um pouco menos caro.
Quedamos totalmente sorprendidos! Apenas llegamos hicimos la ruta del río subterráneo! Lo mejor del parque!! Realmente no pueden perdérselo!

El parque cuenta con diversas actividades, aunque con las entradas “regulares” y “plus” no tenés permitido el acceso a las mejores atracciones. Se pueden pagar aparte: ej. tour de snorkel por 40 usd, actividad “adrenalina” (experiencia en jetboat) por 60 usd. Con tu entrada “plus” (que cuesta alrededor de 550 mexicanos más que la entrada regular) tenés acceso a uno de los distintos restaurantes que tiene el parque. Nosotros optamos por “La península”, especializado en mariscos, pero no fue lo que esperábamos por el precio pagado. Sólo era un buffet con muchas opciones pero ninguna destacada.

Una desilusión y estafa el pack fotográfico , no lo compres , fotografías de pésima calidad , llenas de gente , y además no te las envían todas. Es realmente una ESTAFA por el precio  de cobran , mejor hagan sus fotos ustedes !

Fue un dia maravilloso desde el rio subterráneo. Bucear. Comer en el restaurante para culminar con el show de la noche.
Es realmente entretenido y emocionante sin duda te llegará al corazón y sentirás México.

This is an interesting place with an abundance of sea life, but everything was expensive, and it was very crowded.
There's a lot to see and do, but you better plan on getting there early, and being there all day.

This park is truly not to be missed. Even if you don't like getting wet there is plenty to do here. In fact, you can take a boat ride instead of swimming in the underground rivers (although I recommend doing the second one as there is nothing like it).

There is a small area with sand and palm trees on top of a short cliff where you exit from the underground rivers. Plenty of chairs and hammocks to lounge on with a beautiful view of the sea and several photo ops. You can walk down to the rocks and swim in a tiny lagoon.

We skipped the sea turtles since we going to swim with them at another excursion. The butterfly exhibit was definitely worth visiting, and you can get a nice picture on a rock with falls behind you at the bird sanctuary. The best part of the bird sanctuary is the hike to the top. Just amazing.

Jaguar island was hardly worth it. We eventually did see one jaguar laying down but it was pretty far to see clearly.

The replica of the Mayan cemetery was beautiful. It was also enjoyable walking through the ancient replica structures. We didn't spend much time at the real ruins since there wasn't nearly as much to see as Tulum. 

The kids world is perfect for children 13 and younger. There are lagoons, trails, obstacle courses and water slides. Our 8 year old daughter spent about two hours there and didn't want to leave.

The show at the end is a must-see. Definitely stay till the end. It really felt like a major broadway production and you don't pay anything extra to watch it. Our daughter was tired by the end of the day but stayed awake to watch the entire thing as she was totally enthralled. 

Tips

* If you purchased a ticket that includes a meal, wait until dinner and eat at La Cocina. They have a horse show at 6:00pm and you will have a great view of the action from the restaurant. Otherwise the bleacher seats fill up fast and early (people began sitting there as early as 5:00pm).

* People start finding seats at the theater as early as 5:45pm for the night show but there really aren't any bad seats so don't worry about getting there super early. That being said if you want a seat right near the action you probably want to get there by 6:15pm. Don't try reserving for your entire party if they aren't with you- they won't let you.

* Swim the underground river first and then work your way from the back of the park to the front. Yes everyone else does it that way but it really is the best way to see the park and it is not like Disney World where you are waiting in long lines to experience things.

Es un lugar que no hay que dejar de visitar si venis a playa del carmen o cancun. Es un parque de agua y tenes muchas opciones para hacer nadar con delfines, snorckel o tirarte en las playas que ofrece. El especatulo de final del dia es algo que te deja maravillado. Los actores son increíbles no hay que perderselo

We loved spending days at Xcaret. There is so much to do. We stayed at the Occidental Grand next door. They have deals such as the unlimited Xcaret Experience and private park entrances which made everything so easy.

Our highlights were the amazing bird aviary and swimming the underground rivers. Each river has different scenery. The Rio Maya was our favorite. So much to see so make sure you leave time for the non-water activities such as the butterfly pavilion, aviary, mayan village, chapel, and cemetery. The night show is a must as well.

I visited the park with my family, and we had a great experience and entertainment for all. Kids had a beautiful zone and adults also had many options. The underground river was amazing! Also the final show is worth it because you learn more about Mexican culture and traditions. In addition, system they have for pictures is great because you can get beautiful pictures in areas that it would be difficult to take your camera or phone. Great!

I have to admit that the thought of spending around 12 hours counting travel time was not appealing to me at all, But I'm Glad I went fort it, the day went fast I did not felt tired but the teen agers in our group did not pass the opportunity to lay down on the hammocks it was soo... relaxing that I ended up snoozing for a few minutes in the middle of the day! just enough to  recharge and continue the non stop adventure through out this Eco park, the fresh underwater river, the little Zoo type animal viewing, the restaurant by the beech was my favorite with DELICIOUS food and to top it off The Amazing Tour of Mexico show at the end that gave us goose bumps and filled us with amazing feelings, My family and I strongly recommend this adventure. it's a must.

Посетили Шкарет в мае 2013 года,с ребёнком 10 лет.Брали билеты в отеле,полный пакет,мероприятие заняло целый день(это с учётом дороги,т к мы проживали в Плайя Дель Кармен Ривьере Майя в отеле Иберостар Кецаль).В целом всё в парке понравилось,и попугаи,и подземная река,и большие плавающие черепахи,и зоны отдыха,всё красиво,экзотично,и шоу вечернее смотрели с удовольствием ,отлично всё спланировано,но гуляющие по территории зоны отдыха игуаны (большие ящерицы) это большой дискомфорт(((,они свободно передвигаются в зонах отдыха и незаметно могут к Вам подойти...в нашем случае,мы специально искали место где их нет,выбрали кафе по-выше,сели на лежачки,стали кушать бутеры,и тут игуаны набежали,это не передать словами,какой страх мы испытали,мы с дочкой кричали и звали на помощь,пришёл сотрудник парка,разогнал ящериц,и мы смогли выйти,пишу отзыв спустя 4,5 года,а страх до сих пор((( Я далеко не трусиха) и много где была и видела,но эта ситуация реально заставляет задуматься,особенно когда ты с ребёнком и несёшь ответственность не только за себя,но и за безопасность своего ребёнка...
segunda vez que voy y simplemente me encanta, TODO! es emocionante ver como realzan la cultura mexicana desde los primeros tiempos

Цена за вход, впрочем как и цены на территории всего парка можно смело делить на 3 и тогда получится адекватная стоимость. 
Сам парк большой, красивый, продуманный, но не скажу что невероятно интересный.
Самый оптимальный маршрут: сплав по реке (любой из двух, желтой или зеленой), далее пума с ягуаром, следом парк птиц, парк бабочек, возврат к реке. Сплав по второй реке, дельфинарий, аквариум, черепашки и подъем на башню. 
Собственно проделаете это все вы примерно до 15:00, максимум до 16:00, поэтому покупать улучшенный билет нет никакого смысла. 
Фото сделанные в парке обойдутся вам в 70$, при том снимать на свой фотоаппарат не запрещено. 
Как по мне, ехать в парк стоит только в том случае, если поехать больше совсем некуда.

The highlight of our vacation! The underground rivers were amazing. The snorkeling was amazing. The view of the ocean was amazing. Even the food at the buffet was good! Don’t be afraid of the price, it’s worth every penny. I think next time, we’re going to stay at their new hotel instead of one of the resorts in Cancun.

Un hermoso parque para conocer. Compramos con experiencias Xcaret y tuvimos un descuento. Son personas organizadas, muy confiables y amables en su trato. El parque es apto para llevar carriolas  y si no la tienes, allí te la rentan. El bufett internacional que probé es delicioso, recorrer los ríos subterráneos es muy chevere, y el espectáculo final es hermoso. En principio podría pensarse que el valor de la entrada es  costosa, pero luego de visitar Xcaret, vale cada peso invertido allí. Recomiendo varias visitas para conocerlo mejor.

Regresar es siempre un placer. El parque sigue regalando emociones , aún después haberlo visitados muchas veces. El cuidado de los detalles mejora de año en año. Una empresa que logra superarse a sí mismo constantemente.

Totally worth the price.
It's a full day of animals, and activities followed by a great theater performance. I would definitely go again.

excelente paque, con atracciones a granel, muy  buenas atracciones, la presentación de "mexico espectacular",  de verdad es espectacular, areas para niño muy entretenidas, los rios subterraneos son toda una experiencia

Tres beau endroit avec des tres bonnes idées comme p.ex les photos inclus 😊 
Beaucoup plus beau que dans les photos

Desde que llegas el personal es muy amable , el estacionamiento no tiene costo y puedes tener descuento si eres nacional y reservas con anticipación en Internet. 
El aviario es impresionante , Adán esta encargado de ese lugar y nos dio un recorrido increíble explicando sobre el entrenamiento de los animales y como viven.

Spent 8 hours here, show was amazing, grounds beautiful some.very good history, turtle conservation. 3 mo before we come down turtles hatched down in plya. They brought the turtles here. They will keep them until they are about 2 and set them free back into ocean. We did the lazy river it was relaxing after a couple hard days of diving. The only thing I did not like was the swimming with the dolphins I think they should be let free. It's an activity kids and adults will enjoy
Very good day.. for STAFF. Jacopo. IIaman .jorge .tomas. liliana rosita .Wonderful people who make you feel really good warm thanks to you soon. I recomme it to everyone..

Full disclosure we did get a discount of $200.00 by going to time share presentation. But even At full price worth the visit. Get there early, so much to see & do the dolphin  swim if they offer 50% discount which did for us . $250.00 for 5 of us but great experience. Zoo really cool, river swim ok but better on hot day since water a bit cold. Do the plus, includes one buffet meal & the Mexican one was great and really interesting choices, bring lots of snacks , eat big breakfast and make buffet early dinner, while watching the horse show & then stay for the evening historical show, kids were tired but worth sticking it out, great music $ the games, Mayan costumes thrilling. After 8 years of basically spending lazy days at our royal hacienda resort decided our 3 boys 7,9& 10 were old enough for one of the theme parks , bit of a splurge but no regrets, we had great time . Really pretty to walk around but get there at 10 instead of noon , would have been great to have another 2 hours.

Passamos um dia excelente por lá. Parque estava cheio, e fazia frio. Rio subterrâneo foi uma experiência ótima, mas o frio da água pegou para as crianças menores. Achei um pouco burocrático deixar as coisas em um locker na entrada do parque e ter que usá-lo como ponto focal em um parque tão grande. Restaurante ok, all inclusive. Piscinas ótimas, e o show da noite é incrível. Imperdível para quem vai a Cancun / Playa del Carmen

Mi hijos de 4 años los disfruto tanto Como nosotros, hermoso lugar, limpio. Organizado, Los shows hermosos.
No se puede pedir nada mass.

We come here every time we come to Mexico and never get bored its a great family day out with lots to, the evening show is great but for smaller children they would probably find its goes on a bit long and fall asleep as they would have been worn out from the day of fun they have had at Xcaret.

If you're looking for a Disney type theme park, this is not for you. There will be a lot of walking. The grounds are beautiful. There are many wonderful eco attractions. Their sea turtle program is great. They keep the sea turtles for a year then release them into the sea. They have a snorkeling area included in the admission price. There are other attractions for additional costs. We made five visits to the park during our weeks vacation. The park is educational and fun. Their nightly drama is spectacular. I definitely recommend this park.

Ta på dig bekväma skor för du kommer gå mycket! Otroligt mycket att se, allt från en fjärilsträdgård till akvarium till delfiner... köper du xcaret plus får du simma in i parken genom en undervattensflod, vilket var supermysigt! 
Vi var även på showen på kvällen och åt en 7-rätters mexikansk middag, väldigt gott! Min sambo fyllde år två dagar tidigare och fick en extra efterrätt. :-) väldigt trevlig show, gillade speciellt maya-indianernas ball game. Showen ingår men ska du ha mat är det 60 dollar per person. 

Minus i parken är att man först betalar ett dyrt inträde och sedan kostar alla aktiviteter mycket pengar utöver det. Vi kom som par, men för en barnfamilj blir det lite dyrt...

He estado aquí más de 5 veces y al día de hoy no me canso de decir que es un parque que representa gran parte de nuestro país.

El show es increíble, muestra lo hermoso de México.

Los restaurantes son de primera, en mi opinión tendrías que tener más de tres Dias aquí para poder hacer todo lo que ofrece.

We visited the Xcaret Eco Theme Park several times as it was attached to our hotel during our stay in Mexico, which was perfect.

There is so much to do and see, turtles, parrots, snorkeling, wild animals and history.

It's a great way to spend the day, especially if the weather isn't the best for the beach.

This park is seriously amazing! 
My husband and I enjoyed watching the flying men, checking out the ruins, looking at all the fun creatures and making amazing memories. 
I just wish we had an additional day or two to explore more of the park. It's huge and wonderful with lots of fun gift shops and things to do with your kids. They even have a pink flamingo parade. This place is definitely worth checking out for sure! 

Cannot wait to go again!
El lugar es increíble!!! Realizamos snorkel en un arrecife toda la familia fue algo que no vamos a olvidar hermoso

We booked our 1-day Xcaret Plus pass directly from their website over a month in advance, which got us discounted price.  (Reminder to bring your photo ID and credit card you used to purchase the ticket for entry)

We stayed at Occidental Resort, which is walking distance from Xcaret park. They have a cute little boat that takes you from the resort to the park, which we used.  

Recommendations: Mayan floating river, aviary area, sea turtles and manatees, beach area, scenic tower, and night show.

Food: Highly recommend the international buffet that's along the black path. So good! We originally planned on going to the int'l buffet near the blue path, but found it to be unexpectedly closed.

Floating River: Get the Xcaret Plus and do the Mayan River instead of Manatee River. This is what we did after reading many reviews, and found it to be efficient - Put all your belongings in the bag that gets transported to the end of the river. If you use the lockers, then you can't use anything in your locker until you come back all the way to the entrance of the park.  In our bag we put changing clothes, towels, hairbrush, camera, water bottle, tennis shoes, etc. The Mayan River takes you to the very end of the park near the beachside and it's about an hour float.  We kept our waterproof phone pouch and phone with us. We wore our own water shoes instead of the huge fins. After putting your belongings in the bag, get your life jacket and then you're on your way! 

Special Passes: We got there at 9:30AM and planned our path well to ensure we saw everything in one day, so we only got 1-day pass. We got Xcaret Plus, which included life jacket and lunch. If you have children or are doing any special activities that require additional pay (swimming with dolphins, sharks, etc) then you might need another day and a 2-day pass might be worth it.  

Optimal path - After floating river, we were right next to the beach side so we walked through that to enjoy the scenic view and take photos. Then we headed back down toward the entrance area following the black path and went through the butteryfly and aviary area and got lucky to see a leopard. We saw everything in the black path. Then we went through the green path hoping to eat lunch at the int'l buffet that's along the green path, but that was closed, so we went back to the int'l buffet along the black path. Afterwards we headed towards the top of the blue path and walked along down the blue path to see everything there and made it towards the entrance.  We followed the brown path out the park but went up the scenic tower first before heading to our resort next door.  We got in the park 9:30 and saw everything by 3:30 and chilled at our resort. We sat down at the night show theatre 30 minutes early (6:30) to ensure we got close seating. We sat 4 rows up.

Night Show: Highlight of the entire park. AMAZING no words.

Clothing: We went into the park wearing our swimsuits.  I had a swim dress on that looks like a summer dress.  That way we didn't waste time changing clothes since we did the floating river first.  Then we went to the dressing room and changed into dry clothes.  I wore a summer dress with tennis shoes since there's a lot of walking involved.

Las instalaciones son muy grandes, bellas, limpias, con infinidad de actividades, folklor, naturaleza, playa, snorkel, en fin... De verdad que vale mucho la pena, la experiencia es inolvidable!
Lo más recomendable es hospedarse en el hotel Occidental Xcaret y comprar entrada ilimitada al parque durante su estancia para que puedan disfrutar de todo lo que ofrece el pareque tranquilamente.
Es la segunda ves que visitó el parque Xcaret y me sigue encantando al igual que a toda mi familia. Es una experiencia muy bonita y además es un lugar súper cuidado y limpio. Vale la pena visitarlo.

It was just ten minutes from playa del carmen, very well organized, the came to my hotel and explain everything about our visit, 
The swim in the xenotes is very safe and amazing, my kids loved it, it was almost an our.there are many activities and show.
The bird area was amazing and when we were tired to walk around we went inthe kids area with water slides to chill.
After all a very nice day with family

We spent an entire day at Xcaret. We were the first one to get in by 8:45 and we were the first ones in the underground rivers by 9:00. It took us almost an hour but what an expeirence!! Highly recommended. They took our bags locked and transported it for free to the end point where we collected them (they gave us the keys). This place is out of the  world. The Aviary and butterfly park are very nice too. Overall very nicely spread. Multiple restaurants with decent international buffet. There was no real beach here with waves.. the beach was rocky. Snorkeling was just 'meh'.. we have seen so many better places around the globe. Childrens park is good with a lot of obstacle courses, water slides etc.  Overall, a good place to visit with the family

Aunque las entradas al parque pueden ser algo costosas, el plan que dura todo 1 dia en el plan de almuerzo incluido, vale la pena definitivamente. El contacto con la naturaleza, las playas, los cenotes, paseo en balsa en medio de un ambiente tan tranquilo definitivamente vale la pena. 
La comida en los restaurantes nos parecio muy buena con diferentes opciones y ubicados en varios lugares del parque.
El show final es un gran esfuerzo por hacer un evento de gran altura, te ayuda a conocer la historia de Mexico, sus costumbres y entender mas de su cultura. 
En general es una gran experiencia visitar Xcaret quedamos muy felices con esta experiencia y la recomendamos sin dudarlo.
O parque faz-nos sentir como se tivéssemos realmente numa ilha tropical, a comida é boa e é muito organizado as filas para as actividades demoram muito pouco tempo
El parque es enorme y muy bello hay actividades para todos los gustos y edades, nadar por los ríos es genial y el espectáculo de México mágico es maravilloso!!!

Everything was truly well designed, fun, educational and the park closed with a show that was incredibly delightful to watch and listen to. We loved every minute of our adventure in this theme park. Worth every pesos without question.

From the pick up from our resort to this theme park, all was excellent. If you don't like crowds choose wisely. All the themes are mapped out for you. We did 8 hours there which included floating in the water for almost an hour and half. Lunch buffets are excellent and lots of food to choose from. 
Uneven grounds so wear good sandals and shoes. Bring water shoes if you want. Swimming in the caves was a great experience! There is so much to do it will keep you entertained all day. Long walks so if you have children be prepared. Can be very hot and humid, bring sunscreen and water to drink or you can buy it. A great day and lots of photo opportunities. Enjoy!

We bought the Plus pass for a day at the park. With that pass a life jacket, locker and fins were provided. A meal was included as well. The Cenote swim was a whole lot of fun!  They provide locking duffel bags for your things and valuables. The bags are transported to the other end and are ready for you when you exit the water. My husband and girls swam the Cenote’s more than once. Due to cooler temperatures, I opted see other features of the park instead. We ate our meal at the International buffet along the black route. It was incredibly busy, long lines and they could not keep up with the demand for food. What we did eat was poor in quality and taste. Not worth the money. The horse show was good, however their viewing area is not even remotely close to big enough for the amount of people trying to see the performance. People were saving seats 1 1/2 - 2 hours before the show. It was standing room only and hopefully you don’t have anyone taller than you in front. The evening performance was very well done and showcases the history of the Mexican culture. It’s a huge facility with plenty of seating and there is no bad place to sit. It was great to go to Xcaret once. I probably would not choose to go again.

Xcaret es uno de Los parques temáticos más divertidos de la ribera maya . Se pueden hacer todo tipo de activodades acuáticas y hace unos años agregaron una especie de zoológico con animales como leones , tigres , etc . Tiene una playa muy linda y es un lugar muy agradable para ir con familia , amigos o en pareja . Los shows son muy lindos . Súper recomendable.

We managed to do everything we wanted in 1 day. We skipped any extra cost activities, skipped lounging on their beautiful lagoons. We had a great time wandering around the trails, having a look and all the cool things. Stopped for the buffet at la laguna, could have skipped that. Maybe the actual restaurants are better? We ended our day with the cave swim. Fun!

There is no doubt that Ixcaret is a spectacular place, but a few days ago trying to buy tickets for the park left me quite unhappy.
I gave the tickets to my niece and her boyfriend who were on vacation in the Riviera Maya (like when you buy plane tickets online for a family member or third party, they send you an email with the boarding pass and the person only presents an identification to make it valid, or thousands of similar cases such as concerts, museums, etc.). At the Ixcaret site, they are clear when emphasizing that the ticket must be printed before going to the park and in the purchase process, in addition to my personal information, they ask who will claim / use the tickets. Arrived  the time of their trip, when my niece went to print the tickets, she found that in addition to the ticket to access the park, they had to take a copy of my credit card, and my personal identification on both sides to see how I sign (I do not understand why, being an online purchase). When my niece calls me and tells me this, I immediately contact the customer service of the park, where they confirm the above and that in case my identification does not have a visible signature, I must also send a copy of my passport.
 The best part is when I ask what happens with the copy of ALL MY PERSONAL DOCUMENTS and they respond that they keep those copies. Remember, that in the online site they already have my address, telephone and others, so at this point only They are just missing to ask for my Social Security number (I live in the USA). Never in any internet site I had been requested something so ridiculous buying online either for me, or buying as in this case, for third parties when I'm not with them. Definitely be very careful when you go to buy tickets to Ixcaret for family or friends and you are not present on the trip to save yourself a bad time. Kudos for Anahi in customer service who behaved very professionally despite my visible discontent

Requerimiento adsurdo en la compra de tickets online

No hay duda de que Ixcaret es un lugar espectacular, pero hace unos dias tratando de comprar unas entradas para el parque me dejo bastante descontento.
Le regale las entradas a mi sobrina y su novio que  andaban de vacaciones por la Riviera Maya (como cuando uno compra tiquetes de avion para un familiar o tercero online; te mandan un correo electronico con el pase de abordar y la persona solamente presenta una identificacion para hacerlo valido, o miles de casos similares como conciertos, museos, etc). En el sitio de Ixcaret, son claros al enfatizar que se debe imprimir el boleto de entrada antes de ir al parque y en el proceso de compra, ademas de mi informacion personal, preguntan quien va reclamar/usar los tiquetes. LLegado el momento de su viaje, fueron a imprimir los boletos, pero se encontraron con que ademas de eso les exigian para poder acceder al parque, que tenian que llevar copia de mi tarjeta de credito, y mi identificacion personal por ambos lados para ver como firmo (no entiendo porque al ser una compra online). Cuando mi sobrina me llama y me cuenta esto, yo inmediatamente me comunico con servicio al cliente del parque, donde me confirman lo anterior y que en caso tal de que mi identificacion no tenga firma visible, debo enviar ademas copia de mi pasaporte.
 La mejor parte es cuando pregunte que pasa con la copia de TODOS MIS DOCUMENTOS PERSONALES y me responden que ellos se quedan con esas copias, Vale recordar, que en el sitio online ya tienen mi direccion, telefono y demas, asi que a este punto solo les falta pedirme el numero de mi Seguro social (vivo en USA). Nunca en ningun sitio de internet me habian hecho una solicitud tan adsurda comprando en linea ya fuera para mi o comprando como en este caso, para terceros cuando yo no estoy con ellos. Definitivamente tengan mucho cuidado cuando vayan a comprar entradas a Ixcaret para familiares o amigos y ustedes no estan presentes en el viaje para que se ahorren un mal rato. Kudos para Anahi en servicio al cliente que se porto muy profesionalmente a pesar de mi visible descontento.

We had a wonderful time, but struggled to endure cold weather. We missed some of the water attractions because it was to cold. I strongly recommend visiting in Summer Months.
The park is very clean and personnel very helpful, the buffet food is just ok.
The cons:
-The park is expensive by itself, and once inside you have to pay excessive amounts for each of the best activities available. 
-Also drinks, candies and chips are extremely expensive.

Recomiendo llevar poco equipaje y llevarlo encima,ya que en los lockers queda muy incómodo volver a buscar los dadas las grandes distancias a recorrer. Muy lindo los voladores de papantla y México espectacular. La cena en este ultimo ofrece la oportunidad de degustar varios platos típicos de la cocina mexicana
É uma parte muito bonita onde você pode se relacionar com a natureza, o México é tão lindo que eu quero ficar aqui. Eu gostei bastante dos rios e da praia, mas o mais espetacular é o show noturno.

Debo decir que es el mejor parque que he visitado. Hay un sinfín de cosas por ver, nos encantó estar en contacto con la naturaleza. Tuvimos la oportunidad de tomar excelentes fotografías. La mejor parte es que no hay mosquitos, lo cual me sorprendió bastante ya que me esperaba miles de ellos, afortunadamente nuestro paseo estuvo muy bien. La caleta es hermosa, llegas a pensar que es una piscina por la tranquilidad del agua, todo está muy limpio, la comida está rica y todos te atienden con una sonrisa, Alfred de la cocina Mexicana fue muy atento con nosotros. 

Lo MEJOR de todo el día fue el SHOW en la noche, es IMPRESIONANTE! Un show de primer mundo, te hace sentir orgulloso de ser mexicano. Visitaría otra vez el parque principalmente por el show.

we purchased this excursion through Viator prior to arriving in Cancun.  We did the plus tor since it included lunch and there were 9 of us in attendance.  We were picked up promptly at our hotel in a comfortable mini bus and taken to Xcaret without incident.  Fun info and facts were given along the way so we knew what to expect.  We were also shown and told where to meet at the time we needed to depart.  We arrived, bypassed the "add ons" and went directly to the caves for swimming...wow, what a beautiful feature. It's a long swim but certainly something everyone should experience if at all possible.  At the end of the caves our belongings were given to us in the waterproof bag, we unlocked twitch the key they assigned us and we changed and went to go find a place to enjoy lunch.  We had a buffet lunch of shredded tacos and other regional items and spent a relaxing time with exceptional service. After lunch we strolled a short distance and gathered some chairs along the beach and enjoyed the spectacular views for about 2 hours, a few of our group went snorkeling, some found a hammock and napped.  Perfect afternoon. We then took our time walking back and shopped some and took the mini bus back to our hotel... PERFECT DAY!

El parque es muy bonito tiene de todo para todos los gustos, muy grande tanto que no se puede recorrer completo en un sólo día pero vale la pena intentarlo lo único que no me gustó es que las toallas te las rentan muy caras, y las fotos de las actividades extra están muy caras también de ahí en mas todo excelente y no se diga el espectáculo nocturno es lo mejor que he visto en México.

Es un lugar mágico para pasar todo el día, abren desde la 8:30 de la mañana y  es recomendable llegar temprano para hacer la mayor cantidad de actividades posible. 
Han logrado hacer de este parque un lugar que todas las personas del mundo deberían de conocer debido a lo limpio y el hermoso estado en el que lo conservan.
La comida es de primera calidad y la atención de todos los empleados es de primer mundo.
Por la tarde tienes que prepararte para llegar antes de las 18:30 al show que inicia a las 19:00 horas,ya que si el parque esta muy lleno te puedes quedar fuera, debido a que el cupo es limitado.

So glad that we went to this amazing class it was included in our ticket to Xcaret, it's Great experience if you don't enjoy water.   Our instructor was Jesus he was amazing kind and a good teacher he knew many things about chocolate and he is also Native of the area. We did not plan to get into the water due to the weather not being very warm so we looked for many activities for our family to enjoy without getting wet.

I had read a lot about this place and wanted to check it out. On my previous Cancun vacation I went to Xel-ha and loved it.  This place is SO beautiful! Floating the river from one end of the park to the other alone was worth the money.  The snorkeling was neat, but pretty crowded which I expected.  Because we went around Christmas they had an afternoon parade with a band.  They walked around the park and sang Christmas carols.  It was really neat to see! But wait...if you go you NEED to stay for the show they have at night.  Hands down the coolest thing there....minus the river. :) It was really neat to learn more about Mayan culture....oh and the dancing and singing. Vegas style for sure.  You won't regret it!

To quote the late great football announcer Keith Jackson, in terms of eco-adventure parks in the Mayan Riviera, Xcaret is the “granddaddy of ‘em all”.  In our latest trip with our friends we were looking at excursions, and having done Xel-Ha, a sister property to Xcaret, a couple of years ago, we wanted to try something different.  Xcaret actually describes itself as an eco-archaeological park as opposed to eco-adventure, but there is definitely both aspects to it as there are both land and water activities at the park, which is just south of Playa del Carmen.  The big draw of Xcaret is the fact it is a park that celebrates the history and culture of Mexico and is capped off by a nightly spectacular show, which according to the tour guides is ranked one of the best in the world (how do you not believe a Mexican tour guide)?  All kidding aside I have heard it is a pretty magnificent show – yes, heard, not seen, and I’ll tell you why down below.

In terms of booking tickets, you can head to website of Xcaret, where they offer a number of different levels of tickets.  The base ticket offers entry into the park and that’s about it – no lockers, food, or snorkelling gear.  The Xcaret Plus gives you the base entry plus the aforementioned food at one of their many restaurants (only 1 meal though and 1 adult beverage), locker rental and free use of the snorkelling gear.  Xcaret Total gives you Xcaret Plus and 1 activity that is normally over and above the regular price (such as Sea Trek or Snuba).  Should you book online at least 7 days ahead of time they will give you 10% off – 21 days ahead is 15% off but you do have to pick the exact date you’d like to go.  They say you can make changes to that date, but not the day of the event – meaning once you get to Mexico check out the forecast – if the weather day of your event doesn’t look so good change your date right away – they will not let you change the day of the event.  Kids under 11 are 50% off.

We got an email around Black Friday that said they had a sale on, giving us the Xcaret Plus ticket including transportation (I’ll tell you why you don’t want to book it later) for a reduced price – once all was said and done we bought 3 adult tickets and 1 child ticket for about $500 CAD, which according to current website prices saved us about $140 off their internet rates.

Because we were able to get transportation included, we were picked up by a nice bus in front of our hotel at 7:45am – pretty early for a vacation but it was a big, and even though discounted, a fairly expensive day.  The bus only stopped at one other hotel, which ended up being another Iberostar in our complex and away we went – overall it was about a 35-40 minute drive south to Xcaret.  During our trip the tour guide told us all about Xcaret and made some recommendations as to how to navigate the park as efficiently as possible.  In terms of getting the most out of our day, he recommended that we start with the underground rivers and then the snorkelling in the morning and the land activities later – however seeing as we got there around 9am and it was maybe 17-18 degrees Celsius with the water temp right around there, that wasn’t gonna happen.  He is right as those areas were very quiet in the morning but it was pretty obvious as to the reason behind that.

Instead we did what normal people would do – we checked the map and made a plan and waited for it to warm up.  The map and the park were laid out very well and different areas are color coded via the paths you take to get there and around the areas.  For example, the zoo/aquarium area was blue coded so as long as you followed the blue path you were in the right place.  And that’s where we started as it was closest to the lockers and the start of the underground rivers for later – it was a nice start as they had some domestic creatures like the fat Tapir and some nurse sharks in a tank – but the stars of this show are all the turtles they had on display.  Everything from babies to fully grown sea turtles are around and there is something about those lazy looking things that make me happy.

By nearly 11 it definitely had warmed up so we hustled over and changed into swim suits for the underground rivers – lifejackets and flippers are the main gear for this one – no tubes as the water does not move you – only you and your flippers.  There are 3 rivers to choose from but they all end up in the same spot and probably have similar cool caves and openings to swim through.  All in all it was a very cool swim – cool scenery and cool water – but well worth the journey.  The kids (ages 9-12) had no issues other than the odd flipper shot from another swimmer in the ribs, and it is about 1 km once all is said and done.  The one surprising fact about the river experience is that from the time we decided to go back to the lockers, change, get our gear, do the river and then dry off was about 1 hr 45 minutes…it was not a short part of the day.

A couple of recommendations for the underground river – before you get your lifejacket and other gear you get to throw some essentials (towels, sandals and more) into a bag that gets locked up and taken to the end of the river so you can dry off – also take some clothes to put on (t-shirt or cover-up) because you are 1km away now from the lockers and it’s a bit of a jaunt back, which takes up a lot of your day and after being in that river you will be sporting a couple of diamondcutters on your chest.  Also if you do not have an underwater camera they do sell the iphone waterproof covers, but for about $59US – our resort sold them for $39US so you can easily find one for a lot cheaper than what they have on site.

As you may have noticed I haven’t said why 1) not to take their transportation yet or 2) why we didn’t see the spectacular show…it’s coming…

We finished the river and went for lunch at one of their many restaurants and enjoyed pretty much exactly what we would have at the resorts, except less free beer.  At this point some of the group are done with water activities while the rest want to snorkel – so we walk by the jaguar and puma (yes singular each and busy sleeping) and then head to the lockers (remember that 1 km journey?) where some people change and then we head over to one of the snorkelling areas, and we see why the tour guide told us to get there early.  The place is jam packed!  I’m not even sure any fish could fit in between all the fins in the water!  Nonetheless, 8 or 9 of us out of 12 grab the snorkel gear that is included and head into the cove – yes there are some fish but the area is truly overloaded with waaaay too many people.  Overall the snorkelling is short-lived but after the rivers, lunch, and walking back and forth from the lockers it is after 3pm.  By this point everyone is done with water activities so another jaunt back to the lockers for the final dry off and change into dry clothes, but we are now close to 3:30pm.

Now’s here why I suggest not taking their transportation and finding your own way to Xcaret – when we left our hotel at 7:45am we were told there were 2 options of getting home again on their transportation – either before the show, which we were told we had to meet by 4:30pm, or after the show, which left at 9:30pm, and if you stayed for the show you also had to book dinner at one of the “show” restaurants, which isn’t included in any of their packages.

So as you can see by my timeline above, either we have 1 hr left in the park or 6 hrs left – at that point we all agreed that the underground rivers knocked the snot out of us so we only had 1 hr left, but a lot of park to still see.  The kids wanted to go to the scenic tower, which is near the entrance and takes you up about 80m and revolves, giving everyone a great panoramic view of the area.  It is about a 10 min experience.

Once we were finished with that it was 4:20pm and basically time to go – we didn’t get much time near the water nor in the Mexican cultural area – had we taken a taxi (and we have done this before and easily found a decent deal for all 12 of us) we could have left around 6 and seen everything the park has to offer, except for the show.  And although it would have been to see the “espectacular!” I certainly was in agreement that another 5 hrs at the park was going to be a waste with pretty much a guarantee that 3-4 kids were going to fall asleep during the show.  By the time we got back to the resort it was a 10 hour day which was more than enough for a Mexican Excursion.

Did we like it?  Yes – it was a very cool place and I wish we had a little more time to finish it.

Hay mil cosas que hacer en el parque, mis favoritos son el río y la zona de playas. La comida muy rica aunque me quedé con antojo de Ceviche verde, el día 3 de enero no tenían en el bufete y es delicioso, no lo quiten por favor! Nuestro mesero bastante despistado pero si lo llamabas era atento. 

DOS TIPS: 
1. Quédense al espectáculo nocturno MÉXICO ESPECTACULAR. Sobre todo si eres Mexicano terminas super emocionado y más que orgulloso de México, se te olvida todo lo malo por un rato y solo piensas en las virtudes y bellezas de este país.

2. Compren el paquete de fotos, los lugares donde están puestas las cámaras son estratégicos !!! Paisajes hermosos, tortugas enormes, vale mucho mucho la pena.

3. Si eres mexicano tienen un descuento especial en su página de internet por comprar anticipadamente. 

Si es su primera vez en riviera maya, visítenlo, les va a encantar.

Faltaría que con las llaves del casillero entreguen toallas ya que la entrada no es nada barata y mínimo deberían dar ese servicio gratuito !!!! El show nocturno es muy bueno pero lo considero un poco largo .

Viajé en el 2016 al parque de Xcaret, no es el peor parque del mundo, pero es muy básico, te dedicas todo el tiempo hacer tirolesa porque es lo único que hay basicamente. La entrada costaba USD 100. para mi opinión no lo vale.
La comida que incluye el paquete full, es un buffet libre de muy mala calidad. 
No lo recomiendo.
Muy lindo sitio para visitar,  el nadar en los ríos subterráneos es imperdible. Muy buen espectáculo cuando finaliza la jornada sobre toda la historia de Mexico

4 of us took the Plus package which included a buffet and beer while in the park. We chose the Laguna buffet restaurant. The beer was small. The seafood island had no seafood at 2 PM. The food generally was just OK even considering it is a buffet. The place was very busy so nothing was sitting long. One soft ice cream machine was empty the other produced a very poor example of ice with a bit of chocolate in it. Considering the high quality of the features of Excaret the restaurant was a disappointment.
Me encanto todo ! Son todos muy buena onda y atentos. Las actividades son muy divertidas. Espero volver a ir pronto!
Highlight is an underground swim (with life jackets & helmets).  Mostly underground, with some sections at the bottom of deep but open canyons.  Restaurants and beaches nearby.  Dolphin shows.

He estado varias veces en este parque y ha mejorado mucho, la comida es muy buena . Recomiendo llevar camisa térmica y zapatos de agua , además llegar temprano porque es muy grande , el show nocturno es buenísimo ... debes reservar todo el día para este lugar el show termina 9:15 pm
Está sumamente hermoso, la comida no es muy buena pero las instalaciones son preciosas y muy divertidas

Estimados, me hubiese gustado evitar este comentario. Más allá de la mala señalización del parque y sus atracciones, pocas atracciones divertidas no pagas -ya que lo más importante ES pago, y lo demás es relleno-, precios excesivamente altos, etc.; me lleva a concluir que ustedes son una burda imitación de los excelentes y extraordinarios parques estadounidenses. Ha sido un claro error que los cataloguen como la atracción más visitada en Mexico durante el 2016. 
Al regresar del parque con mi familia hemos sufrido, mi hijo de 11 años y yo, una intoxicación alimentaria producto de la ingesta de alimentos evidentemente sin control bromatológico obvio, de la que aún hoy estamos sufriendo las consecuencias. Hemos visto que en el restaurant “La Península” al que acudimos (frente a la atracción Delfines Xcaret, número 41), las palomas comían de las mismas fuentes de los comensales. Por esta razón deberían estar TODOS los restaurantes del establecimiento clausurados. 
Moraleja: de no cambiar las condiciones del servicio, higiene, señalización, costos, sugiero NO gastar su tiempo visitando este parque. Tome su dinero y tiempo y vaya a EEUU a Disney o a Universal Studios, no pierde nada si no visita este parque.
Sería ideal que me reintegraran todo lo gastado en la visita al parque, y me recompensaran el daño moral producido, para evitar pensar que se trata de una estafa internacional.
Saludos cordiales.
Aldo Polischer.
Parque ótimo para todas as idades, comida boa , atrações e shows imperdíveis, experiência única , vale a visita!

It would take too many words to describe what you can do at this park so I'm going to make it easy for you with some tips for your trip to Xcaret.

Plan to spend ALL day here.  This park has activities all day long with the Mexican Spectacular starting at 7pm to end the day.

This park is a zoo, aquarium, beach, river, pool, city, cenote.. It is EVERYTHING.  You will not get bored here.  Be prepared to walk!

They have lots of buffet style restos around the park with a few bars scattered around as well.

You're going to have a great time here.  Just be prepared physically and mentally to be there all day.

Käytiin Xcaretissa mieheni kanssa. Maksettiin reissusta n. 130e per naama. Ajateltiin, että hintaan kuuluu paljon tekemistä, kun on niin kallis. Kuitenkin tähän hintaan kuuluivat vain perusaktiviteetit joiden parissa puistossa kului n. 3h ajan. Ja itselläni oli ison osan ajasta todella tylsää.
Itseäni surettivat eläimet, esim osa linnuista ei päässyt lainkaan lentämään. Puisto tarjosi lisämaksusta uintia myös delfiinien kanssa ja tätä en voi ymmärtää.
Iso osa eläimistä vain makasi. Toki, päiväkin oli lämmin.

Ruoka on kallista ja hintaan nähden heikkoa. Esim susheja ei säilytetty edes kylmässä. Mainittakoon, että en uskaltanut niitä syödä. Olut oli kallista ja tarjoilijat muistivat mainita että tippi ei kuulu hintaan. Yksi tarjoilija ei tuonut vaihtorahoja takaisin vain piti ne tippinä kysymättä.
Lähdimme ennen iltashowta sillä aika ei olisi kulunut siihen asti.
En suosittele, nyt jos voisin päättää niin laittaisin rahani johonkin muualle.

Vale a pena ir, se programe porque você passa o dia todo la, o parque é gigante, possui muitas opções.. algumas pagas. Tem acesso a uma linda praia. A primeira atividade a fazer é o mergulho no rio subterrraneo. Fiz massagem relaxante dentro de uma caverna, há mergulho com tubarões.. vale a pena, fiz o passeio no primeiro dia que cheguei em Cancun.

We were looking for a botanical garden type of place to visit and Xcaret was the closest we could find.  They have many different water features one can take part in, however we really just wanted to walk and see the plants, butterflys and birds.  And walk we did, however it was good exercise and I'm not complaining.  This park is owned by Mexicans and they are very proud of it.  The park is set up really well and it is easy to get around in it because they have it sectioned off by colors.  Whichever color of the park you are in is marked on the walkway so you always know where you are in the park.  Personally I loved the birds.  So many and so beautiful.  There are many places you can have lunch at there.  We decided on the Mexican buffet and we definitely made the right decision.  It was a buffet that had more items than we could possibly eat.  We did not stay around later in the afternoon for the shows, however I hear that they are really spectacular.  That will be for our next trip there.  The only thing I'll recommend is that you should be prepared for walking and for humidity, as it is like a rain forest really.  We are from Arizona so the extreme humidity was a challenge for us.  Overall though it was fine and I would certainly recommend this as a top place to visit.  A very fun outing.

Nunca tinha feito uma viagem a nadar num rio subterrâneo. Foram cerca de 45 minutos diferentes de tudo. A quem puder, não deixe de repetir. Se não o fizer, arrepender-se-á como eu. No final do dia, o espectáculo “Xcaret México Espectacular” não é só bom, é do melhor que já vi. O único senão foi o tempo, choveu bastante. Recomendo muito.

El parque está muy bonito, conservado.
Nadar en el río subterráneo es imperdible y se disfruta mucho.
Visitar el acuario, poder tocar erizos y ver los peces súper cerca con información detallada de la especie y ecosistema, hace la información muy divertida.
Ver los distintos shows que ofrece xcaret, es una gran ventaja, pues está incluida dentro de tu entrada.
Variedad de restaurantes de especialidades.

Float in three crystal clear underground rivers, visit a Mayan village, see Jaguars and Pumas, a gorgeous Mexican hacienda, a Mexican rodeo, aquariums, archaeological sites and so much more. The day ends with a spectacular show on the history and culture of Mexico. Spend the extra money for the dinner offered during the show. It was unbelievable. Words don't do justice to this #1 park in the world.

My family of 15 (ages 70-7) had a great time at this park. The water temperature for the underground rivers was a little chilly but, since it is not a "lazy river floating" experience, everyone warmed up. The three river courses are quite different (although the staff may tell you they are all the same), our family felt that it was definitely worth trying all three.
The grounds have a wide variety of exhibits, from a butterfly house and aviary to a nature walk and historic hacienda. As the day wore on we found the crowds a little off putting but, if you are staying nearby you can leave and come back. The parking is well organized but at least during our visit giving up a good parking space was enough motivation to stay put. 
The specialty shows like the horse riding demonstration or chocolate making "class" were fun and of course the Mayan influence was nice to experience.
This is a pricey attraction but our family enjoyed it.

Muy lindo el parque y bien cuidado. Tiene lockers para guardar las pertenencias. Hay variedad de restaurantes y buffets para almorzar. El unico detalle es que deben pagarse muchas actividades extra ya que la pulsera aunque sea vip no incluye las más lindas de realizar

I came here with 3 other families; 3 of which had children under 4 years old. We walked around like you would at a zoo. There were small buildings that were aquariums. Then as we left one there were hundreds of turtles and it was quite a sight to see! After, we continued and saw the flamingo crossing. The whole family loved this. Flamingoes who were trained (like a dog would be). It was adorable and like nothing we’ve seen before. Then we swam through a river holding our 1 and 3 year old (they provided life jackets for all of us and free bags for us to lock our belongings in and drove them to the end for us to get at the end of our trip). It was great! The water felt wonderful and the sights along the way, including caves with bats that we went through, were fantastic. The best part is that there are stops throughout the park and along the river for you to scan your wristband and have photos taken and attached to your band. We were able to attach all 4 bands (from our 4 families) and buy a package of the photos - it was one price and we had nearly 100 photos! I only wish there were places in the US that did that. We ate at one of the restaurants afterward and it was fantastic too! We would do it again - all of us! We only spent about 7 hours there but we didn’t even get to see everything. It was worth it to us, we loved it!
We were pleasantly surprised by what a fun day we had here. We saw lots of animals and the highlight was definitely snorkeling the underground river.
If you can only visit one park at Playa Del Carmen, this is the one. It has everything you can do, underground river swimming, snorkeling, night shows.

Went to this park twice on our recent stay. First time we went at night for the nightly show. Really didn’t know what to expect as we walked into the park. Immediately after entering the gates you are in the jungle walking. They had Mayan natives in full dress and body paint playing drums etc scattered in the hills and Mayan ruins  along the pathway — really cool way to start off. Awesome nightly show with all the history of Mexico. 
     Went back in 2 days as we thought the place would be neat to see in the daytime. We were not disappointed. We truly thought “ah a couple of hours and then go back to Hotel Xcaret” we ended up staying 7 hours. From the cool turtles to shark swimming to dolphins then the river walk through the cave  seas truly amazing. Very long but I loved it. The whole place is an eco park with the coolest beaches as well ( I didn’t know this so plan on some beach time - you won’t be disappointed.
El río subterráneo increíble, pero el mariposario y el aviario maravillosos!!!!! Y las orquídeas lindas!!!! Increíble desarrollo

Gostei, tudo organizado e lindo demais. Mas, faço uma ressalva: o parque é legal para quem tem crianças ou quer um lugar lindo e calmo. Para aventuras aquáticas os outros parques são melhores, além do mais tudo no parque é extra, então se torna um passeio caro para quem está com um grupo grande, por exemplo, a parte que mais gostei foi do rio subterrâneo, fora isso e o visual, não achei o passeio imperdível.

This park is the perfect combination of activity, wildlife spotting, cultural and historical entertainment. It's a hybrid between Jurassic Park and Indiana Jones. And lots and lots of swimming. Runs like clockwork and is super organised. They are really serious about their conservation efforts.

It was fun, educational, enjoyable, relaxing, all at the same time. And proof that Mexico has some of the most talented people in the world.

All the shows were amazing and exceptional. The bodypaint, the costumes, the talent and commitment of the artists... They never broke character once.

And the show at the end of the day? UNREAL!!! Especially with dinner.

Make sure you stay at the hotel right next door so you can maximise your time having fun. We stayed at Occidental and it was super worth it - we could walk to the park in minutes.
Nice place great food, the show at night was awesome , the hall park was Great, you need at least two days to see it all.
This was our best day in Mexico. The value was exceptional. Very easy to navigate and unlimited zip lines. Really good buffet included and a great juice bar.

Uno de los mejores de parques de Aventura, les recomiendo que hagan todas las tirolesas, las cuáles son la mayor atracción del Parque, los circuitos que tienen, Venado y Jaguar son excelentes. El circuito Jaguar es el más largo y alto y pueden llegar hasta una tirolesa en la que el descenso es de casi 80 segundos.
Por favor lleven ropa que se seque rápido y zapatos que no pesen tanto para que puedan hacer todas las actividades mas libremente. En mi casi utilicé zapatos plásticos y no me los quité en ninguna atracción. Hay comida incluida y desayuno igualmente.
Ein schöner Park mit viel Aktivitäten und Tieren inmitten einer Dschungellandschaft. Für Kinder bestimmt toll. Für uns als Paar schön durch zu laufen, aber dafür doch ein bisschen teuer.
Tout est magnifique.  Il y a des activités pour 1 semaines.  Nous passions toutes nos jours avec mon garcon de 5 ans et c'était parfait.

Encantador, organizado y muy cuidado el parque con innovación tecnología a favor de los  que lo visitamos,  también con respeto a la flora y fauna local. Criticable los precios algo excesivos en alimentos bebidas y souvenirs, conviene adquirir paquetes y anticipar la compra en línea hasta 3 semanas antes de acudir, precio de exceso de las fotos, les sugiero comprar antes una bolsa impermeable para la toma de fotos con el celular ya que dentro de parque el precio puede ser hasta de 700 % más que en el resto de los lugares, la adquisición antes de la entrada al parque de actividades extra resulta en buenos descuentos de hasta un 10%. La comida es bastante buena. El parque es para conocerlo en un par de Días existen pases de varios días pero en 2 días es suficiente.
Sensacional, diferente dos demais parques que já visitei mundo afora, conhecer rios secretos, visitar trilhas artificiais , animais e o contato com a natureza é encantador.

Park exceptionnel, nous l’avons fait en une journée sans faire tous les spectacles et activité car le park est énorme !!
Les animaux sont magnifiques les plantes de même. Le park est propre ! La nourriture est bonne ! Tout est ok . Les activités sont extraordinaires !!!!! 
Je recommande cette activité ! Et n’oublier pas la fin le spectacle xcaret. Il est magique et inoubliable
Lugar muito bonito. Reúne fauna, flora, mar, gastronomia, cultura geral. Para todas as idades. Imperdível.

En el mariposario se encuentran cientos de mariposas, la mayorías de las que se ven tienen sus alas lastimadas. Son constantemente molestadas por los visitantes y tienen una red en el techo que no les permite salir. Es muy triste de ver. Así están todos los animales, se venden como ecológicos pero es todo lo contrario.

We took a Royal Caribbean excursion to Xcaret and enjoyed it immensely. Be sure to bring water shoes that you can use to walk to the lazy river and swim 35 minutes with a jacket life preserver. Otherwise, you will need to walk barefoot from the locker to the river. Do not plan to swim the lazy river if you are claustrophobic. There are long distances through a narrow tunnel that is not that well lit. Everyone has to pack their belongings into a large duffel bag and is given a key to the lock. Be sure to secure the key to your life preserver jacket very well. We lost the key in the river and had to pay $6 to have the lock cut on the duffel bag. I probably would have paid more because I was dripping wet, shivering, and badly needed the towel in the duffel bag. We enjoyed seeing the wonderful animals, aquarium, hacienda, butterfly garden, and model pyramids. A great day!
Très beau parc , que dire de la balade dans les grottes sous terraine nager sous la terre tout simplement wow. Un peu cher les resto sur place.
we visited the place to show it to our kids. they love crowded places like malls , etc. they enjoy there amongs thousands of them.
Es un parque donde puedes ver muchos animales, es un parque muy bien hecho con diferentes atracciones! Me encanto el show del final de Mexico con los bailes y los papas volando! Muy divertido!

We spent about 14 hours in this huge and beautiful park. I saw it the first time and at the beginning I was pretty sure that it is going to be like Xplor with some activities to older kids. But surprisingly was not. Instead, we spent wonderful day walking around the park and watching the animals. My husband and my daughter were swimming in underground river and said the it was wonderful experience.  Night show is amazing really worth to see. The only thing that was surprise for me that the agents who sold us the tickets did not mention that there is only  one meal included. Being before in Xplor and Hel-ha were everything is included for whole stay, it was not nice surprise for me and our friends with small kids.

Xcaret es un eco parque muy grande. Difícilmente un visitante pueda recorrerlo todo en una sóla visita. Las asistentes que se encuentran en la entrada del mismo nos asesoraron sobré cómo sería mejor recorrerlo para no perderse de lo más importante. Comenzaré diciendo que saqué las entradas por el sitio web 21 días antes y así obtuve el 15% de descuento en las entradas Plus. Fuimos familia de 4 personas con adolescentes y recomiendo no perderse el nado por el río subterráneo con una cámara deportiva. Si no llevas cámara, igualmente el lugar está preparado para tomarte fotos en puntos estratégicos con un sistema de reconocimiento Al finalizar con tu brazalete se escanea y te venden las fotos que quieras. El mariposario es imperdible y el aviario también. Todos los shows están cuidados en detalles. Los animales como las tortugas, tiburones, manta rayas también están muy cuidadas. Recomiend subir la torre escénica desde donde se puede observar toda la costa y la gran selva que rodea este gran emprendimiento. El piso está señalizado con líneas de colores para poder seguirlas en los mapas que te entregan al ingresar. Seguimos la línea azul, la blanca, y la negra. Así pudimos ver casi todo lo del parque. Finalizamos el recorrido de los ríos subterráneos y nuestras pertenencias que habíamos dejado al ingresar en un bolso que se cierra delante tuyo, ya estaba en el sector de salida. Pudimos secarnos y dirigirnos al Restaurant que desearamos . Elegimos El Manglar. Abundantísimo todo lo que comimos y muy sabrosa toda la comida. Entradas, platos principales de todos los gustos y postres también. Bebida sin alcohol ilimitada y una cerveza por persona adulta. Posteriormente seguimos la línea negra y llegamos al delfinario, observamos a quienes realizaban la actividad (que no tiene interacción con el delfín) y luego vimos tortugas y tiburones. El show de los caballos previo al show final de Xcaret México espectacular, lo evitaría. Mucha gente esperó largo rato para ver escasa destreza. Es imperdible el ultimo show que finaliza a las 21hs. Tiene un intermedio de 10 minutos donde se explica que los colectivos o transportes esperarán a toda la gente y que no es necesario perderse el final del show. Tal cual, nosotros llegamos en vans públicas (45 pesos mexicanos) y tomamos "el despeinado o el pícaro" (los transportes de xcaret para recorrer el tramo desde la ruta hasta la puerta del lugar) y sin ningún problema regresamos idem . En la ruta,ya de noche. esperaban varias vans para recoger a la gente. Muy seguro todo. Sin problemas.

Estuvimos en el parque junto a mi mujer y nuestro hijo de 3 años. La pasamos muy buen en todo momento. Llegamos a las 10:30 aprox y nos fuimos al finalizar el show principal a las 21:00 hs. Hicimos el nado por el río secreto, con salvavidas todos, aunque nos dimos cuenta después que no habíamos pedido las patas de rana (infaltables para cansarse menos). En todo momento uno está seguro (yo no sé nadar, en algunos lugares había profundidad superior a los 2mts. Y no tuve ningún problema ni temor). En cuanto a animales, lo más lindo, los delfines y las tortugas gigantes. El acuario también es lindo para los chicos sobre todo. Entre un circuito y otro se puede tomar un baño en el sector de Playa artificial. Hay otras opciones para hacer que nosotros no hicimos por la edad de nuestro hijo pero que hubiese hecho, como la caminata por el lecho marino, con unos cascos enormes que tienen oxígeno para que uno pueda caminar por ahí abajo como si estuviese en la superficie. Llevar repelente de mosquitos y a caminar!!!.

la atención desde la recogida en los hoteles, la organización que tiene en cuenta todos los detalles, la calidez de la gente, el buen cuidado de los sitios, el ambiente, la naturaleza, la señalización, la calidad de sus restaurantes, en general me permito recomendarlo ampliamente.

Me encanto el parque hay mucho que ver, algo que no te puedes perder es el nado en el río hay tres rutas para escoger y te la pasas muy bien, algo que no puedes perderte es el espectáculo que hacen en la noche es muy bueno

Hermoso parque temático que combina deporte acuático, arte y atracciones. Ideal para pasar todo el día. Lo que más nos gustó fueron los ríos subterráneos. No se puede ir a Playa del Carmen o Cancun sin visitarlo

В парк лучше ехать после 11часов-не так много народу.Мы ездили сами-без экскурсии.Билеты купили в кассе,зашли,везде походили,поплавали в подземной речке(полотенце брали с собой).Можно перекусить в кафе(рекомендую Лагуна).Парк очень большой-лучше взять план-карту,(при входе в парк)а то можно запутаться.Много разных магазинчиков с сувенирами ,игрушками и.т.д.В парке есть и животгые,и птицы с бабочками.Вечером начинаются разные представления(около 6часов).Такси прямо у входа в парк без проблем.

Visited for day with family including our granddaughter of 18 months. So much to do and see I would recommend you spend time when entering park to work out what you want to do especially if you want to book to swim with dolphins and get time slot. Look to see in programme when certain display events are scheduled to ensure you maximise your visit. Found it useful in following the coloured routes on map within park. Plenty of areas to rest and eat throughout park with shade if required. Had excellent day at park. Would highly recommend if visiting Cancun.
Me gusto, esta bien estructurado y tiene mucho para disfrutar, pero es una locura el precio de los fotos, no tiene relacion con nada.

Visitar Cancun y no ir a Xcaret es como no haber venido. 
Un lugar increíble, con muchas cosas que hacer dentro de parque, los ríos Subterráneos son maravillosos, la actividad  en el río se debe hacer obligatoria en la visita a Xcaret, es de lo mejor. Las actividades extra, si son un poco caras, estas actividades no están incluidas en el ticket  de ingreso, Se pagan por aparte y lo mejor es comprarlas en combo para que seas más accesibles. Yo hice snorkeling y nado con Delfines y puedo decir que definitivamente vale la pena por lo que se paga. 
Hay mucho más actividades que se puede hacer sin la necesidad de pagar por las extras, es cuestión de gustos.

Escuche mucho hablar sobre este parque (siempre comentarios buenos) y la verdad no entiendes hasta que lo conoces, quede maravillada con este lugar, conviviendo con la naturaleza, todos los atractivos, el rio, los animales, la playa, los restaurantes, shows etc. Lo recomiendo mucho y mucho mas el show nocturno.
Simplemente espectacular y todo muy bonito. El Show es un most tienes que verlo. Gracias!! Me encanto!

Una experiencia al nivel de un parque de diversiones de primer mundo.
Maravillosas instalaciones y excelente logística y servicio.

Muy buena experiencia, si van a la Riviera Maya no dejen de visitar este parque, muy bien cuidado, todas sus instalaciones excelentes, buffet muy variado y rico, quédense porfavor al espectáculo de México espectacular Vale la pena.

We visited xcaret for my birthday and we were not disappointed.  We didn't manage to see the whole park as there was just too much to do but we especially enjoyed the lazy river, seeing baby chicks hatch, the temascal experience and the main show in the evening. It was Dia del Muertos so it was busy as you can expect. The free face painting stations were a nice touch as were the other day of the dead festivities. We visited the ceremony twice so we could see it all lit up. I would definitely recommend booking two days to make sure you can see it all. 

The only downsides were that because of the scheduling we couldn't see the day of the dead show as well as the main show, it was rather expensive for one day and the queue for the buffet in the evening was ridiculous. Food couldn't be cooked fast enough, and rather than people get to g what they could then going back they were just standing there. We stood queuing for an hour before we could get any food; so go early for food.
Such a great experience and so many things to do!  You need a few days here in order to see and do everything!

Beautiful park, loved the beaches, water park, bird avary and butterfly area, It was a great day, the show at the end was worth the price of admission. Especially loved the swim nearly 1/2 mile down the fresh water river!
Definitely a worthwhile visit, it was a great experience. Buy the photo pass totally worth it. We ate at the Caribbean restaurant it was great. Take mosquito spray and water shoes and your set.

Lugar lindíssimo, tem piscinas naturais ao lado do mar, pequenas praias e muitos animais! Vale a pena visitar o aquário e aprender mais sobre os corais! Almoçamos no restaurante La Cocina (dentro do parque) e foi excelente. Vale a pena passar o dia e a noite assistir ao belo espetáculo sobre a cultura mexicana. Um dos melhores shows que vi na vida! Super recomendo! Dica: leve protetor solar biodegradável e repelente também biodegradável.
Winning the Yucatan Peninsula make it a point to visit this beautiful ecological Park, you will feel nature at its best and whatever you do... do not miss the evenings show with dinner
Es un parque que tiene cultura, entretenimiento y muchas cosas por hacer, muy recomendado!! Es costoso pero el alto precio se paga por todas las actividades que allí encuentras!
me  encantó, el Parque es  enorme y puedes caminar  todo  el dia  sorprendiendote  pienso que  al separarse  los visitantes rrecorren todos diversos sitios

Belle expérience avec la biodiversité. À voir papillons,oiseaux, dans un décor enchanteur.Decouverte de la culture Maya,très intéressante.Tres beau et grand site ,nous sommes allés 2 fois et nous n avons pas tout fait.Le spectacle  du soir est à ne pas manquer extraordinaire à tous points de vue

Una experiencia al que vale la pena dedicarle un dia entero! 
Aqui podras encontrar desde un paseo en trajinera, entrar al santuario de los monos, nadar, y cerrar con broche de oro con el show de la noche. 

Recomendable llevar dos mudas, una para mojar y otra para despues de las actividades de agua. Tennis por que se camina mucho y de preferencia zapatos de agua con suela antiderrapante. Bloqueador biodegradable.

Cuando viajo reservo con Natural Trips (999)944.44.10 ellos cuentan con bloqueadores biodegradables.

Absolutely horrible service! All they want is money! I will never recommend this place to anyone. All
I wanted was my 4 year old to have fun and they completely ruined the whole experience. Do not come here.
Beautiful Beaches, Rivers, Great Food!!!! Excelente service

Heavenly! The night show was spectacular. I was there Some years ago.  Some recent reviews state that show had changed. I hope it stays rich in folklore and traditions, because that is what made it enchanting.

Excelente parque y sobre todo el show, solo que el número de xcaret carnaval no tiene nada que ver con lo demás, iba con un grupo de 10 amigos y a ninguno nos gustó, la gente que estaba alrededor también se mostraba sorprendida porque ese número en especial no es bonito, ademas que en el programa viene marcado dentro del estado de veracruz la canción la bamba y no la pusieron, la hubiera preferido mil veces más que el número de xcaret carnaval
É uma atração razoável. Tem algumas atividades interessantes, mas o melhor é o show no final do dia, contando a história do México.
It was entertaining, but touristy, once is enough. The meal was fine, the waiters were good. It was too much like a Disneyland show.
Kjempebra park. Vi brukte 2 dager her for å få med oss alt. Masse dyr, flotte restauranter og severdigheter. Vi svømte blant annet med delfiner som var kjempegøy.

un día que cambio mi vida primero la compañia, el destino y las actividades realizadas ese día no ha cambiado mucho desde la primera vez que fui hace 23 años 

gracias mi admiración por el show nocturno muy dinámico, buena producción, luces , audio, mecánica muy bien

Hermoso lugar todo muy bonito, algo caro pero deverdad que vale la pena mis hijos lo disfrutaron mucho, para mi un orgullo que ellos conoscan lo hermoso que es Mexico todo hermoso pero lo mejor es el night show Excaret espectacular😍se enchina asta la piel, mi hija que no es mexicana me dijo mami asta se me pone la piel chinita😍😍love it😍😍

without a doubt, the best park in the world. Very well worked and with a fantastic detail. Friendly and helpful staff. The best thing about the night show is spectacular. To come back again because with how big it is, it is impossible to do everything and see everything because every corner it has a surprise to you.

The big attraction here is the river swim. My daughter loved it. I chose to not go through the river but walked around the river area while I waited for her. Our guide Gina was wonderful. So patient, so kind. Just a lovely person! The Park is lush with greenery. We did not see any Puma but we did venture into the bat cave and were able to see a few bats flying around. The cemetery area is amazing and was my favorite part of the park. There are quite a few restaurants available and gift shops with unique items to purchase. We were not able to do the aviary or butterfly area because of time restriction but we did enjoy everything that we were able to see.
Ir a Cancún y no visitar Xcaret es no haber ido.  Un lugar hermoso, mágico lleno de aventura y cultura.  Lo mejor de Cancún.

Посетили парк 30.01.2018 и остались в восторге! Конечно, перечитали кучу комментариев, многие были неоднозначными и даже негативными. Итак, по порядку:
1)Организация парка-вам выдают карту на которой пронумерованы и обозначены в картинках все локации. На территории расположено много больших карт с указанием местоположения сейчас(все цветное, со стрелками, т.е. так что ЛЮБОМУ будет понятно), дорожки обозначены разными цветами, каждый объект пронумерован в соответствии с картой. Персонал всегда объясняет понятно (на английском) куда вам нужно идти, чтобы попасть в тот или иной пункт. Если на входе вам будут предлагать одну кабинку на двоих-не соглашайтесь! Они маленькие, берите две.
2)Не планировали, но все же посетили пункт первой помощи. Там круче, чем в некоторых больницах в россии😂🤦🏻‍♀️
3)Ресторанов много, большая часть на побережье, несколько в глубине парка. Все вкусно.
4)Много разных шоу, все очень зрелищно, а вечернее шоу настолько впечатлило, что нет слов. Оставайтесь на него обязательно! Гид сказал, что на вечернее гоу нужно зарезервировать стол за деньги, чтобы спокойно сесть и все видеть-не ведитесь, это развод. Платные места находятся слишком низко и близко к сцене, все картинки с них не видно, пустая трата денег. 
5)Пока добираешься до какого-то места обязательно увидишь что-то красивое/необычное. Животных не очень много, но есть очень необычные(видели ламантинов). Птичник потрясающей красоты! Много попугаев сидят по всей территории парка. 
6)Есть смотровая площадка, в ней несколько укачивает. Вид с неё открывается красивый на бесконечные джунгли.
7)При сплаве по подводной реке ласты надевайте обязательно-дно очень каменистое. 

В общем-парк к посещению обязателен!

The park is way over hyped for what it actually is.  The underground river is great for an hour or so but the rest of the park just lacks.  The beach area is incredible but so is the entire Playa Del Carmen area so what makes it special.  The really cool attractions within the park you have to pay extra for like the dolphins and the boat and you are already $125+ into the park.  They advertise the puma and leopard area but it is one leopard and one puma and they were both so far away from where you are that you can barely see them.  The lockers are so far away from the "exhibits" that it feels like all you do is walk.  Please, take our word for it.  Don't spend you money here...it isn't worth it.  We ended up taking a taxi back to our hotel because the 4:20 bus couldn't come soon enough.

They have the best night show in mexico amazing time history unfolding in their show. This park is got lots to do river swimming also a animal park the flying men on a very tall pole spinning downwards. A great park it takes 1 whole day to visit or split it in 2 days
A rodeo, Vegas show and history lesson all in one!  There is a dinner option, we didn't know this at the time but no matter the show was A M A Z I N G!!
Buena experiencia, solo deben ampliar los lugares para toma de foto por escáner .... ...... .... Tiene presentación de 2 horas de danzas típicas

Lejos el parque mas lindo que he visitado!, todo muy bien programado, la actividad de los ríos subterráneos es increíble, de los delfines buena, la comida (comida internacional) exquisito todo! en general todo perfecto... y para finalizar el show Perfecto que te lleva a conocer cómo evolucionó la cultura para luego mostrar diferentes tradiciones de los estados de México. Todo maravilloso nos fuimos felices

Recomendo a todos. Até pensei em não ir por achar caro, mas valeu cada centavo.
